description:
These are the traits for characters' hair colors. It doesn't matter if this hair color is natural or a result of some conditions affecting hair color.

See the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples of each hair color in the database. Please always refer to this chart when in doubt.

Note 1: if a character's hair color is ambiguous and cannot be described with a single color, tagging the character with multiple color traits is allowed. (Example: [url=http://vndb.org/c10551]Crayanne[/url])

Note 2: if a character has several well distinguishable colors in his/her hair, please use the [url=http://vndb.org/i894]Multicolored[/url] trait along with the relevant color traits. (Example: [url=http://vndb.org/c10040]Aaron Vanich[/url])
This character has black hair.\n\nPlease see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
This character has blond hair.\n\nPlease see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
This character has brown hair.\n\nPlease see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
This character has blue hair.\n\nPlease see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
This character has pink hair.\n\nPlease see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
This character has purple hair.\n\nPlease see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
This character has red hair.\n\nPlease see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.
This character has white hair.\n\nPlease see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.

These are the traits for characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hair_style]hairstyles[/url]. It doesn't matter if this hair style is natural or a result of some conditions affecting hair style.
This character's hair has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_anime_and_manga]ahoge[/url].\n\nAn ahoge is a single strand of hair that sticks out of a character's head.

This character's hair has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_anime_and_manga]antenna[/url].\n\nAn antenna is a variation of ahoge, which is when there are two or more locks of hair sticking up as opposed to one.
This character has no hair.\n\nIt can be a result of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baldness]baldness[/url] and/or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Head_shaving]shaving the head[/url].

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bun_%28hairstyle%29]bun hairstyle[/url].\n\nA bun is a type of hairstyle, typically worn by women, where the hair is pulled back from the face, twisted or plaited, and wrapped in a circular coil around itself, typically on the back of the head or neck. They can either be secured with a hairpiece, a hairnet and bobby pins. They may be tightly gathered or slightly messier and more informal.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bun_%28hairstyle%29#Double_bun]double bun hairstyle[/url].\n\nA bun is a type of hairstyle, typically worn by women, where the hair is pulled back from the face, twisted or plaited, and wrapped in a circular coil around itself, typically on the back of the head or neck. They can either be secured with a hairpiece, a hairnet and bobby pins. They may be tightly gathered or slightly messier and more informal. A double bun is a variation of this hairstyle featuring two of these buns.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ponytail]ponytail hairstyle[/url].\n\nA ponytail is a hairstyle in which most or all of the hair on the head is pulled away from the face, gathered and secured at the back of the head with a hair tie, clip or similar device, and allowed to hang freely from that point.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bunches]bunches hairstyle[/url].\n\nBunches, also called angel wings and pigtails, are a hairstyle in which the hair is parted down the middle and gathered into two symmetrical bundles, like ponytails, secured near the scalp. In some English-speaking regions, this hairstyle is referred to as "pigtails," but in others, the term "pigtails" applies only if the hair is braided.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_cut]bob cut hairstyle[/url].\n\nA "bob cut" is a short haircut for men and women in which the hair is typically cut straight around the head at about jaw-length, often with a fringe (or "bangs") at the front.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hime_cut]hime cut hairstyle[/url].\n\nA hime cut is a hairstyle consisting of straight, cheek to chin length sidelocks and blunt bangs. With the rest of the hair longer than the shoulders and straightened.
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_hair]long hair[/url].\n\nLong hair is used when referring to hair longer than shoulder length.
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_hair]very long hair[/url].\n\nVery long hair is used when referring to hair at waist length or longer.
This character has wavy hair.\n\nWavy hair is used when referring to hair that have waves.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtained_hair]curtained hairstyle[/url].\n\nCurtained hair is the term given to the hairstyle featuring a long fringe divided in either a middle parting or a side parting. When used, it generally applies to males.
This character's hair is at medium length.\n\nMedium hair is used when referring to hair longer than short hair up to shoulder length.
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mullet_%28haircut%29]mullet hairstyle[/url].\n\nThe mullet is a hairstyle that is short at the front and sides, and long in the back.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pixie_cut]pixie cut hairstyle[/url].\n\nA pixie cut refers to a short woman's hairstyle generally short on the back and sides of the head and slightly longer on the top.
This character's hair is short.\n\nShort hair is used when referring to hair at short length overall.
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Straight_hair#Straight_hair]straight hair[/url].

This character's hairstlye has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kemonomimi]kemonomimi[/url], animal ears, shape.

Kemonomimi, literally meaning "animal ears", is based on the the concept of drawing animals as bishoujo or having bishoujo wear or have animal accessories (such as ears or tails). Catgirls are the most prolific in this category, although bunnygirls, foxgirls, and dog girls are also common.

Kemonomimi characters typically appear human except for added animal-like qualities.

This trait is intended for characters with hair styles that look like animal ears. And it should not be mixed with the other two kemonomimi traits:
Clothes > [url=http://vndb.org/i153]Kemonomimi Headband[/url] refers to characters wearing head accessories animal ears and
Body > [url=http://vndb.org/i677]Kemonomimi[/url] refers to humanoid characters with actual animal ears.
These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facial_Hair]facial hair[/url].

These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beard]beard[/url].\n\nA beard is the collection of hair that grows on the chin, cheeks and neck, but not the upper lip, of human beings
These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moustache]moustache[/url].\n\nA moustache is facial hair grown on the outer surface of the upper lip.
These are the traits about characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye]eyes[/url].
These are the traits for characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url].
These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clothing]clothing[/url] and [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personal_armour]armor[/url].
These are the traits for the things characters carry around with them most of the time, things that they can be identified with.

These are the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trait_theory]traits for characters' personality[/url].\n\nThese traits are planned to be the ones that are about how characters act, so even if the trait you thought about sounds closer to a role, put the it here if it is more about characters' mindsets.

These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Role]roles[/url] in the game's story.

They usually apply to characters' current vocation, or social state, but also apply to their previous ones if those are a part of the story.

Do not mix with the term "Role" for their character types such as protagonist, hero/heroine.

While these traits might sound a bit off as a characters role in a story if you think it alone, like "this characters role in this game isn't being an American", think them more along the lines of: "Alex plays the role of an American soldier in this story.". As long as a trait can fit to this structure it can be used as a role trait.
These are the traits for the actions characters engage in, usually by their own initiative.
These are the traits for the actions characters get subjected to by others and situations that they are being the subject of.

These are the traits related to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_sexual_activity]sexual activities[/url].\n\nThese traits are intended to be used on a single character for a sexual act, instead of both characters involved. The aim is to clarify the confusion of which one being the active and which one being the passive partner in such an acts. The child traits of this traits should be used on the active partner in a sexual act.

These are the traits for characters' apparent age. Listed age categories are designed based on the concepts from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erikson%27s_stages_of_psychosocial_development]Erikson's stages of psychosocial development[/url].\n\nNote that these traits only signify the physical appearance of characters, and they might not reflect actual age.
These are the traits for characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somatotype_and_constitutional_psychology]body type[/url] and height.
These are the traits for any distinctive visible markings on characters' bodies such as [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tattoo]tattoos[/url] and [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scar]scars[/url].
These are the traits about characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors]eye colors[/url].

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-dressing]cross-dresses[/url].\n\nCross-dressing is the wearing of clothing and other accoutrement commonly associated with a gender within a particular society that is seen as different than the one usually presented by the dresser. Cross-dressing has been used for disguise, performance art and as a literary trope in modern times and throughout history.

This character displays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transgender]transgender[/url] behavior.

Transgender is the state of one's "gender identity" (self-identification as woman, man, neither or both) not matching one's "assigned sex" (identification by others as male, female or intersex based on physical/genetic sex).

"Transgender" does not imply any specific form of sexual orientation; transgender people may identify as heterosexual, homosexual, bisexual, pansexual, polysexual, or asexual; some may consider conventional sexual orientation labels inadequate or inapplicable to them.

This trait refers to characters acting outside the social norms of their physical gender. It does not necessarily cover looking, dressing like or claiming to be of that gender.
This character has green hair.\n\nPlease see the [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/126533.jpg]VNDB Hair Color Chart[/url] for examples when in doubt.

This character is a boy who looks like, or is usually mistaken, for a girl.

Dressing and acting like a girl is optional.

"Trap" does not imply any specific form of sexual orientation but only the physical appearance.

This trait is to be used for works that explicitly frame a male character as female in order to "trap" the player. For gender ambiguous body types use [url=/i1519]Androgynous[/url] instead. For characters whose self-described gender identity does not match their sex, use [url=/i49]Transgender[/url].

Do not apply the trait to transsexual characters, nor to the characters with a [url=/i3102]Newhalf[/url] body type, as these are separate fetishes. A possible exception could be allowed, if the character starts as a Trap and later transitions during the course of the story.

This character is a girl who looks like, and is usually mistaken, for a boy.

Dressing and acting like a boy is optional.

"Trap" does not imply any specific form of sexual orientation but only the physical appearance.

This trait is to be used for works that explicitly frame a female character as male in order to "trap" the player. For gender ambiguous body types use [url=/i1519]Androgynous[/url] instead. For characters whose self-described gender identity does not match their sex, use [url=/i49]Transgender[/url].

Do not apply the trait to transsexual characters, as it is a separate fetish. A possible exception could be allowed, if the character starts as a Reverse-trap and later transitions during the course of the story.
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Brown]brown eyes[/url].

This character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url] of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/teen]teen[/url] of ages 13 to 19.\n\nNote that this trait only signifies the physical appearance of this character, and it may not reflect actual age.
This character has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ectomorphic]ectomorphic[/url] body type characterized by long and thin muscles/limbs and low fat storage; usually referred to as slim.
These are the important features about characters' bodies.

This character has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_height]average physical stature[/url].\n\nAs a guideline, we decided to list characters between the heights of 1.45m and 1.80m as average.

These are the traits for characters' apparent [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skin_color#Skin_tone_variability]skin tones[/url].\n\nNote that these traits only signify the physical appearance of characters, and they do not reflect race or ethnicity.
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Light_skin#Light_skin]light skin tone[/url].
These are the traits for the characters' clothing worn over others, or ones that cover their entire body or worn as a set. Like a robe or uniform.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform]uniform[/url].\n\nA uniform is a set of standard clothing worn by members of an organization while participating in that organization's activity.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/School_uniform]school uniform[/url].\n\nA school uniform is an outfit—a set of standardized clothes—worn primarily for an educational institution.
These are the traits for all kinds of clothing and accessories worn on the upper part of the body including arms, hands and neck.
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweater]sweater[/url].\n\nA sweater is a garment intended to cover the torso and arms.
These are the traits for all kinds of clothing and accessories worn on the lower part of the body, such as skirts and socks.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trousers]trousers[/url].\n\nTrousers are an item of clothing worn on the lower part of the body from the waist to the ankles, covering both legs separately.

This character is wearing [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shoes]shoes[/url].\n\nA shoe is an item of footwear intended to protect and comfort the human foot while doing various activities. Shoes are also used as an item of decoration.
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dress_shoe]dress shoes[/url].\n\nA dress shoe is a shoe to be worn at smart casual or more formal events.

These are the traits for [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personal_weapon]personal weapons[/url] that characters are seen with during the story.\n\nA personal weapon is a weapon that can be carried and employed by a single person, although its use may be restricted to specialist members of attack or defense teams.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dao_%28sword%29]dao[/url].

Dao is actually a generic word used to denote any member of a family of single-edged, broad-bladed cutting or slicing tools, but in common, everyday usage means knife.

Dao blades are moderately curved and single-edged, though often with few inches of the back edge sharpened as well; the moderate curve allows them to be reasonably effective in the thrust. Hilts are canted, curving in the opposite direction as the blade which improves handling in some forms of cuts and thrusts.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dadao]dadao[/url].\n\nBased on agricultural knives, dadao have broad blades generally between two and three feet long, long hilts meant for "hand and a half" or two-handed use, and generally a weight-forward balance.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinai]shinai[/url].

Shinai is a weapon used for practice and competition in kendo representing a Japanese sword.

The shinai comprises four slats known as take, usually made from dried bamboo, which are held together by three leather fittings: a hilt, or handle fitting; a fitting at the tip and a leather strip that binds the four slats. The parts are all secured with a string.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sword]sword[/url].\n\nA sword is a long, edged piece of forged metal, used in many civilizations throughout the world, primarily as a cutting or thrusting weapon and occasionally as a clubbing or bludgeoning weapon.

The opposite of [url=http://vndb.org/i216]Hetare[/url].

You can rely on this type of characters to do what needs to be done. They aren't afraid to make decisions. They take the initiative and solve the problem, usually by themselves. Once they have a goal in mind, they'll approach it with prudence and tact.

They usually have talent/ability or connections that they know how to make best use of.

Check [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proactivity_%28Proactive_behavior%29]proactivity[/url] or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conscientiousness]conscientious[/url] for more details.

Should only be used when the character acted like this for the majority of the game.

This character is blind against all romantic feelings and actions of people nearby.\n\nDonkan characters can't read the atmosphere at all. Some donkans may be smart like a genius but they still can't understand the romantic feelings of anyone until a clear confession is made. Even than they need to ask for a confirmation and think about it for a while.
This character is a hardworking person.\n\nHardworker refers to a person that spends a lot of effort to succeed at the assigned tasks and achieve his/her goals.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Master_%28form_of_address%29]master[/url].\n\nA master is an employer of workers or servants, usually of a large estate or household.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student]student[/url].

A student is a learner, or someone who attends an educational institution.

This trait is intended to be used for students that are not a member of the child traits such as high school student or university student. If a character is a member of those please use the appropriate trait instead.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magician_%28fantasy%29]magician[/url].

A magician is someone who uses or practices magic that derives from supernatural or occult sources.

This trait signifies a character capable of casting magic spells, it does not necessarily mean that the character actually does so during the story.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warrior]warrior[/url].

A warrior is a person experienced in or capable of engaging in combat or warfare.

This trait is intended to cover all characters that had some self-defense and weapons training, it does not mean that all of these people are war veterans.

This character plays [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football]football[/url].

Soccer is a sport played between two teams of eleven players with a spherical ball. The game is played on a rectangular field of grass or green artificial turf, with a goal in the middle of each of the short ends. The object of the game is to score by driving the ball into the opposing goal.

In general play, the goalkeepers are the only players allowed to touch the ball with their hands or arms, while the field players typically use their feet to kick the ball into position, occasionally using their torso or head to intercept a ball in midair. The team that scores the most goals by the end of the match wins.

This character is a practitioner of  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swordsmanship]swordsmanship[/url].\n\nSwordsmanship refers to the skills of a swordsman, a person versed in the art of the sword. The term is modern, and as such was mainly used to refer to smallsword fencing, but by extension it can also be applied to any martial art involving the use of a sword.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hero]hero[/url].

Hero refer to characters who, in the face of danger and adversity or from a position of weakness, display courage and the will for self sacrifice—that is, heroism—for some greater good of all humanity. This definition originally referred to martial courage or excellence but extended to more general moral excellence.

This trait is for characters moral quality and should not be mixed with their roles in games such as a protagonist or hero/heroine of a VN.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Villain]villain[/url].

A villain is an "evil" character in a story, whether a historical narrative or, especially, a work of fiction. The villain usually is the antagonist, the character who tends to have a negative effect on other characters.

A character may start as a villain or hero and later switch to the other side, this trait should be used in either case.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orphan]orphan[/url].\n\nAn orphan is a child permanently bereaved of his or her parents. In common usage, only a child who has lost both parents is called an orphan. However, adults can also be referred to as orphans, or "adult orphans".

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cooking]cooks[/url].

Cooking is the process of preparing food with heat. 

This trait should be used for characters with cooking related scenes, and not just because they are professional cooks.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Combat]combat[/url].\n\nThe term combat (French for fight) typically refers to armed conflict between military forces in warfare, whereas the more general term "fighting" can refer to any violent conflict. Combat violence can be unilateral, whereas fighting implies at least a defensive reaction.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fedora]fedora[/url].\n\nA fedora is a men's felt hat that is creased lengthwise down the crown and pinched in the front on both sides. The creasing does not define the hat, however. Fedoras can also be creased with teardrop crowns, diamond crowns, center dents, and others, and the positioning of pinches can vary if they are found at all.

This character becomes a victim of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disaster]disaster[/url].\n\nA disaster is a natural or man-made hazard that has come to fruition, resulting in an event of substantial extent causing significant physical damage or destruction, loss of life, or drastic change to the environment. A disaster can be ostensively defined as any tragic event with great loss stemming from events such as earthquakes, floods, catastrophic accidents, fires, or explosions.

This character gets [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assault]assaulted[/url].

Assault is a crime of violence against another person. The specific meaning of assault varies between countries, but can refer to an act that causes another to apprehend immediate and personal violence, or in the more limited sense of a threat of violence caused by an immediate show of force.

Assault is often defined to include not only violence, but any intentional physical contact with another person without their consent.

This trait is intended to be used in situations that the victim can't or doesn't fight back, at least on an equal level to make the situation more of a fight then an attack. In the other case, please use the Fighting trait.

This character suffers from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amnesia]amnesia[/url].

Amnesia is a condition in which memory is disturbed or lost.

The causes of amnesia have traditionally been divided into categories. Functional causes are psychological factors, such as mental disorder, post-traumatic stress or, in psychoanalytic terms, defense mechanisms.

These are the traits about [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_positions]sex positions[/url]. These traits are for the penetrated partner(s). Traits for the penetrating partner(s) are under [url=/i1649]i1649[/url].

Sex positions are positions which people may adopt during or for the purpose of sexual intercourse or other sexual activities.

These traits may be applied not only to characters using these positions for vaginal sex, but also to characters using them for anal sex, pegging, tribadism (between lesbians), frot (between gays), or sex with a double ended dildo. Even though neither partner is penetrated in tribadism or frot, and both partners are penetrated in sex with a double ended dildo, use the matching traits under [url=/i43]Engages in (Sexual)[/url] > [url=/i1649]Sex Positions[/url] and [url=/i1625]Subject of (Sexual)[/url] > [url=/i92]Sex Positions[/url] to indicate which character was in which position.

This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_positions#Penetrating_partner_on_top_with_front_entry]missionary[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1694]i1694[/url] to the penetrating partner.

In this position, the receiving partner lies on their back with their legs apart, while the penetrating partner lies, (or supports themselves) on top.

This is similar to some of the [url=https://vndb.org/i1700]butterfly[/url] positions except the penetrating partner's torso is closer to horizontal instead of vertical.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/71/84171.jpg]Example[/url]

This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_positions#Penetrating_from_behind]doggy[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1692]i1692[/url] to the penetrating partner.

In this position, the receiving partner crouches on all fours (ie, on their hands and knees), while the penetrating partner kneels behind them. Alternatively, the receiving partner may angle their torso downwards and use their elbows, shoulders or chest for support instead of their hands. The penetrating partner may also hold one of the receiver's legs up.

In another variant (the [url=/i1327]Quickie Fix[/url] position), the receiving partner stands on their feet in a bent-over position, while the penetrating partner stands behind them.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/66/84166.jpg]Example 1[/url] - Receiving partner on all-fours
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/67/84167.jpg]Example 2[/url] - Receiving partner angled downwards

trait_alias:
Woman on Top
Cowboy Position
Jackhammer
Receiving partner on Top
Horse Riding Position
Horse Mounting Position
騎乗位
description:
This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woman_on_top#Cowgirl_position]cowgirl[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1689]i1689[/url] to the penetrating partner.

In this position, the penetrating partner lies on their back, while the receiving partner straddles them, typically in a kneeling or squatting position, with their torso mostly upright. The participants face each other.

Use the [url=/i1069]reverse cowgirl[/url] trait if the receiving partner faces away.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/87/14787.jpg]Example 1[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/32/84132.jpg]Example 2[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/33/84133.jpg]Example 3[/url] - Kneeling
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/34/84134.jpg]Example 4[/url] - Squatting
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/86/51786.jpg]Example 5[/url] - Neither kneeling or squatting

trait_alias:
Stand and carry
stand & carry
dancer position
slow dancing position
description:
This character has sex in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_positions#Standing]standing[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1698]i1698[/url] to the penetrating partner.

There are several different positions that may be considered "standing", but they all involve at least one participant standing on their feet, and both participants with their torso upright. The receiving partner may be penetrated from in front, or behind. In one variant, both participants stand upright, possibly leaning on a wall for support. In another variant, the penetrating partner carries the receiving partner.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/79/53779.jpg]Example 1[/url] - Both participants standing, one leaning on a glass wall. Similar to [url=/i1327]quickie fix[/url] except the receiving partner is more upright.
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/09/84309.jpg]Example 2[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/11/84311.jpg]Example 3[/url] - Receiving partner carried by penetrating partner, participants facing each other.
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/10/84310.jpg]Example 4[/url] - Receiving partner carried by penetrating partner, participants facing away from each other.

This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spoons_sex_position]spoons[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1697]i1697[/url] to the penetrating partner.

In this position, the receiving partner lies on their side, while the penetrating partner also lies on their side, behind the receiving partner, facing the same direction. The participants may or may not press their upper bodies together.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/20/85320.jpg]Example[/url]

These are the traits about [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oral_sex]oral sex[/url]. These traits are for the performing partner(s). Traits for the receiving partner(s) are under [url=/i1634]i1634[/url].\n\nOral sex may or may not be penetrative, and is the term given to genital stimulation by the mouth. People may engage in oral sex as part of foreplay before intercourse, or as, during or following intercourse. It may also be performed for its own sake, and can be performed simultaneously.

This character performs [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fellatio]fellatio[/url]. Apply [url=/i1637]i1637[/url] to the receiving character.\n\nFellatio is the act of using the mouth, lips, and tongue to stimulate the penis. [url=/i101]Cunnilingus[/url] may be considered the equivalent trait for a female receiver.

This character performs [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cunnilingus]cunnilingus[/url]. Apply [url=/i1636]i1636[/url] to the receiving character.\n\nCunnilingus is the act of using the mouth, lips and tongue to stimulate the female genitals. [url=/i100]Blowjob[/url] may be considered the equivalent trait for a male receiver.

trait_alias:
69
Congress of the Crow
Mutual Oral Sex
Reciprocal Oral Sex
description:
This character engages in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/69_%28sex_position%29]sixty-nine[/url] position.

In the sixty-nine position, two people position themselves so that each person's mouth is near the other's genitals, and simultaneously perform oral sex.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/04/7004.jpg][Example][/url]

This character performs [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anilingus]anilingus[/url]. Apply [url=/i1635]i1635[/url] to the receiving character.\n\nAnilingus is a form of oral sex involving contact between the anus or perineum of one person and the mouth of another.

This character has a sex scene where they lose their virginity.

The usual bleeding need not be shown, but then it must be mentioned in the game (or in a trusted source like the game's website) that this was the first time this character had sex.

This trait can be used for both male and female characters. Do not use it on characters that have sex with a virgin, but are not virgins themselves.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Group_sex]group sex[/url].

Group sex is sexual behavior involving more than two participants. Group sex can occur amongst people of all sexual orientations and genders.

The following traits are for the active or performing participant(s). Traits for the passive or receiving participant(s) are under [url=/i1625]Subject of (Sexual)[/url]>[url=/i1687]Group Sex[/url]. Traits under [url=/i2965]Group Sex Participants[/url] are an exception from this rule, as they don't have counterparts.
This character has a sex scene with someone other than the protagonist.\n\nDon't use this trait for group sex scenes that the protagonist is also a part of.

This character is hotblooded.

Hotblooded characters feel extremely passionate about something, for example justice, love or protecting someone. This passion is to such a degree that nothing can stop the hotblooded character from reaching it, not the laws of physics nor death.

They usually appear in stories in the form of heroes or villains that refuse to stop or die no matter what, unless their will is broken.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Amber]amber eyes[/url].\n\nAmber eyes are of a solid color and have a strong yellowish/golden and russet/coppery tint. It is a very rare eye color and also known as ‘wolf eyes’, since amber eye color is very common in wolves.

This character has black eye color.\n\nBlack is amongst the rarest eye colors in the world. Most of the people who appear to have black eyes have, infact, extremely dark brown eyes that seem to be black.
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Blue]blue eyes[/url].
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Gray]gray eyes[/url].
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Green]green eyes[/url].

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Hazel]hazel eyes[/url].\n\nHazel eyes often appear to shift in color from a light brown to a golden-green. Hazel mostly consists of brown and green. The dominant color in the eye can either be green or light brown/gold. This is how many people mistake hazel eyes to be amber and vice versa. This can sometimes produce a multicolored iris, i.e., an eye that is light brown/amber near the pupil and charcoal or dark green on the outer part of the iris (and vice versa) when observed in sunlight.
This character has purple eye color.\n\nIt is not a natural eye color in the real world.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_colors#Red]red eyes[/url].\n\nRed is probably the rarest eye color amongst the human population of the world. It is mainly seen in case of albinos and is the result of either large quantities of the "normally scarce" red areas in the eyes or a small leakage of blood into the iris.
This characters' eyes are hidden, their color or other properties are unknown.
This character has white eye color.\n\nIt can be either of pure white with no iris, or colored pupils with white iris.

This character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url] of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child]child[/url] of age 12 or lower.\n\nNote that this trait only signifies the physical appearance of this character, and it may not reflect actual age.

This character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url] of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/young-adult]young-adult[/url] of ages 20 to 39.\n\nNote that this trait only signifies the physical appearance of this character, and it may not reflect actual age.

This character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url] of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/adult]adult[/url] of ages 40 to 65.\n\nNote that this trait only signifies the physical appearance of this character, and it may not reflect actual age.

This character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_physical_appearance]physical appearance[/url] of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_age]old person[/url] of ages 66 and higher.\n\nNote that this trait only signifies the physical appearance of this character, and it may not reflect actual age.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesomorphic]mesomorphic[/url] body type characterized by medium bones, solid torso, low fat levels, wide shoulders with a narrow waist; usually referred to as muscular.

This character has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somatotype]endomorphic[/url] body type characterized by increased fat storage, a wide waist and a large bone structure, usually referred to as fat.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigantism]giant[/url] compared to regular humans.\n\nOnly use for characters that are beyond being overweight and/or tall by a significant amount.
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_height]short physical stature[/url].\n\nAs a guideline, we decided to list characters with a height of 1.45m and below as short.
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_height]long physical stature[/url].\n\nAs a guideline, we decided to list characters with a height of 1.80m and higher as tall.

This character has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olive_skin]olive skin tone[/url].\n\nThis is used to describe a character with a naturally tan-colored skin tone, darker than the typical anime character but not quite brown.
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_skin#Dark_skin]dark skin tone[/url].
This character has a skin color and/or tone that is not found on humans normally.

This character has a visible [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tattoo]tattoo[/url].\n\nA tattoo is a marking made by inserting indelible ink into the dermis layer of the skin to change the pigment for decorative or other reasons. Tattoos on humans are a type of decorative body modification, while tattoos on animals are most commonly used for identification or branding.

This character has a visible [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scar]scar[/url].\n\nA scar results from the biologic process of wound repair in the skin and other tissues of the body. Thus, scarring is a natural part of the healing process. With the exception of very minor lesions, every wound (e.g. after accident, disease, or surgery) results in some degree of scarring. An exception to this is animals with regeneration, which do not form scars and the tissue will grow back exactly as before.
This character wears an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apron]apron[/url].\n\nAn apron is an outer protective garment that covers primarily the front of the body.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catsuit]catsuit[/url].

A catsuit is a close-fitting one-piece garment that covers the torso and the legs, and frequently the arms.

Catsuits, which date from at least the 1940s, can be worn by both men and women, and, despite the name, do not generally have feline characteristics.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coat_%28clothing%29]coat[/url].\n\nA coat is a long garment worn by both men and women, for warmth or fashion. Coats typically have long sleeves and open down the front, closing by means of buttons, zippers, hook-and-loop fasteners, toggles, a belt, or a combination of these. Other possible ornaments include collars and shoulder straps.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raincoat]rain coat[/url].\n\nA raincoat is a waterproof or water-resistant coat worn to protect the body from rain. The term rain jacket is sometimes used to refer to raincoats that are waist length. A rain jacket may be combined with a pair of rain pants to make a rain suit.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trenchcoat]trench coat[/url].\n\nA trench coat or trenchcoat is a raincoat made of waterproof heavy-duty cotton drill or poplin, wool gabardine, or leather. It generally has a removable insulated lining; and it is usually knee-length.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dress]dress[/url].\n\nA dress is a garment consisting of a skirt with an attached bodice (or a matching bodice giving the effect of a one-piece garment).
This character wears a mini-dress.\n\nA mini-dress is a very short dress, at least 10 cm above the knee.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robe]robe[/url].\nA robe is a loose-fitting outer garment. A robe is distinguished from a cape or cloak by the fact that it usually has sleeves.

trait_alias:
Dougi
Traditional Japanese Training Uniform
Kendo Uniform
Judo Uniform
description: This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keikogi]keikogi[/url].\n\nKeikogi is a uniform for training, used in martial arts derived from Japan, or budou. The top part of the keikogi is called the uwagi. The pants of the keikogi are called zubon, which is the Japanese word for pants or trousers.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kimono]kimono[/url].\n\nKimonos are T-shaped, straight-lined robes worn so that the hem falls to the ankle, with attached collars and long, wide sleeves. Kimonos are wrapped around the body, always with the left side over the right (except when dressing the dead for burial), and secured by a sash called an obi, which is tied at the back. Kimonos are generally worn with traditional footwear (especially zouri or geta) and split-toe socks (tabi).

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pajamas]pajamas[/url].\n\nPajamas may refer to several garments, for both daywear and nightwear, derived from traditional pajamas and involving variations of style and material.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suit_%28clothing%29]suit[/url].\n\nIn clothing, a suit is a set of garments made from the same cloth, consisting of at least a jacket and trousers.

These are the traits for the characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headwear]headgear[/url].\n\nHeadgear, headwear or headdress is the name given to any element of clothing which is worn on one's head.

This character wears an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earring]earring[/url].\n\nEarrings are jewelry attached to the ear through a piercing in the earlobe or some other external part of the ear (except in the case of clip earrings, which clip onto the lobe).
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glasses]glasses[/url].\n\nGlasses are frames bearing lenses worn in front of the eyes, normally for vision correction or eye protection.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat]hat[/url].\n\nA hat is a head covering used for several reasons. It may be worn for protection against the elements, for ceremonial or religious reasons, for safety, or as a fashion accessory.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ushanka]ushanka[/url].\n\nAn ushanka is a Russian fur cap with ear flaps that can be tied up to the crown of the cap, or tied at the chin to protect the ears, jaw and lower chin from the cold. The thick dense fur also offers some protection against blunt impacts to the head.
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hood_%28headgear%29]hood[/url].\n\nA hood is a kind of headgear that covers most of the head and neck and sometimes the face.
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mask]mask[/url].\n\nA mask is an article normally worn on the face, typically for protection, disguise, performance or entertainment.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ribbon#Cloth_ribbon]ribbon[/url] on his/her hair.\n\nA ribbon or riband is a thin band of flexible material, typically cloth but also plastic or sometimes metal, used primarily for binding and tying. In this case, a cloth or plastic ribbon is used on hair either as a decoration or to tie the hair.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headband]headband[/url].\n\nA headband is a clothing accessory worn in the hair or around the forehead, usually to hold hair away from the face or eyes. Headbands generally consist of a loop of elastic material or a horseshoe-shaped piece of flexible plastic or metal.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headband]headband[/url] with animal ears.

A headband is a clothing accessory worn in the hair or around the forehead, usually to hold hair away from the face or eyes. Headbands generally consist of a loop of elastic material or a horseshoe-shaped piece of flexible plastic or metal.

Kemonomimi, literally meaning "animal ears", is based on the the concept of drawing animals as bishoujo or having bishoujo wear or have animal accessories (such as ears or tails). Catgirls are the most prolific in this category, although bunnygirls, foxgirls, and dog girls are also common.

Kemonomimi characters typically appear human except for added animal-like qualities.

This trait is intended for characters wearing head accessories animal ears. And it should not be mixed with the other two kemonomimi traits:
Hair > [url=http://vndb.org/i31]Kemonomimi[/url] refers to hair styles that look like animal ears and
Body > [url=http://vndb.org/i677]Kemonomimi[/url] refers to humanoid characters with actual animal ears.

This character acts [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/secretive]secretive[/url].

A secretive character is keeping an important secret, hiding something from the rest of the characters.

Based on the character he/she might not mind keeping it at all. But he/she might also be under great stress either due to worry that the secret will get out or might be battling the desire to tell it and be free.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacket]jacket[/url].\n\nA jacket is a type of sleeved hip- or waist-length garment for the upper body. Copared to a coat, a jacket is generally shorter, ending just below the waist, and often lighter.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scarf]scarf[/url].\n\nA scarf is a piece of fabric worn around the neck, or near the head or around the waist for warmth, cleanliness, fashion or for religious reasons.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Necktie]necktie[/url].\n\nThe necktie (or tie) is a long piece of cloth worn for decorative purposes around the neck or shoulders, resting under the shirt collar and knotted at the throat.
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Necklace]necklace[/url].\n\nA necklace is an article of jewellery which is worn around the neck.

This character wears a necklace with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_cross]christian cross[/url].\n\nThe Christian cross, seen as a representation of the instrument of the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, is the best-known religious symbol of Christianity. It is related to the crucifix (a cross that includes a usually three-dimensional representation of Jesus' body) and to the more general family of cross symbols.
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shirt]shirt[/url].\n\nA shirt is a garment with a collar, sleeves with cuffs and a full vertical opening with buttons.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cardigan_%28sweater%29]cardigan[/url].\n\nA cardigan is a type of machine- or hand-knitted sweater that ties, buttons or zips down the front; by contrast, a pullover does not open in front but must be "pulled over" the head to be worn.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T-shirt]t-shirt[/url].\n\nA T-shirt is a shirt which is pulled on over the head to cover most of a person's torso. A T-shirt is usually buttonless and collarless, with a round neck and short sleeves.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vest]vest[/url].\n\nA vest is a sleeveless upper-body garment worn over a dress shirt and necktie (if applicable) and below a coat as a part of most men's formal wear, and as the third piece of the three-piece male business suit.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wristband]wristband[/url].\n\nWristbands are encircling strips worn on the wrist, made of any of a variety of materials depending on the purpose. The term can be used to refer to the bracelet-like band of a wristwatch, to the cuff or other part of a sleeve that covers the wrist, or to decorative or functional bands worn on the wrist for other reasons, such as lanyards.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bracer]bracer[/url].\n\nA bracer (or arm-guard) is a strap or sheath, commonly made of leather, stone, or plastic that covers the inside of an archer's arm to protect it while shooting. Bracers keep the inside of the archer's forearm from getting hurt by the string of the bow or the fletching of the arrow; they also prevent loose clothing from catching the bow string.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloak]cloak[/url].\n\nA cloak is a type of loose garment that is worn over indoor clothing and serves the same purpose as an overcoat; it protects the wearer from the cold, rain or wind for example, or it may form part of a fashionable outfit or uniform.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arm_warmer]arm warmers[/url].\n\nArm warmers can describe any glove-like articles of clothing that lack finger coverings and/or were originally designed to keep wrists and lower arms warm.
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evening_glove]evening gloves[/url].\n\nLadies' evening gloves or opera gloves are a type of formal glove that reaches beyond the elbow.
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gloves]gloves[/url].\n\nA glove is a garment covering the hand.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gauntlet_%28glove%29]gauntlets[/url].\n\nGauntlet is a name for several different styles of glove, particularly those with an extended cuff covering part of the forearm.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hakama]hakama[/url].\n\nHakama are a type of traditional Japanese clothing. Hakama are tied at the waist and fall approximately to the ankles. There are two types of hakama, undivided andon bakama and umanori type with divided legs, both appear similar outside.
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skirt]skirt[/url].\n\nA skirt is a tube- or cone-shaped garment that hangs from the waist and covers all or part of the legs.
This character wears a half-skirt.\n\nA half-skirt is a kind of skirt that is missing a vertical half. So it can only cover one leg or just buttocks like the garments worn by middle age knights.
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miniskirt]miniskirt[/url].\n\nA miniskirt is a skirt with a hemline well above the knees – generally no longer than 10 cm below the buttocks.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeans]jeans[/url].\n\nJeans are trousers made from denim. Starting in the 1950s, jeans, originally designed for working people, became popular among teenagers. They come in many styles and colors; however, "blue jeans" are particularly identified with American culture, especially the American Old West.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shorts]shorts[/url].\n\nShorts are a bifurcated garment worn by both men and women over their pelvic area, circling the waist, and covering the upper part of the legs, sometimes extending down to or even below the knee, but not covering the entire length of the leg, either as outer or undergarment, which makes them comfortable and easy to wear. They are called "shorts" because they are a shortened version of trousers, which cover the entire leg.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gym_shorts]gym shorts[/url].\n\nGym shorts are an article of clothing typical worn by people when exercising. They are typically made out of fabrics that allow for maximum comfort and ease.

This character wears sport [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloomers_%28clothing%29#Bloomers_in_Japan]bloomers[/url].

Bloomers are a type of girl's gym shorts in Japan.

Please do NOT use this trait for the classic (as in mid-19th century to early 20th century) bloomers. Use the [url=http://vndb.org/i1263]Traditional Bloomers[/url] trait instead.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boot]boots[/url].\n\nA boot is a type of footwear. Most boots mainly cover the foot and the ankle and extend up the leg, sometimes as far as the knee or even the hip. Most boots have a heel that is clearly distinguishable from the rest of the sole, even if the two are made of one piece.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kinky_boots]thigh-high boots[/url].\n\nThigh-high Boots are boots with extreme characteristics which are intended to present a dramatic sexy appearance, such as by a prostitute or dominatrix. Extreme characteristics might include very high heels, thigh- or crotch-high length, or unusual colors or materials.

trait_alias:

Trainers
Sandshoes
Gym Boots
Joggers
Running Shoes
Runners
Gutties
Sneakers

Gym Shoes

Sneaks

Rubber Shoes

description: This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sports_shoes]sports shoes[/url].\n\nA sports shoe is a generic name for the footwear primarily designed for sports or other forms of physical exercise but in recent years has come to be used for casual everyday activities.
These are the traits for characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socks]socks[/url].\n\nA sock is an item of clothing worn on the feet.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knee_highs]knee-highs[/url].

Knee-highs are hosiery that covers the feet and legs almost up to the knee.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/43/79743.jpg]Example[/url]
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pantyhose]pantyhose[/url].\n\nPantyhose are sheer, close-fitting legwear, covering the body from the waist to the feet.

This rait groups the traits for socks (or stockings) that reach higher than the knee, but not higher than the waist. Please use the specific child traits instead if applicable.\n\nA [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stocking]stocking[/url] is a close-fitting, variously elastic garment covering the foot and part of the leg. In American and Australian English it is also a synonym for pantyhose.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thigh-high_stockings]thigh-highs[/url].

Hold-ups or stay-ups (in the USA also referred to as thigh-highs) are stockings with a band of elastic sewn to the top, designed to hold the stockings up when worn, without the need for a garter belt or garters.

If the stockings are held up with a garter belt, use [url=https://vndb.org/i607]Garter Belt[/url] instead of this trait.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personal_armour]armor[/url].\n\nPersonal armor is the whole of protecting clothing, designed to absorb and/or deflect slashing, bludgeoning, and penetrating attacks.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mail_%28armour%29]mail armor[/url].\n\nMail or chain mail is a type of armour consisting of small metal rings linked together in a pattern to form a mesh.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plate_armour]plate armor[/url].\n\nPlate armour, plate armor or plate mail is personal armour made from large metal plates, worn on the chest and sometimes the entire body.

trait_alias:
Bullet-resistant Vest
Ballistic Vest
Bulletproof Vest
Kevlar Body Armor
description: This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballistic_vest]bulletproof vest[/url].\n\nA bulletproof vest is an item of personal armor that helps absorb the impact from firearm-fired projectiles and shrapnel from explosions, and is worn on the torso.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_armor]power armor[/url].

A powered exoskeleton, also known as powered armour is a powered mobile machine consisting primarily of an exoskeleton-like framework worn by a person and a power supply that supplies at least part of the activation-energy for limb movement.

The types of armor that are more of a vehicle than a set of armored clothing like [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha]mecha[/url] are exluded from this trait.

This character's body is partially clothed.

Usually used to refer to characters not wearing any clothes above waistline, like a man only wearing jeans, but can also be used for the other way around.

This trait refers to characters walking around dressed in this sense, other than the times of changing clothes, undressing or having sex.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bandages]bandage[/url].\n\nA bandage is a piece of material used either to support a medical device such as a dressing or splint, or on its own to provide support to the body. Bandages are available in a wide range of types, from generic cloth strips, to specialised shaped bandages designed for a specific limb or part of the body, although bandages can often be improvised as the situation demands, using clothing, blankets or other material.
These are the traits for clothing with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious]religious[/url] signifiance.
These are the traits for clothing with a signifiance in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christianity]christianity[/url].

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clergy_shirt]clerical clothing[/url].\n\nCollarino is probably the most common type of shirt and collar among Roman Catholic clergy. It resembles a standard dress shirt, but has a standing black collar that is sewn to accommodate a white cloth or soft plastic insert, leaving a small white square at the base of the throat.
These are the clothing tags that don't come up with where they are worn but with other aspects.

This character has an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Axe]axe[/url].\n\nThe axe, or ax, is an implement that has been used for millennia to shape, split and cut wood; to harvest timber; as a weapon; and as a ceremonial or heraldic symbol. The axe has many forms and specialized uses but generally consists of an axe head with a handle, or helve.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bow_%28weapon%29]bow[/url].\n\nA bow is a weapon that projects arrows by its elasticity. Essentially, it is a form of spring. As the bow is drawn, energy is stored in the limbs of the bow and transformed into rapid motion when the string is released, with the string transferring this force to the arrow.
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chain_weapon]chain weapon[/url].\n\nA chain weapon is a weapon made of one or more heavy object attached to a chain, sometimes with a handle.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knife]knife[/url].\n\nA knife is any cutting edge or blade, hand-held or otherwise, with or without a handle. Use this trait for fixed blade knives.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pocket_knife]pocket knife[/url].\n\nA pocketknife is a folding knife with one or more blades that fit inside the handle that can still fit in a pocket. A larger folding knife or pocket knife is also known as a jackknife or jack-knife. Blades can range from 1 cm to as much as 30 cm in length, but a more typical blade length is 5 to 15 cm.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Throwing_knife]throwing knife[/url].\n\nThrowing knives are knives that are specially designed and weighted so that they can be thrown effectively. They are commonly made of a single piece of steel or other material, without handles, unlike other types of knives. The knife has two sections, the "blade" which is the sharpened half of the knife and the "grip" which is not sharpened. The purpose of the grip is to allow the knife to be safely handled by the user and also to balance the weight of the blade.

This character carries a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dagger]dagger[/url].\n\nA dagger is a double-edged blade used for hitting, stabbing or thrusting. They often fulfill the role of a secondary defense weapon in close combat.
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spear]spear[/url].\n\nA spear is a pole weapon consisting of a shaft, usually of wood, with a pointed head.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lance]lance[/url].\n\nA lance is a pole weapon or spear designed to be used by a mounted warrior. The lance is longer, stouter and heavier than an infantry spear, and unsuited for throwing, or for the rapid thrusting.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katana]katana[/url].\n\nThe katana is characterized by its distinctive appearance: a curved, slender, single edged blade with a length of greater than 60 cm, circular or squared guard, and long grip to accommodate two hands. It has historically been associated with the samurai of feudal Japan, and has become renowned for its sharpness and cutting ability.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No-dachi]no-dachi[/url].\n\nA nodachi is a large two-handed Japanese sword carried by foot soldiers and was designed as a weapon for war versus cavalry and open field engagements. The length of the nodachi's hilt varied between 30 to 33 centimeters. The blade was usually around 122 centimeters long. Its cutting capability and range exceeded that of a katana, due to its weight and size.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_sword]longsword[/url].\n\nThe longsword is a type of European sword used during the late medieval period, approximately 1350 to 1550. Longswords have long cruciform hilts with grips over 10 to 15 cm length (providing room for two hands). Straight double-edged blades are often over 1 m to 1.2 m length, and weigh typically between 1.2 and 2.4 kg, with light specimens just below 1 kg, and heavy specimens just above 2 kg.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walking-stick]walking stick[/url].

A walking stick is a device used by many people to facilitate balancing while walking. Some kinds of walking stick may be used by people with disabilities as a crutch.

The walking stick has also historically been known to be used as a defensive or offensive weapon, and may conceal a knife or sword as in a swordstick.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firearms]firearm[/url].\n\nA firearm is a weapon which projects either single or multiple projectiles at high velocity through rapid, confined burning of a propellant.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handgun]handgun[/url].\n\nA handgun is a firearm designed to be held and operated by one hand. This characteristic differentiates handguns as a general class of firearms from long guns such as rifles and shotguns (which are mounted against the shoulder).

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rifle]rifle[/url].\n\nA rifle is a firearm designed to be fired from the shoulder, with a barrel that has a helical groove or pattern of grooves ("rifling") cut into the barrel walls.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shotgun]shotgun[/url].\n\nA shotgun is a firearm that is usually designed to be fired from the shoulder, which uses the energy of a fixed shell to fire a number of small spherical pellets called shot, or a solid projectile called a slug.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Submachine_gun]submachine gun[/url].\n\nA submachine gun is an automatic carbine, designed to fire pistol cartridges. It combines the automatic fire of a machine gun with the cartridge of a pistol. An assault rifle, in contrast, uses an intermediate-power cartridge with more power than a pistol but less than a standard rifle or battle rifle.

This character is Hetare which is the opposite of [url=/i74]Proactive[/url].

This character is a worthless, spineless, undependable, lazy, inept and no help to anyone and most of the time unable to make any decisions in time.

This character is always being pushed around by every other characters in the game at the very start and they are still like that in the final moments of the game. They make other characters help them everytime before facing their own problems.

Please don't use this trait on games that have this character starting this way but also has him fixing his ways in the first hours of the game. Thus making it somewhat bearable by some quick reading.
While this description says man, this trait can also be applied to worthless, spineless, good for nothing female characters.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsundere]tsundere[/url].\n\nTsundere is a Japanese character development process which describes a person who is initially cold and even hostile towards another person before gradually showing their warm side over time.

This character is a modern [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsundere]tsundere[/url] with two personalities, hostile and lovestruck.\n\nA variation of the tsundere personality type which has the tsundere character switch between hostile and lovestruck personalities often, which is in contrast to the classic tsundere type where the change is gradual and permanent.

This character is a mayadere, a deadly dangerous tsundere.\n\nA mayadere usually starts as an antagonist trying to kill the someone but switches sides after falling in love. This character is unpredictable and dangerous for everyone including the romantic interest.

This character is a coodere, starts uninterested but turns lovestruck later.\n\nA coodere starts cold, distant, uninterested and doesn't pay any attention to  potential love interests, but eventually turns lovestruck. Unlike the classic type, a coodere doesn't get hostile with the other characters, but just ignores them.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandere#Y]yandere[/url].

Yandere is a Japanese term for a person who is initially very loving and gentle to someone before their devotion becomes destructive in nature, often through violence. Yandere characters are mentally unstable, often using extreme violence as an outlet for their emotions.

Unlike Yangire characters, yandere characters' actions are motivated by love.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yandere#Y]yangire[/url].

Yangire is used to describe a character who is mentally ill and snaps instantly without showing affection for the victim of their outbursts.

Just like yandere characters, yangire characters star very loving and gentle, and suddenly turn out violent, but the difference is that yangire characters' actions are not related to romantic feelings.
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otaku]otaku[/url].\n\nOtaku is a Japanese term used to refer to people with obsessive interests, particularly anime, manga, or video games.

This character is a deredere, lovestruck from the begining of the story.\n\nDeredere characters are deeply in love with someone from the begining or early parts of the story and this is the centerpoint of all of their actions.
These are the traits about notable talking patterns that make this character stand out.
These characters use "boku", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronoun]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.
These characters use "ore", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronoun]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.

This character sometimes acts like a  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foolishness]fool[/url].\n\nFoolishness is the lack of wisdom. In this sense it differs from stupidity, which is the lack of intelligence.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laziness]lazy[/url] person.\n\nLaziness (also called indolence) is a disinclination to activity or exertion despite having the ability to do so.

This character sometimes acts like an  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idiot]idiot[/url].\n\nAn idiot is a mentally deficient person, or someone who acts in a self-defeating or significantly counterproductive way.
This character's mind is usually occupied by sexual thoughts.\n\nPerverted characters think about sex all the time and they would do anything to get close to things that they consider erotic.

This character can't make a decision between romantic interests.\n\nRomantically indecisive characters are unsure about whom they love more and are afraid to hurt the one that would get left behind. While trying to not to hurt anyone, they cause immense grief to any parties involved.

This character knows a lot about the situation, just not personally.\n \nGenre savvy characters may be unfamiliar with their current situation, never experienced it before, but they certainly did read a story, saw a movie or played a game about "just the same thing". They would try to use these "experiences" to their advantage at every opportunity.

This character doesn't display any kinds of emotions outside.

Stoic characters act like they don't have feelings, except in very rare moments, when they talk or act no emotional expressions appear on their faces nor can be noticed from their movements.

This doesn't mean these characters don't feel anything, but that they don't show any outside. They can have psychological problems resulting in this behavior or may have an another reason to act this way.

This character is or seems [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ignorance]ignorant[/url] and lacking [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_sense]common sense[/url].

Ignorant characters are unaware of most things that are considered common knowledge by regular people. It is not because they are incapable of learning, but usually because they just never got the chance to learn or didn't try.

They don't understand the things that are considered obvious by most people because their thought process is different doesn't usually end with the same results with others.

Their actions might seem stupid, meaningless and outright wrong, but that doesn't mean that they are stupid, cruel or evil, they are usually just different.

An ignorant character may be from a distant place or time or maybe he/she just got out of prison, or returned from a prolonged conflict.

An ignorant character is different from an uneducated one since it is not about education. Though a character may carry both of the traits.

This character had little to no [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Education]education[/url].

Uneducated characters never had much experience with schools or private tutors and they don't have any knowledge of any of the subjects thought in one, like mathematics, science and history. At worst case an uneducated character may not even know how to read or write.

An uneducated character is different from an ignorrant one since it is not about common knowledge. Though a character may carry both of the traits.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hunter]hunter[/url].

Hunting is the practice of pursuing any living thing (usually wildlife) for food, recreation, or trade. In present-day use, the term refers to lawful hunting, as distinguished from poaching, which is the killing, trapping or capture of the hunted species contrary to applicable law. The species which are hunted are referred to as game and are usually mammals and migratory or non-migratory gamebirds.

Fictional hunters on the other hand are known to hunt anything from animals to humans to monsters...

This character is faking his or her personality.

Pretending characters hide their true personality and act like someone else. They may be acting this way because of social pressure or out of a hidden agenda.

This trait is intended for characters that are pretending all or most of their personality, do not use it for ones that pretend one or two things in a game.

This character suffers from [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypersexuality]hypersexuality or nymphomania[/url].\n\nHypersexuality, or excessive sexual drive, are medical terms for a desire to engage in sexual activities at a level that is considered abnormally high in relation to normal development or culture and at a level that causes distress or serious problems for the person affected or to persons associated with them.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spoiled]spoiled like a child[/url].\n\nSpoiled characters exhibit behavioral problems as a result of overindulgence by parents or similar figures. They usually believe that they are more important than everybody else and they are supposed to get everything they want, when they want.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Selfish]selfish[/url].\n\nSelfishness denotes an excessive or exclusive concern with oneself; and as such it exceeds mere self interest or self concern. In that it necessarily connotes a disregard for others, it is beyond the act of placing one's own needs or desires above the needs or desires of others (self interest).

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Narcissism_%28psychology%29]narcissist[/url].

Narciccist characters have an inordinate fascination with themselves, excessive self-love and vanity.

Narcissism is the personality trait of egotism, vanity, conceit, or simple selfishness. Applied to a social group, it is sometimes used to denote elitism or an indifference to the plight of others.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grandiosity]grandiosit[/url].\n\nAn extreme case of narcissism. Grandiosit characters have an unrealistic sense of superiority, a sustained view of oneself as better than others that causes the narcissist to view others with disdain or as inferior. It also refers to a sense of uniqueness, the belief that few others have in common with oneself and that one can only be understood by a few or very special people.

This character acts in a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/cynical]cynical[/url] way, showing contempt for accepted standards of honesty or morality by one's actions, especially by actions that exploit the scruples of others. It has little to no relation to Greek philosophy [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cynicism]cynicism[/url].\n\nA cynical person believes that only selfishness motivates human actions and disbelieves in or minimizes selfless acts or disinterested points of view.

This character has a carefree attitude.\n\nCarefree characters act without [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anxiety]anxiety[/url] or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Worry]worry[/url] similar to relaxed characters. But it is mostly because they don't take anything too seriously or because they don't care about the results at all. They are known to be able to to crack a joke or two even in worst situations.

These are the role traits associated with characters'  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interpersonal_relationship]interpersonal relationships[/url].\n\nAn interpersonal relationship is an association between two or more people that may range from fleeting to enduring. This association may be based on limerence, love, solidarity, regular business interactions, or some other type of social commitment. Interpersonal relationships are formed in the context of social, cultural and other influences.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extroversion]extrovert[/url].\n\nOutgoing characters tend to be fond of the company of others, assertive, and interested in seeking out excitement.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Introversion]introvert[/url].\n\nIntrovert characters tend to be more reserved, less outgoing, and less sociable. They are not necessarily loners but they tend to be satisfied with having fewer friends. Introversion does not describe social discomfort but rather social preference: an introvert may not be shy but may merely prefer less social activities.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shyness]shy[/url].\n\nShyness is a social psychology term used to describe the feeling of apprehension, lack of comfort, or awkwardness experienced when a person is in proximity to, approaching, or being approached by other people, especially in new situations or with unfamiliar people.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agreeableness]agreeable[/url].\n\nFriendly characters have a tendency to be pleasant and accommodating in social situations. They also have an optimistic view of human nature and tend to believe that most people are honest, decent, and trustworthy.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neuroticism]neurotic[/url].

Feelings of anxiety, obsessional thoughts, compulsive acts, and physical complaints without objective evidence of disease, in various degrees and patterns, dominate the personality of neurotic characters.

It is an enduring tendency to experience negative emotional states. Individuals who score high on neuroticism are more likely than the average to experience such feelings as anxiety, anger, guilt, and depressed mood. They respond more poorly to environmental stress, and are more likely to interpret ordinary situations as threatening, and minor frustrations as hopelessly difficult.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Self-esteem]low self-esteem[/url].\n\nCharacters with low self-esteem have no belief in their own worth. They tend to suffer from heavy self-criticism, hypersensitivity to criticism of others, chronic indecision, excessive will to please, perfectionism, neurotic guilt, floating hostility, and defensive tendencies.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Driving]drives[/url] a vehicle.

Driving is the controlled operation and movement of a land vehicle, such as a car, truck or bus.

This trait should be used for characters with driving related scenes, and not just because they are professional drivers.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piloting]pilots[/url] an aircraft.

Piloting is the controlled operation and movement of an aircraft, such as a plane, helicopter or spacecraft on sci-fi stories.

This trait should be used for characters with piloting related scenes, and not just because they are professional pilots.

This character is a master of tactics and during the course of the game, runs elaborate plans to achieve some goals.\n\nMostly used for the experts of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_tactics]military tactics[/url], the art of organizing an army, are the techniques for using weapons or military units in combination for engaging and defeating an enemy in battle.
