But also applies to characters that use maneuvers or follow plans to achieve a particular aim in in non-battle situations.

trait_alias:
Domestic Abuse
Domestic Violence
Spousal Abuse
Family Violence
Intimate Partner Violence
description:
This character engages in the acts of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domestic_violence]domestic violence[/url].

Domestic violence can be broadly defined as a pattern of abusive behaviors by one or both partners in an intimate relationship such as marriage, dating, family, friends or cohabitation. Domestic violence has many forms including physical aggression (hitting, kicking, biting, shoving, restraining, slapping, throwing objects), or threats thereof; sexual abuse; emotional abuse; controlling or domineering; intimidation; stalking; passive/covert abuse (e.g., neglect); and economic deprivation.

In games and anime domestic violence may appear as a comedy routine.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bullying]bullies[/url] someone.

Bullying is a form of abuse. It involves repeated acts over time attempting to create or enforce one person's (or group's) power over another person (or group) , thus an "imbalance of power". The "imbalance of power" may be social power and/or physical power.

Bullying consists of three basic types of abuse – emotional, verbal and physical. It typically involves subtle methods of coercion such as intimidation.

This character engages in the acts of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frotteurism]frotteurism[/url].\n\nFrotteurism refers to a paraphilic interest in rubbing, usually one's pelvis or erect penis, against a non-consenting person for sexual gratification. It may involve touching any part of the body including the genital area.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rapes[/url] one or more other characters.

In criminal law, rape is a type of sexual assault usually involving sexual intercourse, which is initiated by one or more persons against another person without that person's consent.

This trait is intended for rape scenes that involve penetration, ones that reach finality. For the scenes that stop before penetration use the "Rape Attempt" trait.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drug_abuse]abuses drugs[/url].

Substance abuse refers to a maladaptive pattern of use of a substance that is not considered dependent. The term "drug abuse" does not exclude dependency, but is otherwise used in a similar manner in nonmedical contexts.

This trait is intended for characters that are addicted to drugs, do not use it for everyone that takes a pill once or twice in a story.

This character drinks [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alcoholic_beverage]alcoholic beverages[/url].

An alcoholic beverage is a drink containing ethanol, commonly known as alcohol. Alcoholic beverages are divided into three general classes: beers, wines, and spirits. They are legally consumed in most countries, and over 100 countries have laws regulating their production, sale, and consumption.

This trait is intended for characters that drink alcoholic beverages a few times in the story, for the addiction alcoholism use the [url=https://vndb.org/i263]Alcohol Abuse[/url] trait.

This character suffers from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alcoholism]alcoholism[/url].

Alcoholism is a disabling addictive disorder. It is characterized by compulsive and uncontrolled consumption of alcohol despite its negative effects on the drinker's health, relationships, and social standing.

This trait is intended for characters that are addicted to alcohol, for characters that drink an alcoholic beverage once or twice in a story use the Drinking trait.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smoking]smokes[/url] tobacco or cannabis.

Smoking is a practice in which a substance, most commonly tobacco or cannabis, is burned and the smoke is tasted or inhaled. This is primarily practised as a route of administration for recreational drug use, as combustion releases the active substances in drugs such as nicotine and makes them available for absorption through the lungs. It can also be done as a part of rituals, to induce trances and spiritual enlightenment.

This trait is only for smoking, for other types of recreational drug use and the leading addiction use the [url=https://vndb.org/i261]Drug Abuse[/url] trait.

This character attempts at [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide]suicide[/url].\n\nSuicide is the act of a human being intentionally causing his or her own death. Suicide is often committed out of despair, or attributed to some underlying mental disorder which includes depression, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, alcoholism and drug abuse. Financial difficulties, troubles with interpersonal relationships and other undesirable situations play a significant role.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypnotism]hypnotises[/url] others.\n\nHypnosis is a mental state. It is usually induced by a procedure known as a hypnotic induction, which is commonly composed of a long series of preliminary instructions and suggestions. Hypnotic suggestions may be delivered by a hypnotist in the presence of the subject, or may be self-administered ("self-suggestion" or "autosuggestion").

This character gets caught in an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accident]accident[/url].\n\nAn accident is a specific, unpredictable, unusual and unintended external action which occurs in a particular time and place, with no apparent and deliberate cause but with marked effects. It implies a generally negative outcome which may have been avoided or prevented had circumstances leading up to the accident been recognized, and acted upon, prior to its occurrence.

This character becomes the target of  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bullying]bullying[/url].

Bullying is a form of abuse. It involves repeated acts over time attempting to create or enforce one person's (or group's) power over another person (or group) , thus an "imbalance of power". The "imbalance of power" may be social power and/or physical power.

Bullying consists of three basic types of abuse – emotional, verbal and physical. It typically involves subtle methods of coercion such as intimidation.

This character becomes a victim of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frotteurism]frotteurism[/url].\n\nFrotteurism refers to a paraphilic interest in rubbing, usually one's pelvis or erect penis, against a non-consenting person for sexual gratification. It may involve touching any part of the body including the genital area.

This character becomes the target of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypnotism]hypnotism[/url].\n\nHypnosis is a mental state. It is usually induced by a procedure known as a hypnotic induction, which is commonly composed of a long series of preliminary instructions and suggestions. Hypnotic suggestions may be delivered by a hypnotist in the presence of the subject, or may be self-administered ("self-suggestion" or "autosuggestion").

This character becomes the target of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brainwashing]brainwashing[/url].\n\nBrainwashing refers to a process in which a group or individual "systematically uses unethically manipulative methods to persuade others to conform to the wishes of the manipulator(s), often to the detriment of the person being manipulated". The term has been applied to any tactic, psychological or otherwise, which can be seen as subverting an individual's sense of control over their own thinking, behavior, emotions or decision making.
These are the traits related to the characters [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Health]health[/url].

This character suffers from  a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terminal_illness]terminal illness[/url].\n\nA terminal illness is a medical term popularized in the 20th century to describe a disease that cannot be cured or adequately treated and that is reasonably expected to result in the death of the patient within a relatively short period of time. This term is more commonly used for progressive diseases such as cancer or advanced heart disease than for trauma. In popular use, it indicates a disease which will end the life of the sufferer.

This character suffers from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insanity]insanity[/url].\n\nInsanity is a spectrum of behaviors characterized by certain abnormal mental or behavioral patterns. Insanity may manifest as violations of societal norms, including becoming a danger to themselves and others, though not all such acts are considered insanity.

This character suffers from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Split_Personality]split personality[/url].

Dissociative identity disorder is a psychiatric diagnosis that describes a condition in which a person displays multiple distinct identities or personalities (known as alter egos or alters), each with its own pattern of perceiving and interacting with the environment. The victim may or may not be aware of the existence of the alternate personality.

Notes:
1) Do NOT confuse this with [url=http://vndb.org/i239] Pretending[/url], in which the character is intentionally creating a "fake" persona, to hide his identity and is in full control of it.
2) Do NOT confuse this with Hypnotism (i266 & i270) or Mind Control (i488 & i271) since they are not creating new personalities, they are imposing someone else's will on the character at most.

trait_alias:
Major Depressive Disorder
MDD
Recurrent Depressive Disorder
Major Depression
Unipolar Depression
Unipolar Disorder
description: This character suffers from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_disorder]major depressive disorder[/url].\n\nMajor depressive disorder is a mental disorder characterized by an all-encompassing low mood accompanied by low self-esteem, and by loss of interest or pleasure in normally enjoyable activities.

This character becomes a victim of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child_abuse]child abuse[/url].\n\nChild abuse is any recent act or failure to act on the part of a parent or caretaker which results in death, serious physical or emotional harm, sexual abuse or exploitation, an act or failure to act which presents an imminent risk of serious harm.

This character becomes the target of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blackmail]blackmail[/url].\n\nBlackmail is the act of threatening to reveal substantially true information about a person to the public, a family member, or associates unless a demand is met. This information is usually of an embarrassing, socially damaging, and/or incriminating nature. As the information is substantially true, the act of revealing the information may not be criminal in its own right nor amount to a civil law defamation; it is the making of demands in exchange for withholding the information that is often considered a crime.

This character becomes the victim of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rape[/url] perpetrated by an individual.\n\nIn criminal law, rape is a type of sexual assault usually involving sexual intercourse, which is initiated by one or more persons against another person without that person's consent.

This character becomes the victim of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rape[/url] perpetrated by a group of people.\n\nIn criminal law, rape is a type of sexual assault usually involving sexual intercourse, which is initiated by one or more persons against another person without that person's consent.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Husband]husband[/url].\n\nA husband is a male participant in a marriage, a social union or legal contract between people that creates kinship.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Widow]widower[/url].\n\nA widower is a man whose spouse has died.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wife]wife[/url].\n\nA wife is a female participant in a marriage, a social union or legal contract between people that creates kinship.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Widow]widow[/url].\n\nA widow is a woman whose spouse has died.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engagement]engaged to be married[/url].\n\nAn engagement is a promise to marry, and also the period of time between proposal and marriage – which may be lengthy or trivial.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Divorcee]divorcee[/url].\n\nDivorcee refers to a person whose marriage has ended in divorce, a legal dissolution of marriage before death by either spouse.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mother]mother[/url].\n\nA mother is a woman who has conceived, given birth to, or raised a child in the role of a parent.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Father]father[/url].\n\nA father is defined as a male parent of any type of offspring.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Son]son[/url].\n\nA son is a male offspring; a boy or man in relation to his parents.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daughter]daughter[/url].\n\nA daughter is a female offspring; a girl or woman in relation to her parents.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sibling#Full_sibling]full brother[/url].\n\nA full brother is a male sibling that shares both parents with the other siblings.
This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stepsibling]step brother[/url].\n\nA stepbrother is the son of one's stepparent from a previous relationship. They are not related by blood.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twin]twin[/url] brother.\n\nA twin is one of two offspring produced in the same pregnancy. Twins can either be identical (in scientific usage, "monozygotic"), meaning that they develop from one zygote that splits and forms two embryos, or fraternal ("dizygotic") because they develop from two separate eggs that are fertilized by two separate sperm.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sibling#Full_sibling]full sister[/url].\n\nA full sister is a female sibling that shares both parents with the other siblings.
This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stepsibling]step sister[/url].\n\nA stepsister is the daughter of one's stepparent from a previous relationship. They are not related by blood.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twin]twin[/url] sister.\n\nA twin is one of two offspring produced in the same pregnancy. Twins can either be identical (in scientific usage, "monozygotic"), meaning that they develop from one zygote that splits and forms two embryos, or fraternal ("dizygotic") because they develop from two separate eggs that are fertilized by two separate sperm.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grandfather]grandfather[/url].\n\nA grandfather is the male parent of a person's own parent.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grandmother]grandmother[/url].\n\nA grandmother is the female parent of a person's own parent.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family#Western_kinship]grandson[/url].\n\nA grandson is a child's son.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family#Western_kinship]granddaughter[/url].\n\nA granddaughter is a child's daughter.
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family#Western_kinship]uncle[/url].\n\nAn uncle is a father's brother, mother's brother, father's sister's husband, mother's sister's husband.
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family#Western_kinship]aunt[/url].\n\nAn aunt is a father's sister, mother's sister, father's brother's wife, mother's brother's wife.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family#Western_kinship]nephew[/url].\n\nA nephew is a sister's son, brother's son, wife's brother's son, wife's sister's son, husband's brother's son, husband's sister's son.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family#Western_kinship]niece[/url].\n\nA niece is a sister's daughter, brother's daughter, wife's brother's daughter, wife's sister's daughter, husband's brother's daughter, husband's sister's daughter.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brother-in-Law]brother-in-law[/url].\n\nA brother-in-law is the brother of one's spouse, the husband of one's sister, or the husband of one's spouse's sibling.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sister-in-law]sister-in-law[/url].\n\nA sister-in-law is the sister of one's spouse, the wife of one's brother, or sometimes the wife of one's spouse's sibling.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cousin]cousin[/url].\n\nA cousin is a relative outside the immediate family with whom one shares a common ancestor. The term is usually used when any of the other known terms are not applicable.

This character is in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domestic_partnership]domestic partnership[/url].

A domestic partnership is a legal or personal relationship between two individuals who live together and share a common domestic life but are neither joined by marriage nor a civil union.

A domestic partner is different from a roommate since it signifies an intimate relationship while the later doesn't.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roommate]roommate[/url].

A roommate is a person who shares a living facility such as an apartment or dormitory.

A domestic partner is different from a roommate since it signifies an intimate relationship while the later doesn't.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boyfriend]boyfriend[/url].

A boyfriend is a person's regular male companion in a romantic and/or sexual relationship, though normally not in long-term committed (e.g. marital) relationships, where other titles (e.g. husband, partner) are more commonly used.

Due to database classification, this trait should not be used for the meaning of "guy friend" as "a male non-romantic and non-sexual friend".

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Girlfriend]girlfriend[/url].

A girlfriend is a person's regular female companion in a romantic and/or sexual relationship, though normally not in long-term committed (e.g. marital) relationships, where other titles (e.g. husband, partner) are more commonly used.

Due to database classification, this trait should not be used for the meaning of "female non-romantic friend that is closer than other friends".

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friend#Types_of_friendships]acquaintance[/url] of someone.

An acquaintance is usually considered as a friend, but sharing of emotional ties isn't present. An example would be a coworker with whom you enjoy eating lunch or having coffee, but would not look to for emotional support. Many "friends" that appear on social networking sites are generally acquaintances in real life.

This trait is intended to be used if a character knows another character from the same story, but the type of this relationship isn't easy to define by one of the child traits of this one. Otherwise use one of them or add a new appropriate one.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friend]friend[/url] of someone.\n\nIn a comparison of personal relationships, friendship is considered to be closer and more intimate than association. Friendships is often the result of a friend demonstrating the tendency to desire what is best for the other, sympathy, empathy, honesty, mutual understanding and compassion, trust in one another and positive reciprocity.

This character is a childhood [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friend]friend[/url] of someone.\n\nA childhood friend is usually considered to be a friend that shares extremely strong interpersonal ties with someone based on this friendship's having roots to these character's early childhoods.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friend#Types_of_friendships]comrade[/url] of someone.\n\nComradeship is the feeling of affinity that draws people together in time of war or when people have a mutual enemy or even a common goal. Friendship can be mistaken for comradeship. As a war ends, or a common enemy recedes, many comrades return to being strangers, who lack friendship and have little in common.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frenemy]frenemy[/url] of someone.\n\nFrenemy is a portmanteau of "friend" and "enemy" which can refer to either an enemy disguised as a friend or to a partner who is simultaneously a competitor and rival.

This character is the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legal_guardian]legal guardian[/url] of someone.\n\nA legal guardian is a person who has the legal authority (and the corresponding duty) to care for the personal and property interests of another person, called a ward. Usually, a person has the status of guardian because the ward is incapable of caring for his or her own interests due to infancy, incapacity, or disability. Most countries and states have laws that provide that the parents of a minor child can designate who shall become the child's legal guardians in the event of death.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ward_%28legal%29]ward[/url] of someone.\n\nA ward is someone placed under the protection of a legal guardian.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Employee#Employee]employee[/url].\n\nAn employee is any person hired by an employer to do a specific "job". In most modern economies, the term employee refers to a specific defined relationship between an individual and a corporation, which differs from those of customer, or client.
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Employer#Employer]employer[/url].\n\nAn employer is a person or institution that hires employees or workers.

These are the role traits associated with characters' [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Career]careers[/url].

Career is an individual's course or progress through life (or a distinct portion of life). It is usually considered to pertain to remunerative work (and sometimes also formal education).

While most of these traits can be used for either of the cases, there are some exceptions. For example the cook and cooking traits; while a lot of characters engage in cooking during stories, only a few are actually professional cooks. Users should keep these in mind while applying these traits.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Class_President]class president[/url].

A class president is usually the leader of a student body class, and presides over its class cabinet or organization within a student council, in a grade school class presidents are generally elected by the class, a constituency composed of all students in a grade level.

Class presidents are different from the student-body president in that they represent only a specific class of students, rather than the entire student body.

This character is a member of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student_club]student club[/url].\n\nSchool clubs are student-based school organizations, consisting of administration-approved organizations functioning with myriads of tasks, varying on the specific purpose of each respective club.

trait_alias:
Student Club Chairman
Student Club Chancellor
Leader of Student Club
Student Club Director
description: This character is the leader of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student_club]student club[/url].\n\nA student club president leads the members of the student club in day to day tasks to follow and achieve the goal of the club.

This character is a member of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sports_club]sports club[/url] associated with a school.\n\nA school sports club is a administration-approved student-based school organization focusing on a selected sport.

This character is a member of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archery]archery club[/url] associated with a school.\n\nA school sports club is a administration-approved student-based school organization focusing on a selected sport. Archery is the art, practice, or skill of propelling arrows with the use of a bow.

trait_alias:
Student Council Officer
Student Body Representative
Student Government Member
Students' Union Officer
Guild of Students Member
description: This character is a member of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student_government]student government[/url].\n\nA student government is a student organization present in many colleges, universities and has started to appear in some high schools. In higher education, the student union is often accorded its own building on the campus, dedicated to social and organizational activities of the student body.

trait_alias:
Student Council Chairman
Student Body President
Student Government President
Students' Union Chancellor
Guild of Students President
Student Council Director
description:
This character is the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student-body_president]student government president[/url].

The president of the student government is the highest ranking officer of a student government or student union association on the high school, college, or university level. Respected as one of the highest honored roles to achieve during academic studies, serving as president can enable a student to gain strong interpersonal, leadership, social, economic, and management skills. Employers may look highly upon an applicant who has served in this capacity.

A student government president is different from a class president. Class presidents only represent a specific class (grade) of students, while the body president is the highest ranking student in the school.

These are the roles associated with a  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religion]religion[/url].\n\nReligion is a cultural system that creates powerful and long-lasting meaning, by establishing symbols that relate humanity to truths and values.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Priest]priest[/url].\n\nA priest or priestess is one authorized to perform the sacred rites of a religion, especially as a mediatory agent between humans and deities. They also have the authority or power to administer religious rites; in particular, rites of sacrifice to, and propitiation of, a deity or deities.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Priest]priestess[/url].\n\nA priest or priestess is one authorized to perform the sacred rites of a religion, especially as a mediatory agent between humans and deities. They also have the authority or power to administer religious rites; in particular, rites of sacrifice to, and propitiation of, a deity or deities.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miko]miko[/url].\n\nMiko is a Japanese term that anciently meant a "female shaman, spirit medium" who conveyed oracles from kami ("spirits; gods"), and presently means a "shrine maiden; virgin consecrated to a deity" who serves at Shinto shrines.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Physician]medical doctor[/url].\n\nA physician practices the ancient profession of medicine, which is concerned with maintaining or restoring human health through the study, diagnosis, and treatment of disease or injury. This properly requires both a detailed knowledge of the academic disciplines (such as anatomy and physiology) underlying diseases and their treatment—the science of medicine—and also a decent competence in its applied practice—the art or craft of medicine.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nurse]nurse[/url].\n\nA nurse is a healthcare professional who, in collaboration with other members of a health care team, is responsible for: treatment, safety, and recovery of acutely or chronically ill individuals; health promotion and maintenance within families, communities and populations; and, treatment of life-threatening emergencies in a wide range of health care settings.

This character is a member of a  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_family]royal family[/url].\n\nA royal family is the extended family of a king or queen regnant. The term imperial family appropriately describes the extended family of an emperor or empress, while the terms "ducal family", "grand ducal family" or "princely family" are more appropriate to describe the relatives of a reigning duke, grand duke, or prince. However, in common parlance members of any family which reigns by hereditary right are often referred to as royalty or "royals".

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monarch]monarch[/url].

A monarch is the person who heads a monarchy, a form of government in which a country or entity is usually ruled or controlled by an individual who typically inherits the throne by birth and normally rules for life or until abdication.

Monarchs may be autocrats (absolute monarchy) or ceremonial heads of state who exercise little or no power or only reserve power, with actual authority vested in a parliament or other body (constitutional monarchy).

This trait is intended for monarchs that are outside of the common norms listed as child traits to this, if applicable use them instead.
This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/queen]queen[/url].\n\nA queen is a female monarch or the the wife or consort of a king.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen_regnant]queen regnant[/url].\n\nA queen regnant is a female monarch who reigns in her own right, in contrast to a "queen consort", who is the wife of a reigning king. Queens regnant possess and exercise sovereign powers.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen_consort]queen consort[/url].\n\nA queen consort is the wife of a reigning king. A queen consort usually shares her husband's rank and holds the feminine equivalent of the king's monarchical titles. Historically, queen consorts do not share the king regent's political and military powers. Most queens in history were queens consort.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince]prince[/url].\n\nPrince is a general term for a ruler, monarch or member of a monarch's or former monarch's family, and is a hereditary title in the nobility of some European states.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess]princess[/url].\n\nPrincess is a general term for a ruler, monarch or member of a monarch's or former monarch's family, and is a hereditary title in the nobility of some European states.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magical_girl]magical girl[/url].\n\nA magical girl is a young girl with superhuman abilities, who fights evil and protects the Earth.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superhero]superhero[/url].\n\nA superhero is a type of stock character possessing "extraordinary or superhuman powers" and dedicated to protecting the public.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artist]artist[/url].\n\nAn artist is a person engaged in one or more of any of a broad spectrum of activities related to creating art, practicing the arts and/or demonstrating an art.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Musician]musician[/url].\n\nA musician is a person who writes, performs, or makes music.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Singing]singing[/url].\n\nSinging is the act of producing musical sounds with the voice, and augments regular speech by the use of both tonality and rhythm. One who sings is called a singer or vocalist. Singers perform music known as songs that can be sung either with or without accompaniment by musical instruments.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_idol]idol[/url].\n\nIdols are (usually female) media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly attractive or cute and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities (tarento), models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guitarist]guitarist[/url].\n\nA guitarist is a musician who plays the guitar. Guitarists may play a variety of instruments such as classical guitars, acoustic guitars, electric guitars, and bass guitars. Some guitarists accompany themselves on the guitar while singing.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drummer]drummer[/url].\n\nA drummer is a person who plays drums, particularly a drum kit ("drum set" or "trap set", which will also include cymbals), marching percussion or hand drums.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keyboardist]keyboardist[/url].\n\nA keyboardist is a musician who plays keyboard instruments. A keyboard instrument is any musical instrument played using a musical keyboard. The most common of these is the piano. Other widely used keyboard instruments include multiple types of organs as well as other mechanical, electromechanical and electronic instruments. In common language, it is mostly used to refer to keyboard-style synthesizers.

This character is an artist in the medium of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Painting]painting[/url].

Painting is the practice of applying paint, pigment, color or other medium to a surface (support base). The application of the medium is commonly applied to the base with a brush but other objects can be used. In art the term describes both the act and the result which is called a painting.

This trait is for characters that are creating paintings as a form of art, do not use it for someone who paints the walls of buildings in a single color as a job.

This character is an artist in the medium of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voice_acting]voice acting[/url].\n\nVoice acting is the art of providing voices for animated characters (including those in feature films, television program, animated short films, and video games) and radio and audio dramas and comedy, as well as doing voice-overs in radio and television commercials, audio dramas, dubbed foreign language films, video games, puppet shows, and amusement rides.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Servant]servant[/url].\n\nServant is an older English term for "domestic worker", though not all servants worked inside the home. A domestic worker is someone who works within the employer's household. Domestic workers perform a variety of household services for an individual or a family, from providing care for children and elderly dependents to cleaning and household maintenance, known as housekeeping.

trait_alias:
Majordomo
Butler Administrator
Staff Manager
Head of Household Staff
description: This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butler]butler[/url].\n\nA butler is a servant in a large rich household. The butler is in charge of food service, wine, spirits, and silver, supervises other servants, and may perform a wide array of household management duties. A butler is usually male, and in charge of male servants, while a housekeeper is usually a woman, and in charge of female servants.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maid]maid[/url].\n\nA maid is a female employed in domestic service. Maids perform typical domestic chores such as cooking, ironing, washing, cleaning the house, grocery shopping, walking the family dog, and taking care of children.

trait_alias:
Majordomo
Butler Administrator
Staff Manager
Head of Household Staff
description: This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Housekeeper_%28servant%29]housekeeper[/url].\n\nA housekeeper is an individual responsible for the cleaning and maintenance of the interior of a residence. A housekeeper is usually a woman, and in charge of female servants, while a butler is usually male, and in charge of male servants.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cheerleader]cheerleader[/url].

Cheerleading is a physical activity, sometimes a competitive sport, based on organized routines, usually ranging from one to three minutes, which contain the components of tumbling, dance, jumps, cheers, and stunting to direct spectators of events to cheer on sports teams at games or to participate in competitions.

While cheerleaders are usually students cheering for their school's teams, there are also non-student cheerleaders supporting professional sports clubs and similar.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teacher]teacher[/url].\n\nA teacher is a person who provides schooling for pupils and students. A teacher who facilitates education for an individual student may also be described as a personal tutor.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Journalist]journalist[/url].

A journalist collects and disseminates information about current events, people, trends, and issues. His or her work is acknowledged as journalism.

Reporters are one type of journalist. They create reports as a profession for broadcast or publication in mass media such as newspapers, television, radio, magazines, documentary film, and the Internet.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Librarian]librarian[/url].\n\nA librarian is an information professional trained in library and information science, which is the organization and management of information services or materials for those with information needs.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientist]scientist[/url].\n\nA scientist in a broad sense is one engaging in a systematic activity to acquire knowledge. In a more restricted sense, a scientist is an individual who uses the scientific method.

This character is a type of magician that delves into the context of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Witchcraft]witchcraft[/url].\n\nWitchcraft, in historical, anthropological, religious and mythological contexts, is the alleged use of supernatural or magical powers. Historically, it was widely believed that witchcraft involved the use of these powers to inflict harm upon members of a community or their property, and that all witches were in league with the devil.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neet]NEET[/url].

NEET is a government initialism for people currently "Not in Education, Employment, or Training". NEET classification comprises people who are unemployed, not engaged in housework, not enrolled in school or work-related training, and not seeking work. The "NEET group" is not a uniform set of individuals. It includes those people who will be NEET for a short time while testing out a variety of opportunities, and those who have major and often multiple mental disorders and are likely to be NEET for most of their lives.

This trait does not apply to people that are very rich and have no need to worry about earning income for the rest of their lives.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unemployed]unemployed[/url].

Unemployment, as defined by the International Labour Organization, occurs when people are without jobs and they have actively looked for work within the past four weeks.

The difference between an unemployed person and a neet is that the fist one is looking for a job.

This character is a classic [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsundere]tsundere[/url].\n\nTsundere is a Japanese character development process which describes a person who is initially cold and even hostile towards another person before gradually showing their warm side over time. This change of behavior is permanent, and that's where the classic tsundere type is different form the modern tsundere.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cooking]cook[/url].

Cooking is the process of preparing food with heat. 

This trait should be used for professional cooks, not every character with cooking related scenes.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Driving]driver[/url].

Driving is the controlled operation and movement of a land vehicle, such as a car, truck or bus.

This trait should be used for professional drivers, not every character with driving related scenes.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piloting]pilot[/url].\n\nPiloting is the controlled operation and movement of an aircraft, such as a plane, helicopter or spacecraft on sci-fi stories.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineer]engineer[/url].\n\nAn engineer is a professional practitioner of engineering, concerned with applying scientific knowledge, mathematics and ingenuity to develop solutions for technical problems. Engineers design materials, structures, machines and systems while considering the limitations imposed by practicality, safety and cost.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawyer]lawyer[/url].\n\nA lawyer is a person learned in the law; as a attorney, counsel or solicitor; a person who is practicing law. Law is the system of rules of conduct established by the sovereign government of a society to correct wrongs, maintain the stability of political and social authority, and deliver justice.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prostitute]prostitute[/url].\n\nProstitution is the act or practice of providing sexual services to another person in return for payment. People who execute such activities are called prostitutes. Prostitution is one of the branches of the sex industry.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waitress]server[/url].\n\nWaitstaff are those who work at a restaurant or a bar attending customers — supplying them with food and drink as requested.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Writer]writer[/url].\n\nA writer is a person who produces literary content, including but not limited to stories, poetry, music and other literary art, advertising, procedures, and books.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue-collar_worker]blue-collar worker[/url].\n\nA blue-collar worker is a member of the working class who typically performs manual labor and earns an hourly wage. Blue-collar workers are distinguished from those in the service sector and from white-collar workers, whose jobs are not considered manual labor.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White-collar_worker]white-collar worker[/url].\n\nA white-collar worker refers to a salaried professional or an educated worker who performs semi-professional office, administrative, and sales coordination tasks, as opposed to a blue-collar worker, whose job requires manual labor.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hacker]hacker[/url].

A hacker is a person who delights in having an intimate understanding of the internal workings of a system, computers and computer networks in particular. 

Modern popular use of the term refers to people committed to circumvention of computer security. This primarily concerns unauthorized remote computer break-ins via a communication networks such as the Internet (Black hats), but also includes those who debug or fix security problems (White hats), and the morally ambiguous Grey hats.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criminal]criminal[/url].\n\nA criminal is a character that violates the law. Crime is the breach of rules or laws for which some governing authority (via mechanisms such as legal systems) can ultimately prescribe a conviction.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thief]thief[/url].\n\nSomeone who carries out an act of or makes a career of theft is known as a thief, and the act of theft is known as stealing, thieving, or sometimes filching. In criminal law, theft is the illegal taking of another person's property without that person's freely-given consent.

This character is a member of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Criminal_syndicate]criminal syndicate[/url].\n\nOrganized crime or criminal organizations are transnational, national, or local groupings of highly centralized enterprises run by criminals for the purpose of engaging in illegal activity, most commonly for monetary profit. Some criminal organizations, such as terrorist organizations, are politically motivated. Gangs may become "disciplined" enough to be considered "organized". An organized gang or criminal set can also be referred to as a mob.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yakuza]yakuza[/url] member.

Yakuza are members of traditional organized crime syndicates in Japan.

Despite uncertainty about the single origin of Yakuza organizations, most modern Yakuza derive from two classifications which emerged in the mid-Edo Period: tekiya, those who primarily peddled illicit, stolen or shoddy goods; and bakuto, those who were involved in or participated in gambling.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mafia]mafia[/url] member.\n\nThe Mafia (also known as Cosa Nostra) is a criminal syndicate that emerged in the mid 19th century in Sicily. It is a loose association of criminal groups that share a common organizational structure and code of conduct. Each group, known as a "family", "clan", or "cosca", claims sovereignty over a territory in which it operates its rackets – usually a town or village or a neighbourhood (borgata) of a larger city.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bodyguard]bodyguard[/url].\n\nA bodyguard is a type of security operative or government agent who protects a person—usually a famous, wealthy, or politically important figure—from assault, kidnapping, assassination, stalking, loss of confidential information, terrorist attack or other threats.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassin]assassin[/url].\n\nAn assassin is a highly skilled and trained murderer, usually someone who kills a politically prominent person, or someone of similar importance, for fanatical or monetary reasons.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knight]knight[/url].\n\nA knight is a member of the warrior class of the Middle Ages in Europe who followed a code of law called "chivalry", the sum of the ideal qualifications of a knight, including courtesy, generosity, valor, and dexterity in arms.

This character is a practitioner of  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martial_arts]martial arts[/url].\n\nMartial arts are extensive systems of codified practices and traditions of combat. Martial arts all have similar objectives: to physically defeat other persons or defend oneself or others from physical threat.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samurai]samurai[/url].\n\nSamurai is the term for the military nobility of pre-industrial Japan. The samurai followed a set of rules that came to be known as Bushidou. This code is said to have emphasized virtues such as loyalty, honor, obedience, duty, filial piety, and self-sacrifice.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ninja]ninja[/url].\n\nA ninja is a covert agent or mercenary from feudal Japan specializing in unorthodox arts of war. The functions of the ninja includes espionage, sabotage, infiltration, and assassination, as well as open combat in certain situations.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Onmyouji#Onmy.C5.8Dji]onmyouji[/url].

Onmyouji was one of the classifications of civil servants belonging to the Bureau of Onmyou in ancient Japan's ritsuryo system. People with this title were professional practitioners of onmyoudou.

Onmyouji were specialists in magic and divination. Their court responsibilities ranged from tasks such as keeping track of the calendar, to mystical duties such as divination and protection of the capital from evil spirits. They could divine auspicious or harmful influences in the earth, and were instrumental in the moving of capitals. It is said that an onmyouji could also summon and control shikigami.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier]pirate[/url].\n\nA pirate is a perpetrator who paretakes in criminal acts of violence, detention, rape, or depredation committed for private ends by the crew or the passengers of a private ship or aircraft that is directed on the high seas against another ship, aircraft, or against persons or property on board a ship or aircraft.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Police_officer]police officer[/url].\n\nA police officer is a warranted employee of a police force. Police officers are generally charged with the apprehension of criminals and the prevention and detection of crime, and the maintenance of public order.

This character engages in espionage, a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spy]spy[/url].\n\nEspionage or spying involves an individual obtaining information that is considered secret or confidential without the permission of the holder of the information. Espionage is inherently clandestine, lest the legitimate holder of the information change plans or take other countermeasures once it is known that the information is in unauthorized hands.
This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/soldier]soldier[/url].\n\nA soldier is a person who serves in an army; a person engaged in military service.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercenary]mercenary[/url].\n\nA mercenary is a person who takes part in an armed conflict, who is not a national or a party to the conflict, and is "motivated to take part in the hostilities essentially by the desire for private gain and, in fact, is promised, by or on behalf of a party to the conflict, material compensation substantially in excess of that promised or paid to combatants of similar ranks and functions in the armed forces of that Party" (Additional Protocol I to the Geneva Convention of August 1949).

This character is based on a famous person from the history of Earth, and on rare cases someone that is still alive.\n\nThis is different from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_person_fiction]real person fiction[/url] where the character is the actual famous person, not just a character inspired by that person.

trait_alias:
Based on a Fable
Based on a Fantasy
Based on a Myth
Based on a Story
description: This character is based on a famous character from another work of fiction.\n\nThis is different from a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crossover_fiction]fictional crossover[/url] where the character is the actual famous character, not just a character inspired by that person.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinigami]shinigami[/url].\n\nA shinigami is a death deity or personification of death. There are variations like  deities that either collect or rule over the dead, and those deities who only determine the time of death.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valkyrie]valkyrie[/url].\n\nA valkyrie is one of a host of female figures who pick the worthy among those that die in battle. The valkyries bring their chosen to the afterlife hall of the slain, Valhalla, ruled over by the god Odin, where the deceased warriors become einherjar.

This character is a member of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobility]nobility[/url].\n\nNobility is a state-privileged status which is generally hereditary. The privileges associated with nobility may constitute substantial advantages over or relative to non-nobles, or may be largely honorary (e.g. precedence), but are maintained, or at least officially acknowledged, by law or government.

This character is the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alter_ego]alter ego[/url] of another character from the same game.\n\nAn alter-ego (Latin, "the other I") is a second self, a second personality or persona within a person, who is often oblivious to the persona's actions. A person with an alter-ego is said to lead a double life.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloning]clone[/url].\n\nCloning in biology is the process of producing similar populations of genetically identical individuals that occurs in nature when organisms such as bacteria, insects or plants reproduce asexually. Cloning in biotechnology refers to processes used to create copies of DNA fragments (molecular cloning), cells (cell cloning), or organisms.

This character is subjected to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torture]torture[/url].

Torture is any act by which severe pain or suffering, whether physical or mental, is intentionally inflicted on a person for such purposes as obtaining from him, or a third person, information or a confession, punishing him for an act he or a third person has committed or is suspected of having committed, or intimidating or coercing him or a third person, or for any reason based on discrimination of any kind, when such pain or suffering is inflicted by or at the instigation of or with the consent or acquiescence of a public official or other person acting in an official capacity. It does not include pain or suffering arising only from, inherent in, or incidental to, lawful sanctions. 

[From UN Convention Against Torture]

These are the traits about [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fingering_%28sexual_act%29]fingering[/url]. These traits are for the performing partner. Traits for the receiving partner are under [url=/i1644]i1644[/url].

Fingering is the act of using one's fingers to stimulate a partner's clitoris, vulva, vagina or anus.

Don't use these traits for cases where a character fingers themselves. Use [url=/i592]Masturbation[/url] instead.
This character participates in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lesbian_sex]lesbian sex[/url].\n\nLesbian sexual practices are sexual activities where the participants are women.

trait_alias:
MSM Sex
Yaoi
Gay Sex
Male-on-Male Sex
Boy-on-Boy Sex
Man-on-Man Sex
Men with Men Sex
description: This character participates in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gay_sex]men with men sex[/url].\n\nMen who have sex with men (abbreviated as MSM, also known as males who have sex with males) are male persons who engage in sexual activity with members of the same sex, regardless of how they identify themselves; many men choose not to (or cannot for other reasons) accept social identities of gay or bisexual.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_cleaning]housekeeping[/url] or cleaning of other places in a similar manner, like a classroom.\n\nHousekeeping is the act of cleaning the rooms and furnishings of a home. It is one of the many chores included in the term housework. Housecleaning includes activities such as disposing of rubbish, cleaning dirty surfaces, dusting and vacuuming. It may also involve some outdoor chores, such as removing leaves from rain gutters, washing windows and sweeping doormats.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teasing]teases[/url] someone.

Teasing comes in two major forms, playful and hurtful. When teasing is playful and friendly, and especially when it is reciprocal, teasing can be regarded as flirting.

People may be teased on such matters as their appearance, weight, behavior, abilities, and clothing. From the victim's point-of-view, this kind of teasing is often hurtful, irrespective of the intention of the teaser.

When teasing is unwelcome, it may be regarded as harassment or mobbing, especially in the work place, or as a form of bullying or emotional abuse. If done in public, it may be regarded as humiliation.

This character often makes [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarcasm]sarcastic[/url] remarks.\n\nSarcasm is “a sharp, bitter, or cutting expression or remark; a bitter jibe or taunt.” Though irony is usually the immediate context, most authorities sharply distinguish sarcasm from irony; however, others argue that sarcasm may or often does involve irony or employs ambivalence. Sarcasm has been suggested as a possible bullying action in some circumstances.
These are the traits regarding the nature of characters and mostly concern non-human and/or part-human aspects of characters.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homunculus]homunculus[/url].\n\nA homunculus is an artificial human, given life by magic and/or science.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spirit]spirit[/url].\n\nThe spirit of a human being is the animating, sensitive or vital principle in that individual, similar to the soul taken to be the seat of the mental, intellectual and emotional powers. The notions of a person's "spirit" and "soul" often also overlap, as both contrast with body and both are imagined as surviving the bodily death in religion and occultism, and "spirit" can also have the sense of "ghost", i.e. manifestations of the spirit of a deceased person.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Equestrianism]horseback riding[/url] or another [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riding_animal#Riding_animals_or_mounts]riding animal or mount[/url].\n\nEquestrianism more often known as riding, horseback riding (American English) or horse riding (British English) refers to the skill of riding, driving, or vaulting with horses. This broad description includes the use of horses for practical working purposes, recreational activities, artistic or cultural exercises, and competitive sports.
This character is the non-blood-related brother of a character in this game.\n\nThis may be the result of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adoption]adoption[/url] or something similar.
This character is the non-blood-related sister of a character in this game.\n\nThis may be the result of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adoption]adoption[/url] or something similar.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blackmail]blackmails[/url] someone.\n\nBlackmail is the act of threatening to reveal substantially true information about a person to the public, a family member, or associates unless a demand is met. This information is usually of an embarrassing, socially damaging, and/or incriminating nature. As the information is substantially true, the act of revealing the information may not be criminal in its own right nor amount to a civil law defamation; it is the making of demands in exchange for withholding the information that is often considered a crime.

This character may [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death]die[/url] during the course of the story.

Death is the termination of the biological functions that sustain a living organism.

This trait is intended to be used for characters that can die during the shared route of the game as well as on the paths to good endings. Please do not attach it to characters that can die only at bad endings and game over scenes.

These are the traits regarding [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homicide]homicide[/url].\n\nHomicide refers to the act of a human killing another human.Homicide is not always a punishable act under the criminal law, and is different than a murder from such formal legal point of view.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manslaughter]manslaughter[/url].

Manslaughter is a legal term for the killing of a human being, in a manner considered by law as less culpable than murder.

The law generally differentiates between levels of criminal culpability based on the mens rea, or state of mind. This is particularly true within the law of homicide, where murder requires either the intent to kill – a state of mind called malice, or malice aforethought – or the knowledge that one's actions are likely to result in death; manslaughter, on the other hand, requires a lack of any prior intention to kill or create a deadly situation.

This character commits a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder]murder[/url].

Murder is the unlawful killing of another human being with "malice aforethought", and generally this state of mind distinguishes murder from other forms of unlawful homicide (such as manslaughter).

The four states of mind recognized as constituting "malice" are:
    Intent to kill,
    Intent to inflict grievous bodily harm short of death,
    Reckless indifference to an unjustifiably high risk to human life (sometimes described as an "abandoned and malignant heart"), or
    Intent to commit a dangerous felony (the "felony-murder" doctrine).

This character commits a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justifiable_homicide]justifiable homicide[/url].\n\nThe killing of another, homicide, is not a crime unless the circumstances of a particular homicide fall within outlawed behavior. If a homicide is justified or excused, it is not a crime. One of the most recognized justifications is self defense, which provides, in part, that in certain circumstances a person is justified in killing another to protect his own life from a deadly attack.

As a result of an event in this story this character gets  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Injury]injured[/url].

Injury is damage to a biological organism.

These traits are intended for events that characters survive with an injury and does not apply if they die during that scene or they magically heal shortly afterwards.

As a result of an event in this story this character gets  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wound]wounded or bruised[/url].

A wound is a type of injury in which skin is torn, cut or punctured (an open wound), or where blunt force trauma causes a contusion (a closed wound). In pathology, it specifically refers to a sharp injury which damages the dermis of the skin.

These traits are intended for events that characters survive with a wound and does not apply if they die during that scene or they magically heal shortly afterwards.

As a result of an event in this story this character gets a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wound]bone fracture[/url].

A bone fracture is a medical condition in which there is a break in the continuity of the bone. A bone fracture can be the result of high force impact or stress, or trivial injury as a result of certain medical conditions that weaken the bones, such as osteoporosis, bone cancer, or osteogenesis imperfecta, where the fracture is then properly termed a pathologic fracture.

These traits are intended for events that characters survive with a bone fracture and does not apply if they die during that scene or they magically heal shortly afterwards.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sadist]sadist[/url].\n\nA sadist is someone who obtains pleasure from inflicting pain on others.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sadist]masochist[/url].\n\nMasochist are people who derive pleasure from having pain inflicted on themselves (by either themselves or by others).

This character has a strict personality.

Strict people believe that every aspect of one's life should be taken seriously and time should not be wasted on trivial pursuits that won't progress career.

They accept no mistakes in work and consider them a result of laziness. They tend to follow a routine and have a very solid view of the world and how the things should be, and they consider any other opinions and acts outside that frame a foolish waste of time.
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Braid]braided[/url] hairstyle.\n\nBraid is a hair style formed by interweaving three or more strands of hair.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torture]tortures[/url] someone.

Torture is any act by which severe pain or suffering, whether physical or mental, is intentionally inflicted on a person for such purposes as obtaining from him, or a third person, information or a confession, punishing him for an act he or a third person has committed or is suspected of having committed, or intimidating or coercing him or a third person, or for any reason based on discrimination of any kind, when such pain or suffering is inflicted by or at the instigation of or with the consent or acquiescence of a public official or other person acting in an official capacity. It does not include pain or suffering arising only from, inherent in, or incidental to, lawful sanctions. 

[From UN Convention Against Torture]

These are the traits about characters [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_of_Origin]country of origin[/url].

These traits are more about the unique properties a person gains by being a resident of a country, as well as having parents from that country.

It is aimed towards characters where others can look and say "Hey, you are from Helmajistan aren't you?" instead of characters that lived in Helmajistan for some amount of time. So only use the actual countries that currently exists in the real world and for the cases non is applicable, or it is unknown even though everyone knows a character is a foreigner, just use the Foreigner trait.

This character looks and acts like he/she is from a different country than the VN is set upon. For example if the VN was set in Japan, he/she'd be a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaijin]gaijin[/url].

Gaijin is a Japanese word meaning "non-Japanese", or "alien". This word is a short form of gaikokujin, which means "foreign country people".

This trait is intended to be used for characters that are clearly foreigners to the game's setting, according to the other characters from the game, but their country of origin is not revealed in any point, or just doesn't exists (anymore) in the real world. Making it not possible to use the other country traits but this.

This character suffers from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychotic]psychosis[/url].

Psychosis means abnormal condition of the mind, and is a generic psychiatric term for a mental state often described as involving a "loss of contact with reality".

People suffering from psychosis are described as psychotic. Psychosis is given to the more severe forms of psychiatric disorder, during which hallucinations and delusions and impaired insight may occur.

This character is someone of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honor]honor[/url].

A honorable character acts in accordance with principles of honor, with dignity, distinction, and an illustrious, noble and distinguished way.

There are many definitions to being honorable, some are:

The Bushido code of the samurai that is said to have emphasized virtues such as loyalty, honor, obedience, duty, filial piety, and self-sacrifice.

Chivalry of medieval knights with ideals of knightly virtues, honor and courtly love, pride aspiring to beauty, and formalized pride giving rise to a conception of honor, which is states as the pole of noble life.

It should be noted that the principle idea is not being "good", but being "just" and "true to one's word" and in that sense even criminal organizations such as Yakuza consider themselves honorable.

This trait is intended to be used for characters that make it into a habit to mention that they are honorable, bound by a code of honor like Bushido or chivalry, just, fair, true-to-their-word, etc. And should not be applied to every character that looks honest.

This character has a relaxed attitude.\n\nRelaxed characters act without [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anxiety]anxiety[/url] or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Worry]worry[/url]. They may have solid reasons for doing so, like having made all possible preparations for a situation, or they may be prepared to accept the negative consequences.

This character wears a traditional [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maid]maid[/url]'s or a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_maid]French maid[/url]'s dress.\n\nFrench maid refers to a strongly modified style of servant’s dress that evolved from typical maids’ black and white afternoon uniforms of the nineteenth century (and their later use by stereotypical characters in risqué burlesque dramas of the bedroom farce variety).

This character engages in the acts of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child_abuse]child abuse[/url].\n\nChild abuse is any recent act or failure to act on the part of a parent or caretaker which results in death, serious physical or emotional harm, sexual abuse or exploitation, an act or failure to act which presents an imminent risk of serious harm.

trait_alias:
School Archery Club Chairman
School Archery Club Chancellor
Leader of School Archery Club
School Archery Club Director
description: This character is the leader of a student club.\n\nA school archery club president leads the members of the student club in day to day training and prepares them for competitions.

These are the traits about various [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sports]sports[/url] that the characters engage in.

A sport is an organized, competitive, entertaining, and skillful activity requiring commitment, strategy, and fair play, in which a winner can be defined by objective means. It is governed by a set of rules or customs. 

Activities such as card games and board games, are classified as "mind sports" and some are recognized as Olympic sports, requiring primarily mental skills and mental physical involvement.

Non-competitive activities, for example as jogging or playing catch are usually classified as forms of recreation. Though you should still use these traits for characters if they practice them even if not in the form of a sport.

Please make a specific trait for the type of sport that characters engage in and use this trait only if that sport is unknown or does not exists in the real world.

This character practices [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archery]archery[/url].\n\nArchery is the art, practice, or skill of propelling arrows with the use of a bow, from 'arcus' (Latin). Archery has historically been used for hunting and combat; in modern times, however, its main use is that of a recreational activity.

This character plays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baseball]baseball[/url].

Baseball is a bat-and-ball sport played between two teams of nine players each. The goal is to score runs by hitting a thrown ball with a bat and touching a series of four bases arranged at the corners of a ninety-foot square, or diamond.

Players on one team (the batting team) take turns hitting against the pitcher of the other team (the fielding team), which tries to stop them from scoring runs by getting hitters out in any of several ways. A player on the batting team can stop at any of the bases and later advance via a teammate's hit or other means. The teams switch between batting and fielding whenever the fielding team records three outs. One turn at bat for each team constitutes an inning and nine innings make up a professional game. The team with the most runs at the end of the game wins.
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blindness]blind[/url].\n\nBlindness is the condition of lacking visual perception due to physiological or neurological factors.

This character is [url=http://www.thefreedictionary.com/arrogant]arrogant[/url].\n\nArrogant characters have or display a sense of overbearing self-worth or self-importance. They are marked by or arising from a feeling or assumption of their superiority toward others.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altruism]altruistic[/url].

Altruism is selfless concern for the welfare of others. It is a traditional virtue in many cultures, and a core aspect of various religious traditions, though the concept of 'others' toward whom concern should be directed can vary among religions.

Altruism is the opposite of selfishness.
This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Schoolmate]schoolmate[/url] of another character in this story.\n\nA schoolmate is someone that you go to the same school with.

This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Classmate]classmate[/url] of another character in this story.\n\nA classmate is someone that you go to the same school and same class for one or more periods.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sempai]senpai[/url] of another character in this story.\n\nA junior student will often refer to senior students as "senpai", and alumni will often refer to alumni from earlier classes as "senpai". This holds true particularly if fate brings them together later on, such as joining the same company, serving on a board together, or simply being in a club or parent's organization at the same time.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sempai]kouhai[/url] of another character in this story.\n\nA senior student will often refer to junior students as "kouhai", and alumni will often refer to alumni from late classes as "kouhai". This holds true particularly if fate brings them together later on, such as joining the same company, serving on a board together, or simply being in a club or parent's organization at the same time.

This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/coworker]coworker[/url] of another character in this story.\n\nA coworker is someone that you work together with at the same company/office.

This character is a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/coworker]neighbour[/url] of another character in this story.\n\nA neighbor is someone that lives nearby. Someone from the same [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neighbour]neighbourhood[/url].
This character is a [url=http://www.thefreedictionary.com/teammate]teammate[/url] of another character in this story.\n\nA teammate is a fellow member of a team that you are a part of.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belt_%28clothing%29]belt[/url].

A belt is a flexible band or strap, typically made of leather or heavy cloth, and worn around the waist. A belt supports trousers or other articles of clothing.

This trait is intended for characters that are actually seen wearing a belt, don't add it to anyone that is seen wearing a piece of clothing that is normally worn with a belt (like trousers) and add this tag too unless the belt is also seen or mentioned.

This character suffers from a severe case of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headache]headache[/url].

A headache is pain anywhere in the region of the head or neck.

It can be a symptom of a number of different conditions of the head and neck. The brain tissue itself is not sensitive to pain because it lacks pain receptors. Rather, the pain is caused by disturbance of the pain-sensitive structures around the brain.

This character is wearing a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoodie]hoodie[/url].

A hoodie is a sweatshirt with a hood. The characteristic design includes large frontal pockets, a hood, and (usually) a drawstring to adjust the hood opening. They are sometimes worn with sweatpants.

Some hoodies have zippers on them to allow easy removal much like a jacket. These hoodies are sometimes called zip-up hoodies.

This character is [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/timid]timid[/url].
A timid character is someone who is lacking in courage or confidence in everyday interactions.

They usually will face the challange if there are enough reasons to do so (like saving their friend, or won't watch any scary movie if it's not a popular film that will help you to blend in), but they scare themselves to death when facing the thing. Popular example would be Niimi Sora.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qipao]chinese dress[/url].

The cheongsam is a body-hugging (modified in Shanghai) one-piece Chinese dress for women; the male version is the changshan.

The stylish and often tight-fitting cheongsam that is most often associated with today was created in the 1920s in Shanghai and was made fashionable by socialites and upperclass women.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shawl]shawl[/url].

A shawl is a simple item of clothing, loosely worn over the shoulders, upper body and arms, sometimes also over the head.

It is usually a rectangular or square piece of cloth, that is often folded to make a triangle but can also be triangular in shape. Other shapes include oblong shawls.

These are the traits about the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Footwear]footwear[/url] characters are seen wearing.\n\nFootwear consists of garments worn on the feet, for fashion, protection against the environment, and adornment.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandal_%28footwear%29]sandals[/url].

Sandals are an open type of outdoor footwear, consisting of a sole held to the wearer's foot by straps or thongs passing over the instep and generally, but not always, around the ankle.

While the distinction between sandals and other types of footwear can sometimes be blurry (as in the case of huaraches—the woven leather footwear seen in Mexico), the common understanding is that a sandal leaves most or all of the foot exposed.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence]artificial intelligence[/url].

Artificial intelligence is the intelligence of machines and the branch of computer science that aims to create it.

AI textbooks define the field as "the study and design of intelligent agents" where an intelligent agent is a system that perceives its environment and takes actions that maximize its chances of success.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robot]robot[/url].

A robot is a mechanical intelligent agent which can perform tasks on its own, or with guidance. The term robot can also apply to a virtual agent. In practice it is usually an electro-mechanical machine which is guided by computer or electronic programming.

This trait is intended for mechanical machine bodies with artificial intelligences and should not be mixed with cyborgs which are part human part machine.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyborg]cyborg[/url].

A cyborg is a being with both biological and artificial (e.g. electronic, mechanical or robotic) parts.

Fictional cyborgs are portrayed as a synthesis of organic and synthetic parts, and frequently pose the question of difference between human and machine as one concerned with morality, free will, and empathy.

Real cyborgs are more frequently people who use cybernetic technology to repair or overcome the physical and mental constraints of their bodies.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guide]guide[/url].\n\nA guide is a person who leads anyone through unknown or unmapped country. This includes a guide of the real world (such as someone who conducts travellers and tourists through a place of interest), as well as a person who leads someone to more abstract places (such as to knowledge or wisdom).

This character suffers from a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_disorder]mental disorder[/url].

A mental disorder is a psychological or behavioral pattern generally associated with subjective distress or disability that occurs in an individual, and which is not a part of normal development or culture. 

A few mental disorders are diagnosed based on the harm to others, regardless of the subject's perception of distress. Over a third of people in most countries report meeting criteria for the major categories at some point in their lives.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infection]infected[/url] with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virus]virus[/url].

An infection is the colonization of a host organism by parasite species. Infecting parasites seek to use the host's resources to reproduce, often resulting in disease.

A virus is a small infectious agent that can replicate only inside the living cells of organisms. Most viruses are too small to be seen directly with a light microscope.

These are the traits for the notable [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fashion]fashion styles[/url] that character's clothing belong to.\n\nFashion, a general term for a currently popular style or practice, especially in clothing, foot wear or accessories. Fashion references to anything that is the current trend in look and dress up of a person.
