A regulation basketball hoop consists of a rim 45.7cm in diameter and 3.05m high mounted to a backboard. A team can score a field goal by shooting the ball through the hoop during regular play. A field goal scores two points for the shooting team if a player is touching or closer to the hoop than the three-point line, and three points (a "3 pointer") if the player is "outside" the three-point line. The team with more points at the end of the game wins, but additional time (overtime) may be issued when the game ends with a tie. The ball can be advanced on the court by bouncing it while walking or running (dribbling) or passing it to a teammate. It is a violation (traveling) to walk with the ball, carry it, or to double dribble (to hold the ball and then resume dribbling).

This character is or acts like a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomboy]tomboy[/url].\n\nA tomboy is a girl who exhibits some characteristics and or behavior considered typical of the gender role of a boy, including the wearing of typically masculine-oriented types of clothes and engaging in games and activities that are often physical in nature, and which are considered in many cultures to be the domain of boys.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naive]naive[/url].\n\nNaive refers to someone having or showing a lack of experience, understanding or sophistication, someone having or showing unaffected simplicity of nature or absence of artificiality.

This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whistle]whistle[/url].

A whistle or call is a simple aerophone, an instrument which produces sound from a stream of forced air. It may be mouth-operated, or powered by air pressure, steam, or other means. Whistles vary in size from a small slide whistle or nose flute type to a large multi-piped church organ.

When carried by characters in visual novels, whistles are typically the small variety, often worn around the neck.

This character becomes the victim of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rape[/url] on a route that is not of his/her own.\n\nThis means that while playing the route of this character the rape scenes involving this character can be avoided, but not on other routes such as the routes for other characters and "evil routes".

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rapes[/url] one or more of game's other characters during some specific routes.\n\nThis means that while playing some routes, this character will be the perpetrator of rape(s), while on other routes not committing such crimes.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assault]assaults[/url] another character.

Assault is a crime of violence against another person. The specific meaning of assault varies between countries, but can refer to an act that causes another to apprehend immediate and personal violence, or in the more limited sense of a threat of violence caused by an immediate show of force.

Assault is often defined to include not only violence, but any intentional physical contact with another person without their consent.

This trait is intended to be used in situations that the victim can't or doesn't fight back, at least on an equal level to make the situation more of a fight then an attack. In the other case, please use the Fighting trait.

This character recently [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academic_transfer]transferred[/url] into his/her current school.

College transfer is the movement of students from one higher education institution to another and the process by which academic credits are accepted or not accepted by a receiving institution.

However, transferring can be done by students at schools of any level of education, high schools being the most commonly in visual novels. Younger students may transfer because of a parent's job changing to a new area, but in visual novels it's often the result of the student's personal, and often secret or mysterious, circumstances.
This character is the non-blood-related daughter of a character in this game.\n\nThis may be the result of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adoption]adoption[/url] or something similar.
This character is the non-blood-related son of a character in this game.\n\nThis may be the result of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adoption]adoption[/url] or something similar.

The character is a patriot, a person who vigorously supports his country and its way of life.\n\n[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patriotism]Patriotism[/url] is a devotion to one's country. In a generalized sense applicable to all countries and peoples, patriotism is a devotion to one's country for no other reason than being a citizen of that country.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kidnapping]kidnapping[/url].\n\nIn criminal law, kidnapping is the taking away or transportation of a person against the person's will, usually to hold the person in false imprisonment, a confinement without legal authority. This may be done for ransom or in furtherance of another crime, or in connection with a child custody dispute.
This character has a hairstyle that hides one or both of his/her eyes. This method of hiding the eyes can also be the result of hair and shadows working together.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychologist]psychologist[/url].

Psychologist is a professional or academic title used by individuals who are either:
*Clinical professionals who work with patients in a variety of therapeutic contexts (contrast with psychiatrists, who typically provide medical interventions and drug therapies, as opposed to analysis and counseling).
*Social scientists conducting psychological research or teaching psychology in a college or university;
*Academic professionals who apply psychological research, theories and techniques to "real-world" problems, questions and issues in business, industry, or government.

The character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stalking]stalking[/url].

Stalking is a term commonly used to refer to unwanted, obsessive attention by individuals (and sometimes groups of people) to others.
Stalking can be defined as the willful and repeated following, watching, and / or harassing of another person. Most of the time, the purpose of stalking is to attempt to force a relationship with someone who is unwilling or otherwise unavailable. Unlike other crimes, which usually involve one act, stalking is a series of actions that occur over a period of time. Although stalking is illegal, the actions that contribute to stalking are legal, such as gathering information, calling someone on the phone, sending gifts, emailing or instant messaging. Such actions by themselves are not usually abusive, but can become abusive when frequently repeated over time.

This character returns from the death, in other words gets [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resurrection]resurrected[/url].

Resurrection refers to the literal coming back to life of the biologically dead. It is used both with respect to particular individuals or the belief in a General Resurrection of the dead at the end of the world. The General Resurrection is featured prominently in Jewish, Christian, and Muslim scriptures. The death and resurrection of Jesus is the central focus of Christianity.

The term, while acceptable in certain religious and spiritual contexts, is typically not used in medical circles to describe the return to life of one who was clinically dead, although rare extreme cases are properly classified scientifically as examples of the 'Lazarus syndrome', a term originating from the Biblical resurrection story.

This character is seen with a musical instrument.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Musical_instrument]musical instrument[/url] is a device created or adapted for the purpose of making musical sounds.

In principle, any object that produces sound can serve as a musical instrument—it is through purpose that the object becomes a musical instrument.

This character is seen with a bass guitar.

The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bass_guitar]bass guitar[/url] is a stringed instrument played primarily with the fingers or thumb (by plucking, slapping, popping, tapping, or thumping), or by using a pick.

The bass guitar is similar in appearance and construction to an electric guitar, but with a longer neck and scale length, and four, five, or six strings. The four-string bass—by far the most common—is usually tuned the same as the double bass, which corresponds to pitches one octave lower than the four lower strings of a guitar (E, A, D, and G).

The bass guitar is a transposing instrument, as it is notated in bass clef an octave higher than it sounds (as is the double bass) to avoid excessive ledger lines. Like the electric guitar, the bass guitar is plugged into an amplifier and speaker for live performances.

This character is seen with a guitar.

The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guitar]guitar[/url] is a plucked string instrument, usually played with fingers or a pick. The guitar consists of a body with a rigid neck to which the strings, generally six in number, are attached.

Guitars are traditionally constructed of various woods and strung with animal gut or, more recently, with either nylon or steel strings. Some modern guitars are made of polycarbonate materials.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_worker]social worker[/url].

Social work is a professional and academic discipline committed to the pursuit of social welfare, social change and social justice. The field works towards research and practice to improve the quality of life and to the development of the potential of each individual, group and community of a society.

Social workers perform interventions through research, policy, community organizing, direct practice and teaching. Research is often focused on areas such as human development, social policy, public administration, program evaluation and international and community development.

This character is seen with an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guitar]electric guitar[/url].

Electric guitars, introduced in the 1930s, rely on an amplifier that can electronically manipulate tone. Early amplified guitars employed a hollow body, but a solid body was found more suitable.

Electric guitars have had a continuing profound influence on popular culture. Guitars are recognized as a primary instrument in genres such as blues, bluegrass, country, flamenco, jazz, jota, mariachi, reggae, rock, soul, and many forms of pop.

This character carries or owns and cares for a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plant]flower or plant of some sort[/url].

Plants are living organisms belonging to the kingdom Plantae. They include familiar organisms such as trees, flowers, herbs, bushes, grasses, vines, ferns, mosses, and green algae.

This trait is intended for characters having a specific plant under their care as an item associated with that character. It should not be used for characters taking care of a garden since that wouldn't be an item.

This character is considered a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamato_nadeshiko]Yamato Nadeshiko[/url], a traditional ideal Japanese woman.\n\nYamato Nadeshiko is a Japanese term meaning "personification of an idealized Japanese woman", "ideal" in the historical context of the patriarchal, traditional culture of Japan.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bandana]bandanna[/url].

A bandana is a type of large, usually colorful, kerchief, usually worn on the head or around the neck of a person or pet.

Bandannas are frequently printed in a paisley pattern and most often used to hold hair back, either as a fashionable head accessory, or for practical purposes.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bassist]bass player[/url].\n\nA bassist is a musician who plays a bass instrument such as a double bass, bass guitar, keyboard bass or a low brass instrument such as a tuba or sousaphone. Different musical genres tend to be associated with one or more of these instruments. Since the 1960s, the electric bass is the standard bass instrument for rock and roll, jazz fusion (and occasionally other forms of jazz), heavy metal, country, reggae and pop music. The double bass is the standard bass instrument for classical music, bluegrass, and Swing-era and Bebop-era jazz. Low brass instruments such as the tuba or sousaphone are the standard bass instrument in Dixieland and New Orleans-style jazz bands.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bokken]bokken[/url].

A bokken is a Japanese wooden sword used for training, usually the size and shape of a katana, but sometimes shaped like other swords, such as the wakizashi and tantou.

Some ornamental bokken are decorated with mother-of-pearl work and elaborate carvings.

Bokutou should not be confused with shinai, a sword made of bamboo that is used for practice in kendo.

This character has a [url=http://ninja.wikia.com/wiki/Shikomizue]shikomizue[/url].

The shikomizue is a Japanese concealed sword disguised as a cane or walking stick, similar to the swordstick.

It was used mostly by the ninja. It is most famous for its use by the fictional swordmaster Zatoichi.

trait_alias:
Shokushu Goukan
Tail Rape
Appendage Rape
触手強姦
description: The character is a subject of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tentacle_erotica]tentacle rape[/url]. Demon tails and whatnot are also covered by this trait.\n\nTentacle rape or shokushu goukan is a concept found in some horror hentai titles, where various tentacled creatures (usually fictional monsters) rape or otherwise penetrate women, anthropomorphous creatures, Futanari and, less commonly, men.

This character has some shuriken.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shuriken]shuriken[/url] is a traditional Japanese concealed weapon that was generally used for throwing, and sometimes stabbing or slashing.

They are sharpened hand-held blades made from a variety of everyday items such as needles, nails, and knives, as well as coins, washers, and other flat plates of metal.

This character becomes the victim of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rape[/url] perpetrated by a female character of the story.\n\nIn criminal law, rape is a type of sexual assault usually involving sexual intercourse, which is initiated by one or more persons against another person without that person's consent.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trident]trident[/url].

A trident is a three-pronged spear. It is used for spear fishing and was also a military weapon.

Tridents are featured widely in mythical, historical and modern culture. The sea god Poseidon or Neptune is classically depicted bearing a trident. Note that a trident is not a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pitchfork]pitchfork[/url].

As a weapon, the trident was prized for its long reach and ability to trap other long-weapons between prongs to disarm their wielder. In Ancient Rome, in a parody of fishing, tridents were famously used by a type of gladiator called a retiarius or "net fighter". The retiarius was traditionally pitted against a secutor, and cast a net to wrap his adversary and then used the trident to kill him.

The character uses a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naginata]Naginata[/url].

A pole weapon that was traditionally used in Japan by members of the samurai class, naginata consists of a wooden shaft with a curved blade on the end; it is similar to the Chinese Guan Dao or European glaive or Russian sovnya. Usually it also had a sword-like guard (tsuba) between the blade and shaft.

The naginata has become associated in modern Japan as a woman's weapon as it is studied by women more than men, whereas in Europe and Australia naginata is practiced predominantly by men—this is however simply a reflection of the martial arts demographics of Europe, where there is no historical association—as there is in Japan—that naginatajutsu is for women.

This character becomes the victim of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rape[/url], but this event can be avoided by making better choices or succeeding better in earlier segments of the story.

In criminal law, rape is a type of sexual assault usually involving sexual intercourse, which is initiated by one or more persons against another person without that person's consent.

This trait itself is intended to be used in situations where player can avoid the rape scene altogether. For situations that fit better to the child traits, like the ability to interrupt a rape scene in motion, use the related trait, [url=http://vndb.org/i543]Rape Attempt[/url] in this example, instead.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helmet]helmet[/url].

A helmet is a form of protective gear worn on the head to protect it from injuries.

Ceremonial or symbolic helmets (e.g., English policeman's helmet) without protective function are sometimes used. The oldest known use of helmets was by Assyrian soldiers in 900BC, who wore thick leather or bronze helmets to protect the head from blunt object and sword blows and arrow strikes in combat. Soldiers still wear helmets, now often made from lightweight plastic materials.

In civilian life, helmets are used for recreational activities and sports (e.g., jockeys in horse racing, American football, ice hockey, cricket, and rock climbing); dangerous work activities (e.g., construction, mining, riot police); and transportation (e.g., Motorcycle helmets and bicycle helmets). Since the 1990s, most helmets are made from resin or plastic, which may be reinforced with fibers such as aramids.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hairpin_(fashion)]hair pin[/url].

A hairpin is a long device used to hold a person's hair in place. The hairpin may be decorative and encrusted with jewels and ornaments, or it may be utiliarian, and designed to be almost invisible while holding a hairstyle in place.

Some hairpins are a single straight pin, but modern versions are more likely to be constructed from different lengths of wire that are bent in half with a u-shaped end and a few kinks along the two opposite portions. The finished pin may vary from two to six inches in final length. The length of the wires enables placement in several styles of hairdos to hold the style in place. The kinks enable retaining the pin during normal movements.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunglasses]sunglasses[/url].\n\nSunglasses are a form of protective eyewear designed primarily to prevent bright sunlight and high-energy visible light from damaging or discomforting the eyes. They also help cancel out harmful UV rays from the sun. They can sometimes also function as a visual aid, as variously termed spectacles or glasses exist, featuring lenses that are colored, polarized or darkened.

This character is considered [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Strange]strange[/url] by the people around.\n\nA strange character speaks and behaves in a different way then the surrounding people, who consider him/her off, odd, weird or even repulsive/attractive.

This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diary]diary[/url].

A diary is a record (originally in handwritten format) with discrete entries arranged by date reporting on what has happened over the course of a day or other period. Diaries undertaken for institutional purposes play a role in many aspects of human civilization, including government records, business ledgers and military records.

Generally the term is today employed for personal diaries, in which the writer may detail more personal information and normally intended to remain private or to have a limited circulation amongst friends or relatives. The writer may also describe recent events in his/her personal diary. The word "journal" may be sometimes used for "diary," but generally one writes daily in a diary, whereas journal-writing can be less frequent.

This character practices [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Figure_skating]figure skating[/url].

Figure skating is an Olympic sport in which individuals, pairs, or groups perform spins, jumps, footwork and other intricate and challenging moves on ice skates.

Figure skaters compete at various levels from beginner up to the Olympic level (senior), and at local, national, and international competitions. The International Skating Union (ISU) regulates international figure skating judging and competitions. Figure skating is an official event in the Winter Olympic Games.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leotard]leotard[/url].

A leotard is a skin-tight one-piece garment that covers the torso but leaves the legs free. 

Leotards are worn by acrobats, gymnasts, dancers, figure skaters, athletes, actors, and circus performers both as practice garments and performance costumes. They are often worn together with tights or sometimes bike shorts. There are sleeveless, short-sleeved and long-sleeved leotards. A variation is the unitard, which also covers the legs. As a casual garment, a leotard can be worn with a belt.

Leotards are entered through the neck, in contrast to bodysuits which generally have snaps at the crotch, allowing the garment to be pulled on over the head. Scoop-necked leotards have wide neck openings and are held in place by the elasticity of the garment. Others are crew necked or polo necked and close at the back of the neck with a zipper or snaps.

This character is a victim of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kidnapping]kidnapping[/url].\n\nIn criminal law, kidnapping is the taking away or transportation of a person against the person's will, usually to hold the person in false imprisonment, a confinement without legal authority. This may be done for ransom or in furtherance of another crime, or in connection with a child custody dispute.
This character engages in an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incest]incestous[/url] relationship.\n\nIncest is sexual intercourse between close relatives.

This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swimming_float]swimming board[/url].

Swimming boards are a flotation aid used to develop a swimmer's kicking action. They can be used on all strokes but are primarily used on Freestyle, Butterfly stroke and Breaststroke.

Swimmers of all ability can use them. Young swimmers can develop their kicking action while elite swimmers can refine their kick. They are also used to strengthen a swimmers legs.

Swimming boards should not be mixed with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surfboard]surfboards[/url].

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baseball_cap]baseball cap[/url].\n\nA baseball cap is a type of soft cap with a long, stiff brim that may either be curved or flat. The front of the cap typically contains designs or logos of sports teams (namely baseball teams). The back of the cap may be "fitted" to the wearer's head size or it may have a plastic, Velcro, or elastic adjuster so that it can be quickly adjusted to fit different wearers.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baseball_bat]baseball bat[/url].\n\nA baseball bat is a smooth wooden or metal club used in the game of baseball to hit the ball after the ball is thrown by the pitcher. It is no more than 12cm in diameter at the thickest part and no more than 100cm in length. It typically weighs no more than 1 kg.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Club_%28weapon%29]club[/url].

A club is among the simplest of all weapons. A club is essentially a short staff, or stick, usually made of wood, and wielded as a weapon since prehistoric times.

Most clubs are small enough to be swung in one hand although two-handed variants are known. Various kinds of clubs are used in martial arts and other specialized fields, including the law-enforcement baton. The military mace is a more sophisticated descendant of the club, typically made of metal and featuring a spiked, knobbed or flanged head attached to a haft.

The wounds inflicted by a club are generally known as bludgeoning or blunt-force trauma injuries.

This character is seen with a  [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suitcase]suitcase[/url].\n\nA suitcase is a general term for a distinguishable form of luggage. It is often a somewhat flat, rectangular-shaped bag with rounded/square corners, either metal, hard plastic or made of cloth, vinyl or leather that more or less keeps its shape. It has a carrying handle on one side and is used mainly for transporting clothes and other possessions during trips. It opens on hinges like a door. Suitcases lock with keys or a combination.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hafu]half Japanese[/url].

The word hafu (ハーフ) is used in Japanese to refer to somebody who is biracial, i.e. ethnically half-Japanese. The label emerged in the 1970s in Japan and is now the most commonly used label and preferred term of self-definition.

The word hafu comes from the English word "half" indicating half foreign-ness.

This character is a [url=http://jisho.org/words?jap=%E7%9C%8B%E6%9D%BF%E5%A8%98&eng=&dict=edict]kanban musume[/url].\n\nThis term (看板娘) traditionally refers to a pretty girl who attracts customers by working at her parents' shop. It generally refers to any girl who works at a shop run by her family.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deity]deity[/url]

A deity is a recognized preternatural or supernatural immortal being, who may be thought of as holy, divine, or sacred, held in high regard, and respected by believers, often religiously referred to as a god.

Deities are depicted in a variety of forms, but are also frequently expressed as having human form. Some faiths and traditions consider it blasphemous to imagine or depict the deity as having any concrete form. They are usually immortal, and are commonly assumed to have personalities and to possess consciousness, intellects, desires, and emotions similar to those of humans. Such natural phenomena as lightning, floods, storms, other 'acts of God', and miracles are attributed to them, and they may be thought to be the authorities or controllers of various aspects of human life (such as birth or the afterlife).

This character has real [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moe_anthropomorphism]kemonomimi[/url], animal ears.

Kemonomimi, literally meaning "animal ears", is based on the the concept of drawing animals as bishoujo or having bishoujo wear or have animal accessories (such as ears or tails). Catgirls are the most prolific in this category, although bunnygirls, foxgirls, and dog girls are also common.

Kemonomimi characters typically appear human except for added animal-like qualities.

This trait is intended for humanoid characters with actual animal ears. And it should not be mixed with the other two kemonomimi traits:
Hair > [url=http://vndb.org/i31]Kemonomimi[/url] refers to hair styles that look like animal ears and
Clothes > [url=http://vndb.org/i153]Kemonomimi Headband[/url] refers to hairbands and similar accessories that look like animal ears.

This character reacts like a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsukkomi]tsukkomi[/url].

In a Japanese comedy duo, the tsukkomi (突っ込み) refers to the role one comedian plays in "butting in" and correcting the errors of the other (called the boke). It is common for tsukkomi to berate boke and hit them on the head with a swift smack; traditionally, tsukkomi often carried a fan as a multi-purpose prop, one of the uses for which was to hit the boke with. Boke and tsukkomi are loosely equivalent to the roles of "funny man" or "comic" (boke) and "straight man" (tsukkomi) in the comedy duos of western culture.

In stories, tsukkomi refers to a typically level-headed character who habitually engages in no-nonsense critical commentary on the behavior of funny characters.
This character is the non-blood-related father of a character in this game.\n\nThis may be the result of an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adoption]adoption[/url] or something similar.

This character engages in the acts of bondage during sexual scenes. Use this trait for the unrestrained partner and use i1643 on the partner in bondage.\n\n[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bondage_(sexual)]Bondage[/url] is the use of restraints for the sexual pleasure of the parties involved. It may be used in its own right, as in the case of rope bondage and breast bondage, or as part of sexual activity or BDSM activity.

This character is the member of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gang]school gang[/url].\n\nUsually school gangs only violate the school rules and does not require actual law enforcement such as police to intervene. But there are times their activities step outside the school, like fights with other gangs, illegal races and such. In those situations police would take over dealing with them.

This character is the leader of a school [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gang]gang[/url].\n\nA gang leader is the person who has the most authority in a gang. In japan, gang-leaders are usually called as Aniki/Aneki (meaning older brother/sister) by the other gang members.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gang]gang[/url] member.

A gang is a group of people, through the organization, formation, and establishment of an assemblage, share a common identity. In current usage it typically denotes a criminal organization or else a criminal affiliation. 

The word gang often carries a negative connotation; however, within a gang which defines itself in opposition to mainstream norms, members may adopt the phrase as a statement of identity or defiance.

This trait is intended to be used for small often unorganized gangs, for the ones that are big and organized like Mafia and Yakuza use the appropriate trait instead.

This character is the leader of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gang]gang[/url].\n\nA gang leader is the person who has the most authority in a gang. In japan, gang-leaders are usually called as Aniki/Aneki (meaning older brother/sister) by the other gang members.

The character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/self-sacrifice]self-sacrifice[/url].\n\nSelf-sacrifice means sacrificing one's personal interests or well-being for the sake of others or for a cause, the giving up of one's own benefit, especially giving up one's life, for the good of others.

This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wheelchair]wheelchair[/url].\n\nA wheelchair is a chair with wheels, designed to be a replacement for walking. The device comes in variations where it is propelled by motors or by the seated occupant turning the rear wheels by hand. Often there are handles behind the seat for someone else to do the pushing. Wheelchairs are used by people for whom walking is difficult or impossible due to illness (physiological or physical), injury, or disability.

The character is a subject of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disability]disability[/url]. The disability may be physical, cognitive, mental, sensory, emotional, developmental or some combination of these.\n\nDisabilities is an umbrella term, covering impairments, activity limitations, and participation restrictions. An impairment is a problem in body function or structure; an activity limitation is a difficulty encountered by an individual in executing a task or action; while a participation restriction is a problem experienced by an individual in involvement in life situations.
This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death]dies[/url], but it is possible to avoid this outcome by satisfying some game conditions or make choices leading otherwise.

trait_alias:
Rape Dream
Rape Nightmare
Rape Fantasy
Rape Delusion
Rape Premonition
Rape Illusion
description: This character becomes the victim of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rape[/url]. But this event, usually later, is revealed to be not real. It can be a dream/nightmare, fantasy, delusion, illusion, premonition etc.\n\nIn criminal law, rape is a type of sexual assault usually involving sexual intercourse, which is initiated by one or more persons against another person without that person's consent.

The character wears an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overall]overall[/url].\n\nAn overall, coverall, over all, or dungarees, is a type of garment which is usually used as protective clothing when working. Some people call an overall a "pair of overalls" by analogy with "pair of trousers".

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treason]treason[/url].\n\nIn law, treason is the crime that covers some of the more serious acts of betrayal of one's sovereign or nation. Historically, treason also covered the murder of specific social superiors, such as the murder of a husband by his wife. Treason against the king was known as high treason and treason against a lesser superior was petit-treason. A person who commits treason is known in law as a traitor.

The character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genius]genius[/url], in one field at least if not many.\n\nGenius is something or someone embodying exceptional intellectual ability, creativity, or originality, typically to a degree that is associated with the achievement of unprecedented insight.

This character is seen with a (pair of) [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binoculars]binocular(s)[/url].\n\nBinoculars are a pair of identical or mirror-symmetrical telescopes mounted side-by-side and aligned to point accurately in the same direction, allowing the viewer to use both eyes (binocular vision) when viewing distant objects. Most are sized to be held using both hands, although sizes vary widely from opera glasses to large pedestal mounted military models.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shopkeeper]shopkeeper[/url].

A shopkeeper is an individual who owns a shop. Generally, shop employees are not shopkeepers, but are often incorrectly referred to as shopkeepers.

Today, a shopkeeper is usually referred to as a manager, though this term could apply to larger firms (ie: multiple shops).

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technician]technician[/url].

A technician is a worker in a field of technology who is proficient in the relevant skills and techniques, with a relatively practical understanding of the theoretical principles.

Experienced technicians in a specific tool domain typically have intermediate understanding of theory and expert proficiency in technique. As such, technicians are generally much better versed in technique compared to average layman and even general professionals in that field of technology.

The character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_travel]time travel[/url].\n\nTime travel is the concept of moving between different points in time in a manner analogous to moving between different points in space, either sending objects (or in some cases just information) backwards in time to some moment before the present, or sending objects forward from the present to the future without the need to experience the intervening period (at least not at the normal rate).

The character is a subject of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_loop]time loop[/url].\n\nA time loop or temporal loop is a common plot device in science fiction (especially in universes where time travel is commonplace) in which time runs normally for a set period (usually a day or a few hours) but then skips back like a broken record. When the time loop "resets", the memories of most characters are reset (i.e. they forget all that happened).

The character is a subject of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arranged_marriage]arranged marriage[/url], a marriage arranged by someone other than the couple getting wedded.\n\nAn arranged marriage is one in which someone other than the couple getting married makes the selection of the persons to be wed, curtailing or avoiding the process of courtship. The match could be selected by parents, a matchmaking agent, matrimonial site, or a trusted third party. In many communities, priests or religious leaders as well as relatives or family friends play a major role in matchmaking.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death]dies[/url] on a route that is not of his/her own.\n\nThis means that while playing the route of this character the scenes involving his/her death can be avoided, but not on other routes such as the routes for other characters and "evil routes".

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religion]religious[/url] activities.

The game may feature scenes of this character spending time in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prayer]prayer[/url], [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confession]confession[/url], [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sacrifice]sacrifice[/url], etc.

Or this character may have lengthy religious discussions that are promotional in nature. In order to recruit other characters to his/her religion, or "save them" in a sense.
This character wears one or more rings.\n\nA [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ring]ring[/url] (jewellery) is a decorative ornament worn on fingers, toes, or around the arm or neck.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Record_producer]record producer[/url]

A record producer is an individual working within the music industry, whose job it is to oversee and manage the recording (i.e. "production") of an artist's music. A producer has many roles that may include, but are not limited to, gathering ideas for the project, selecting songs and/or musicians, coaching the artist and musicians in the studio, controlling the recording sessions, and supervising the entire process through mixing and mastering. Producers also often take on a wider entrepreneurial role, with responsibility for the budget, schedules, and negotiations.

With today's relatively easy access to technology, an alternative to the record producer just mentioned, is the so called 'bedroom producer'. With today's technological advances, it is very easy for a producer to achieve high quality tracks without the use of a single instrument. Many established artists take this approach.

This character gets [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/hospitalized]hospitalized[/url].\n\nHospitalization is the period during which a person is hospitalized, to be placed in a hospital for medical care or observation.

This character is voluntarily involved in sexual activities with people or creatures with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tentacle_erotica]tentacles[/url].\n\nA [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tentacle]tentacle[/url] is a flexible, mobile, elongated organ present in some species of animals, most of them invertebrates.

This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruler]ruler[/url].\n\nA ruler is an instrument used in geometry, technical drawing, printing and engineering/building to measure distances and/or to rule straight lines. Strictly speaking, the ruler is essentially a straightedge used to rule lines, but typically the ruler also contains calibrated lines to measure distances.

The protagonist of this game is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Werewolf]werewolf[/url].\n\nA werewolf, also known as a lycanthrope, is a mythological or folkloric human with the ability to shapeshift into an anthropomorphic wolf-like creature, either purposely, by being bitten by another werewolf, or after being placed under a curse.

This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lollipop]lollipop[/url].\n\nA lollipop is a type of confectionery consisting mainly of hardened, flavored sucrose with corn syrup mounted on a stick and intended for sucking or licking. They are available in many flavors and shapes.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monocle]monocle[/url].\n\nA monocle is a type of corrective lens used to correct or enhance the vision in only one eye. It consists of a circular lens, generally with a wire ring around the circumference that can be attached to a string. The other end of the string is then connected to the wearer's clothing to avoid losing the monocle.

This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smoking_pipe_%28tobacco%29]smoking pipe[/url].\n\nA smoking pipe for tobacco smoking typically consists of a chamber (the bowl) for the combustion of tobacco and a thin stem (shank) ending in a mouthpiece (the bit). Pipes can range from the very simple machine-made briar pipe to highly-prized handmade and artful implements created by renowned pipe-makers which are often very expensive collector's items.

This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toy]toy[/url].\n\nA toy is any object that can be used for play. Toys are usually associated with children and pets. Playing with toys is training the young for their social role. Many items are designed to serve as toys, but goods produced for other purposes can also be used. Some toys are produced primarily as collector's items and are intended for display only.

trait_alias: Parallel universe travel\nAlternate reality travel\nDimension travel
description: This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parallel_universe_%28fiction%29]travels dimensions[/url] throughout the story, at least once. Please use [url=https://vndb.org/i696]Time Travel[/url] if it's strictly time travel though.\n\nA parallel universe or alternative reality is a hypothetical self-contained separate reality coexisting with one's own. While the terms "parallel universe" and "alternative reality" are generally synonymous and can be used interchangeably in most cases, there is sometimes an additional connotation implied with the term "alternative reality" that implies that the reality is a variant of our own. The term "parallel universe" is more general, without any connotations implying a relationship, or lack of relationship, with our own universe.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elf]elf[/url].

An elf (plural elves) is a fantasy and mythological being. The elves were originally thought of as a race of divine beings (wights, vættir) endowed with magical powers, which they use both for the benefit and the injury of mankind. In medieval Norse mythology, they appear to have been divided into light elves and dark elves, difficult to delineate from the Æsir (gods) on one hand and the dvergar (dwarves) on the other.

In early modern and modern folklore, they become associated with the fairies of Romance folklore and assume a diminutive size, often living mainly in forests but also underground in hills or rocks, or in wells and springs. 19th-century Romanticism attempted to restore them to full stature making them men and women of great beauty. They were often depicted as very young, probably adolescents as male elves lack facial hair.

From their depiction in Romanticism, elves entered the 20th-century high fantasy genre in the wake of the published work of J. R. R. Tolkien (especially the posthumous publication of his Silmarillion where Tolkien's treatment of the relation of light elves, dark elves and dwarves is made explicit).

This trait is intended to be used for LotR inspired elves that are human-like. For the tiny flying ones like [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tinkerbell]Tinker Bell[/url] use [url=http://vndb.org/i516]Fairy[/url].

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fur]fur[/url] covering most or all of their body.\n\nFur is a synonym for hair, used more in reference to non-human animals, usually mammals; particularly those with extensive body hair coverage. The term is sometimes used to refer to the body hair of an animal as a complete coat, also known as the "pelage". Fur is also used to refer to animal pelts which have been processed into leather with the hair still attached. The words fur or furry are also used, more casually, to refer to hair-like growths or formations; particularly when the subject being referred to exhibits a dense coat of fine, soft "hairs".

This character is not a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human]human[/url], nor a member of any species listed under [url=http://vndb.org/i408]Nature[/url].\n\nThis trait is intended to be used for characters that are revealed to be something else than a human, or a member of any of the existing traits under [url=http://vndb.org/i408]Nature[/url]. If the species is something that can be described easily, something relatively common, make a new trait for it and use this trait mainly for things that are not easy to identify, things that are not explained.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Athletics_(sport)]athletics[/url], whether as a profession or as a hobby.\n\nAthletics is a collection of sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, and walking. The most common types of athletics competitions are track and field, road running, cross country running, and race walking.

This character is shown to be [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intelligence]intelligent[/url].\n\nSmart is used when referring to a person with good understanding or a high mental capacity, someone who is quick to comprehend.
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Undead]undead[/url].\n\nUndead is a term for beings that are deceased and yet behave as if alive.

trait_alias: Spirit of a deceased\nSoul of a deceased
description: This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghost]ghost[/url].\n\nIn traditional belief, a ghost is the soul or spirit of a deceased person or animal that can appear, in visible form or other manifestation, to the living. Descriptions of the apparition of ghosts vary widely: The mode of manifestation can range from an invisible presence to translucent or wispy shapes, to realistic, life-like visions. The deliberate attempt to contact the spirit of a deceased person is known as necromancy, or in spiritism as a séance.
This character loves to eat and is often, if not always, hungry.

trait_alias:
Shut-in
Recluse
Hikki
ひきこもり
引き籠もり
ヒッキー
description: This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hikikomori]hikikomori[/url], a person who refuses to leave their house or interact with people.\n\nHikikomori is a Japanese term to refer to the phenomenon of reclusive people who have chosen to withdraw from social life, often seeking extreme degrees of isolation and confinement because of various personal and social factors in their lives. The term hikikomori refers to both the sociological phenomenon in general as well as to people belonging to this societal group.

These are the traits for describing female characters "apparent" (*) breast sizes.

* Note that these traits only signify the physical appearance of breasts following the rules VNDB users have given themselves (rules are written inside traits description), and they might not reflect statements by story or artist.

The traits under "Apparent Breast Sizes" should be used for:
1) Females 
2) Traps
3) Reverse-traps 
4) Newhalves 
5) Futanaris 
6) Androgynous females
7) Characters whose sex/gender is unknown depending on the case
This character has small breasts or a flat chest.
This character has big breasts.

This character is unusually [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperactivity]energetic[/url].\n\nHyperactivity can be described as a physical state in which a person is abnormally active. The colloquial term hyper is used to describe someone who is in a hyperactive state.

This character acts like a doting, fawning parent towards another of the story characters. They may or may not be actual family members but "the taking under one's wing" and "protecting against dangers" are important parts of this behavior.\n\nThis trait is intended for mild cases which are most usually found in parents. Extreme cases of this behavior results in acting [url=http://vndb.org/i556]Possessive[/url], which is presented as a child trait to this.
This character wears a flower in their hair.\n\nSeparate from [url=https://vndb.org/i647]Flower / Plant[/url] which is a living flower or plant carried by the character.
The character has pink eye color.

trait_alias: Female to Male Penetration\nStraight stap-on sex
description: This character is subject to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pegging_%28sexual_practice%29]pegging[/url]. Apply this trait to the character being pegged, and apply [url=/i729]i729[/url] to the character wearing the strap-on.\n\nPegging is a sexual practice in which a woman penetrates a man's anus with a strap-on dildo.

description: This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pegging_%28sexual_practice%29]pegging[/url]. Apply this trait to the character wearing the strap-on, and apply [url=/i728]i728[/url] to the character being pegged.\n\nPegging is a sexual practice in which a woman penetrates a man's anus with a strap-on dildo.

This character walks around fully [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nudity]naked[/url].

Usually used to refer to characters not wearing any clothes.

This trait refers to characters walking around dressed in this sense, don't use it for characters who have naked sprites/tachies on rare occasions like sexual scenes, while most of the same time being clothed properly.

trait_alias: Eternally young\nOlder than they appear\nOlder Than They Look
description: This character is older than they appear to be.\n\nThis can be anything from a young adult that looks like a child, to someone that is centuries older than their appearance.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beauty_mark]beauty mark[/url].\n\nA beauty mark or beauty spot is a euphemism for a type of dark facial mole, so named because such birthmarks are sometimes considered an attractive feature. Moles of this type may also be located elsewhere on the body.

This character engages in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visual_Art]visual art[/url].\n\nThe visual arts are art forms that create works which are primarily visual in nature, such as ceramics, drawing, painting, sculpture, printmaking, design, crafts, and often modern visual arts (photography, video, and filmmaking) and architecture. These definitions should not be taken too strictly as many artistic disciplines (performing arts, conceptual art, textile arts) involve aspects of the visual arts as well as arts of other types. Also included within the visual arts are the applied arts such as industrial design, graphic design, fashion design, interior design and decorative art.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Painting]painting[/url].\n\nPainting is the practice of applying paint, pigment, color or other medium to a surface (support base). The application of the medium is commonly applied to the base with a brush but other objects can be used. In art, the term painting describes both the act and the result of the action. Paintings may have for their support such surfaces as walls, paper, canvas, wood, glass, lacquer, clay, copper or concrete, and may incorporate multiple other materials including sand, clay, paper, gold leaf as well as objects.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dog]dog[/url] or has dog-like physical features.\n\nThe dog is a domesticated form of the gray wolf, a member of the Canidae family of the order Carnivora. The term is used for both feral and pet varieties. Through selective breeding by humans, the dog has developed into hundreds of varied breeds, and shows more variation than any other land mammal.

This character is [url=http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/antisocial]antisocial[/url].\n\nDifferent from just being [url=http://vndb.org/i250]shy[/url] or [url=http://vndb.org/i249]reserved[/url], antisocial people are unwilling or unable to associate normally with other people. They may or may not be a [url=http://vndb.org/i720]hikikomori[/url].

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Futanari]futanari[/url].

Futanari have a mostly female body and female gender presentation, but possess both female and male genitalia (testicles are not always present). The character may be this way naturally or become futanari through magical or scientific means.

Please note that futanari and [URL=https://vndb.org/i2450]transwomen[/URL] are not the same as transwomen only have one set of genitalia.

This character wears one or more [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chain]chains[/url]. A chain is a series of connected links which are typically made of metal. Use this with the [url=http://vndb.org/i158]Necklace[/url] trait when the chain is worn around the neck.\n\nNot to be confused with the [url=http://vndb.org/i200]chain weapon[/url] trait, this is for chains worn, not used as weapons.
This character had previous sexual experiences before the game's story begins or still keeps an active sexual life. This trait is for characters that are not virgins when the story starts.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pompadour_(hairstyle)]pompadour hairstyle[/url].\n\nPompadour is a style of hair with a large portion sticking out in front. The name comes from Madame de Pompadour. In Japanese popular culture, the pompadour is a stereotypical hairstyle often worn by gang members, thugs, members of the yakuza and bousouzoku, and other similar groups such as the yankii (high-school hoodlums).

This character draws manga.\n\n[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mangaka]Mangaka[/url] (漫画家) is the Japanese word for a comic artist or cartoonist. Outside of Japan, manga usually refers to a Japanese comic book and mangaka refers to the author of the manga, who is usually Japanese. As of 2006, about 3000 professional mangaka were working in Japan.

This character carries a video camera.\n\nA [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_camera]video camera[/url] is a camera used for electronic motion picture acquisition, initially developed by the television industry but now common in other applications as well. The earliest video cameras were those of John Logie Baird, based on the electromechanical Nipkow disk and used by the BBC in experimental broadcasts through the 1930s. All-electronic designs based on the cathode ray tube, such as Vladimir Zworykin's Iconoscope and Philo T. Farnsworth's Image dissector, supplanted the Baird system by the 1940s and remained in wide use until the 1980s, when cameras based on solid-state image sensors such as CCDs (and later CMOS active pixel sensors) eliminated common problems with tube technologies such as image burn-in and made digital video workflow practical.

This character records a film, engages in filming.\n\nFilming is the process of creating a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Film]film[/url]. A film, also called a movie or motion picture, is a series of still or moving images. It is produced by recording photographic images with cameras, or by creating images using animation techniques or visual effects. The process of filmmaking has developed into an art form and industry.

This character makes an appearance in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Film]film[/url].\n\nA film, also called a movie or motion picture, is a series of still or moving images. It is produced by recording photographic images with cameras, or by creating images using animation techniques or visual effects. The process of filmmaking has developed into an art form and industry.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student_exchange_program]foreign exchange student[/url].\n\nA student exchange program is a program where students from secondary school or university choose to study abroad in partner institutions.
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_people]Chinese[/url].
This character's appearance can be changed by the player. Examples: changing clothing, hair color, eye color, skin tone, breast size, accessories worn, etc.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homosexuality]homosexual[/url]. They may not have any sexual scenes displaying this but it is a part of their character in the story.\n\nHomosexuality is romantic and/or sexual attraction between members of the same gender.
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blindfold]blindfold[/url], a piece of cloth that covers the eyes.

This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afro]afro[/url] hairstyle.\n\nAn afro, sometimes shortened to 'fro and also known as a "natural", is a hairstyle worn naturally by people with lengthy kinky hair texture or specifically styled in such a fashion by individuals with naturally curly or straight hair. The hairstyle is created by combing the hair away from the scalp, allowing the hair to extend out from the head in a large, rounded shape, much like a halo, cloud or ball.
This character is a native of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy]Italy[/url], or a person of Italian descent.
This character is a personification/embodiment of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celestial_body]celestial body[/url] (star, planet, etc.).

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exhibitionist]exhibitionist[/url].\n\nExhibitionism refers to exposing bare female breasts and/or buttocks of either a male or female. When genitalia is exposed the behavior is more commonly described as indecent exposure.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fox]fox[/url] or has fox-like physical features.

Fox is a common name for many species of omnivorous mammals belonging to the Canidae family. Foxes are small to medium-sized canids (slightly smaller than the medium-sized domestic dog), characterized by possessing a long narrow snout, and a bushy tail (or brush).

In japanese mythology, there are foxes with more than one tail. These are known as Kitsune are reputated to be mischievous spirits. This type of fox is common in Anime, Manga and all forms of Japanese media.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flirting]flirting[/url] with other characters.

Flirting is a playful, romantic or sexual overture by one person to another subtly indicating an interest in a deeper relationship with the other person, and can involve verbal communication as well as body language. Body language can include flicking the hair, eye contact, brief touching, open stances, proximity etc. Verbal communication of interest can include the vocal tone, such as pace, volume, intonation. Challenges (teasing, questions, qualifying, feigned disinterest) serve to increase tension, test intention and congruity.

Almost every VN has some romance and relationships, but rarely they do have actual flirting. Use this trait sparingly for only the ones that actually do.
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_people]British[/url].\n\nA citizen of the United Kingdom which consists of England, Scotland, Wales & Northern Ireland.
This character is of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germans]German[/url] descent.

This character is a practitioner of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wrestling]wrestling[/url].\n\nWrestling is a form of grappling type techniques such as clinch fighting, throws and take-downs, joint locks, pins and other grappling holds. A wrestling bout is a physical competition, between two (occasionally more) competitors or sparring partners, who attempt to gain and maintain a superior position. There are a wide range of styles with varying rules with both traditional historic and modern styles.

This character suffers a mental breakdown as a result of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychological_trauma]traumatic event[/url]. 

Psychological trauma is a type of damage to the psyche that occurs as a result of a traumatic event.

A traumatic event involves a single experience, or an enduring or repeating event or events, that completely overwhelm the individual's ability to cope or integrate the ideas and emotions involved with that experience. The sense of being overwhelmed can be delayed by weeks, years or even decades, as the person struggles to cope with the immediate circumstances. Psychological trauma can lead to serious long-term negative consequences that are often overlooked even by mental health professionals.

Trauma can be caused by a wide variety of events, but there are a few common aspects. There is frequently a violation of the person's familiar ideas about the world and of their human rights, putting the person in a state of extreme confusion and insecurity. This is also seen when people or institutions, depended on for survival, violate or betray or disillusion the person in some unforeseen way.

This character owns a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pet]pet[/url]. 

The character is solely responsible for the welfare of the animal/s in question.
As such, a companionship is formed.

The character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camera]camera[/url].

A camera is a device that records and stores images. These images may be still photographs or moving images such as videos or movies.

Use this trait for traditional style photo cameras whether or not they record video as well. And for more [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handycam#Handycam]handycam[/url] like cameras, use the child trait video camera.

The character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unpopularity]not very popular with others[/url].\n\nWhether it is at school, work, around the neighbourhood or anywhere else, this character lacks approval his/her from fellow beings.

This character carries and uses a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapier]rapier[/url]\n\nA rapier is a slender, sharply pointed sword, ideally used for thrusting attacks, used mainly in Early Modern Europe during the 16th and 17th centuries.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bow_tie]bow tie[/url].\n\nThe bow tie is a type of men's necktie. It consists of a ribbon of fabric tied around the collar in a symmetrical manner such that the two opposite ends form loops. Ready-tied bow ties are available, in which the distinctive bow is sewn into shape and the band around the neck incorporates a clip.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuff]cuffs[/url].

A cuff is an extra layer of fabric at the lower edge of the sleeve of a garment covering the arms.

Do not mix this with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handcuffs]handcuffs[/url].

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swim_cap]swim cap[/url].

Caps are worn for various reasons. Some facilities require the wearing of swim caps, in order to protect filters from becoming clogged with loose hairs which fall from the scalp of swimmers who are not wearing a cap. Caps are also sometimes worn in an attempt to keep the hair relatively dry or free from chlorinated water, to keep the sun off of the hair, and also, when a cap is worn with ear plugs, in order to keep water out of the ears.

Competitive swim caps are made of tightly fitted silicone, latex, or lycra that hugs the skull of its user, providing cover for his or her hair. This reduces drag in the water caused by loose hair. During longer swimming sessions, a swim cap keeps the head warm.
This character competes in or engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swimming_(sport)]swimming[/url].

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cycling]cycling[/url], either for fun or competitively.\n\nCycling is the use of bicycles for transport, recreation, or for sport. Apart from ordinary two-wheeled bicycles, cycling also includes riding unicycles, tricycles, quadracycles, and other similar human-powered vehicles (HPVs).
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Actor]actor/actress[/url].\n\nA person who acts in a dramatic production and who works in film, television, theater, or radio in that capacity.

This character is a subject of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muteness]muteness[/url]. \n\nHe can't speak because of speech disorder, hearing loss, surgery, mutations, or inability to speak from the begining due to his non-human nature. Don't apply this to ordinary plants and animals, who aren't supposed to speak.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doll]doll[/url] or similar item that has somehow come to life.\n\nDolls are models of human beings generally used as children's playthings.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infidelity]infidelity[/url]; that is, they have sex with someone other than their partner or spouse, without their partner's knowledge or permission.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon]dragon[/url].\n\nDragons are legendary creatures, typically with serpentine or reptilian traits, that feature in the myths of many cultures.

The character has the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chonmage]Chonmage hairstyle[/url]\n\nA form of Japanese traditional haircut worn by men. It is most commonly associated with the Edo Period and samurai, and in recent times with sumo wrestlers. It was originally a method of using hair to hold a samurai helmet steady atop the head in battle, and became a status symbol among Japanese society.

This character has a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/vindictive]vindictive[/url] nature.

This trait can divined in two ways:


1. disposed or inclined to revenge; vengeful (a vindictive person). 
2. proceeding from or showing a revengeful spirit (vindictive rumors).
This character, of their choice, leads a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secret_identity]double life in secrecy[/url].
This character is unusually [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Popularity]popular[/url].\n\nPopularity is the quality of being well-liked or having a high social status.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goggles]goggles[/url], a form of protective eyewear that protect the eye area in order to prevent particulates, water or chemicals from striking the eyes.

This character has a goal of obtaining money anyway possible. Usually with a 'get rich quick scheme' or demanding money frequently.\nThis can also mean a character who does not like spending money, like those old meany misers.
These characters has a special place in their hearts for the environment, wildlife and plant life.

This character is a rabbit, hare, or some other animal hailing from the order [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lagomorpha]lagomorpha[/url], or is a humanoid possessing the traits of those animals, such as bunny ears.

This character is refered to as a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jock_(athlete)#Stereotypical_characteristics_of_jocks]Jock[/url].

The term jock, when used in the United States and Canada, refers to the classic stereotype of a male athlete. It is generally a negative stereotype, and is attributed mostly to high school and college athletics participants who form a distinct youth subculture. In sociology, the jock is thought to be included within the socialite subculture, which also contains the preps and Ivy-Leaguers. As a blanket term, jock can be considered synonymous with athlete. 

Similar words that may mean the same as "jock" include "meathead," "musclebrain," and "musclehead." These terms are based on the stereotype that a jock is muscular, but not very smart, and cannot carry a conversation on any topic other than one relating to sports or exercise.

This trait does not refer to the job but the personality stereotype that comes with the people that are usually associated with this job.

This character is penetrated [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_positions#Multiple_penetration]multiple times[/url] simultaneously.\n\nThey may be penetrated by multiple objects (penis, sex toy, tentacle, etc) in a single orifice (vagina, anus or mouth). Alternatively, they may be penetrated in more than one orifice at the same time.

This character performs a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handjob]handjob[/url]. Apply [url=/i1633]i1633[/url] to the receiving character.

A handjob is the act of using one's hands to stimulate a male partner's penis. [url=/i1595]Vaginal Fingering[/url] may be considered the equivalent trait for a female receiver.
