description: This character's hair is tied with a rubber band which has bead(s) on it as a decoration.\n\n[url=http://s.vndb.org/ch/63/7963.jpg]Example[/url]
In traditional Chinese dress, a changshan  is the male equivalent of the women's [url=/i453]cheongsam (qipao)[/url]. It is also known as a changpao or dagua.
This character has a sword with blades on each sides of its handle.\n\n[url=http://fc00.deviantart.net/fs15/f/2007/012/d/8/Dual_Bladed_Mithrodin_by_SiberianRaccoon.jpg]example[/url]

This person has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halo_%28religious_iconography%29]halo[/url]. 

A halo is a ring of light that surrounds a person in art. They have been used in the iconography of many religions to indicate holy or sacred figures, and have at various periods also been used in images of rulers or heroes.

When perspective came to be considered essential, painters also changed the halo from an aura surrounding the head, always depicted as though seen full-on, to a flat golden disk or ring that appeared in perspective, floating above the heads of the saints, or vertically behind, sometimes transparent. This is the version often depicted in modern pop culture and art.
This character is mischievous.\n\nMischievous characters like to cause trouble in a playful way. Their actions may or may not be an annoyance to people around them.

This character has an appearance similar to the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ganguro]ganguro[/url] fashion.\n\nGanguro is an alternative fashion trend of blonde, pink or silver hair and tanned skin among young Japanese women that peaked in popularity around the year 2000. The Shibuya and Ikebukuro districts of Tokyo were the centers of ganguro fashion. In contradiction to the traditional Japanese concept of beauty by having pale skin, dark hair, and neutral makeup tones, rebellious youth tanned their skin, bleached their hair, and used colourful makeup. There is a connection to Japanese folklore of ghosts and demons, who are depicted with a similar appearance and often displayed in kabuki and noh costumes. This connection to folklore is further noted in the ganguro offshoot style called yamanba, named after a famous story about a mountain witch. The term ganguro is a portmanteau of the Japanese word gangan-kuro (ガンガン黒), meaning extremely dark, and guro (グロ), meaning grotesque, and the word ganguro can also be translated as "blackface".

This character use "watakushi", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.\n\nWatakushi is the most formal polite form of the Japanese pronouns for "I".
This character use "ware", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.

This character uses "atashi", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]Japanese pronouns for "I"[/url], to address themselves.\n\nThe "atashi" pronoun is used mostly by females, rarely males (girlish), and is often considered cute. Rarely used in written language, but common in conversation, especially among younger women.
The character is an antagonist for the main characters. Their intentions may be bad, good, or they may just be doing their job, but the important point is that they oppose the protagonists.

This character uses "warawa", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.\n\nWarawa is a female pronoun, with archaic connotations.
This character uses a ribbon as a hair accessory. The ribbon isn't used to tie anything and is typically located above the bangs or on top of the head.
This character uses a ribbon as a hair tie. It may be used to tie a ponytail, twintails, or other similar hairstyles.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suit_(clothing)#Suit_etiquette_for_women]skirt suit[/url].

In clothing, a skirt suit is a set of garments made from the same cloth, consisting of at least a jacket and a skirt. 
A blouse, which can be white or colored, takes the place of a shirt. Women's skirt suits can also be worn with colored tops or t-shirts.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garter_(stockings)]garter[/url].\n\nGarters are articles of clothing: narrow bands of fabric fastened about the leg, used to keep up stockings, and sometimes socks. Now obsolete due to garter belts and thigh-high stockings but still used, for tradition, during weddings.

This character is seen [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urination]peeing[/url] in a sex scene. Use [url=/i2227]Pissing on Others[/url] instead if they're peeing on another character.

Try not to confuse this with [url=/i1113]Female Ejaculation[/url]. Use the text to determine which trait applies.

Urination is the ejection of urine from the urinary bladder through the urethra to the outside of the body. In healthy humans the process of urination is under voluntary control. In infants, some elderly individuals, and those with neurological injury, urination may occur as an involuntary reflex.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tracksuit]tracksuit[/url].\n\nA tracksuit is an article of clothing consisting of two parts: trousers and a jacket usually with front zipper. It was originally intended for use in sports, mainly as what athletes wore over competition clothing (such as running shirt and shorts or a swimsuit) and would take off before competition.
This character engages in sexual acts in water. For example, in the sea, a pool, a bath, a river or a shower.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flip-flops]flip-flops[/url].\n\nFlip-flops are a type of open-toed sandal typically worn in casual situations, such as outside or at the beach. They consist of a flat sole held loosely on the foot by a Y-shaped strap that passes between the first and second toes and around either side of the foot.

This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woman_on_top#Reverse_cowgirl_position]reverse cowgirl[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1690]i1690[/url] to the penetrating partner.

Similarly to the [url=/i95]cowgirl[/url] position, the penetrating partner lies on their back, while the receiving partner straddles them with their torso mostly upright. Unlike the cowgirl position, the receiving partner faces away.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/35/84135.jpg]Example 1[/url]
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plant]flower or plant[/url] of some sort or a personification/avatar of it.

This character wears tight form fitting shorts that cover most of the thigh they are often associated with cycling in the west and known as [[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cycling_shorts]Cycling or Bicycle Shorts[/url]] in English but are primarily known as 'Spats' in Japanese anime and games where they are often seen as common sports wear.
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koreans]Korean[/url].\n\nThe Korean people are an ethnic group originating in the Korean peninsula.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gambling#Casino_games]gambling[/url].\n\nGambling is the wagering of money or something of material value (referred to as "the stakes") on an event with an uncertain outcome with the primary intent of winning additional money and/or material goods. Typically, the outcome of the wager is evident within a short period.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombian_people]Colombian[/url].\n\nColombian people are from a multiethnic Spanish speaking nation in South America called Colombia. Colombians are predominantly Roman Catholic and are a mixture of Europeans, Africans, and Amerindians.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greeks]Greek[/url].

The Greeks, also known as the Hellenes, are an ethnic group native to Greece, Cyprus and other regions. They also form a significant diaspora, with Greek communities established around the world.
Greek colonies and communities have been historically established in most corners of the Mediterranean, but Greeks have always been centered around the Aegean Sea, where the Greek language has been spoken since antiquity. Until the early 20th century, Greeks were uniformly distributed between the Greek peninsula, the western coast of Asia Minor, Pontus, Egypt, Cyprus and Constantinople; many of these regions coincided to a large extent with the borders of the Byzantine Empire of the late 11th century and the Eastern Mediterranean areas of the ancient Greek colonization.
This character is penetrated or otherwise sexually teased by a vibrator or [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dildo]dildo[/url]..

This character is penetrated with [url=/http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anal_beads]anal beads[/url].\n\nAnal beads are a sex toy consisting of multiple spheres or balls attached together in series which are continuously inserted through the anus into the rectum and then removed with varying speeds depending on the effect desired (most typically at orgasm to enhance climax). Those who use anal beads enjoy the pleasurable feeling they receive as the ball passes through the narrow sphincter of the anus.

This character's boobs get pressed against a glass surface (usually a window or table) in a sex scene.\n\nOnly use this trait if the girl's boobs are exposed, or her clothing is transparent (possibly due to being wet).

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gag_(BDSM)]gag[/url].\n\nA gag is sometimes worn during some bondage and BDSM roleplays. Gags are usually associated with roleplays involving bondage, but that is not necessarily the case. The person who wears the gag is regarded as the submissive partner, while the one not wearing one is regarded as the dominant one.
This character wears a [url=http://www.bondageblog.com/2012/07/08/nose-hook-and-ball-gag/]nose hook[/url].\n\nThey are usually used during a bondage scene.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latex_clothing]latex clothing[/url].\n\nLatex rubber as a clothing material is common in fetish fashion and among BDSM practitioners, and is often seen worn at fetish clubs. Latex is sometimes also used by couturiers for its dramatic appearance. Worn on the body it tends to be skin-tight, producing a "second skin" effect. There are several magazines dedicated to the use and wearing of it. Less commonly, latex clothing can be loose-fitting.
This character has an object other than a sex toy or body part inserted into one of their orifices.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Babydoll]baby-doll[/url].

A babydoll is a short, sometimes sleeveless, loose fitting nightgown or negligee intended as nightwear for women. It sometimes has formed cups called a bralette for cleavage with an attached loose fitting skirt falling in length usually between the upper thigh and the belly button. The garment is often trimmed with lace, ruffles, appliques, marabou fur, bows and ribbons, optionally with spaghetti straps. Sometimes it is made of sheer or translucent fabric like nylon or chiffon or silk.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/10/98910.jpg]NSFW Comparison[/url] - Left: [url=/i2277]chemise[/url], center: [url=https://vndb.org/i2276]teddy[/url], right: baby-doll. Only the teddy wraps around the crotch, and the baby-doll is much looser around the hips than the chemise.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fishnet]fishnet stockings[/url].\n\nIn the field of textiles, fishnet is hosiery with an open, diamond shaped knit; it is most often used as a material for stockings, tights or bodystockings. Fishnet is available in a multitude of colors, although it is most often sported in traditional matte black.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominant_(BDSM)]dominant[/url] role in one or more BDSM scene through the game.\n\nIn BDSM, a top or dominant is the partner in a BDSM relationship or in a BDSM scene who takes the active or controlling role over that of the bottom or submissive partner(s).

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bottom_(BDSM)]submissive[/url] role in one or more BDSM scene throughout the game.\n\nIn BDSM relationships, the bottom or submissive takes the passive, receiving, or obedient role. The other partner is the top or dominant.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pareo]pareo[/url].

The pāreu or pareo is the Cook Islands and Tahitian word for a wraparound skirt. Originally it was used only to refer to women's skirts, as men wore a loincloth, called a maro. Nowadays the term is applied to any piece of cloth worn wrapped around the body, worn by males or females.

[url=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/06/129606.jpg]Example[/url]
This character has their body written on in a sex scene.\n\nBody writing is a form of sexual domination (part of BDSM), often associated with sexual humiliation or abuse.
This character has no bangs. They might be held back by a headband, or they might simply not be a part of the character's hairstyle.

This character has hair that is parted to the side. The hair is parted off center, creating bangs or a fringe that is uneven. Examples include Fate/Stay Night's [url=/c37]Ilya[/url] and Steins;Gate's [url=/c6496]Moeka[/url]. If the hair is parted on center, use the [url=/i1095]Parted in Middle[/url] trait.
This character has short bangs. The bangs are located above the eyebrows and only a little lower than the hairline.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Optimism]optimist[/url].\n\nOptimism is a mental attitude or world view that interprets situations and events as being best (optimized), meaning that in some way for factors that may not be fully comprehended, the present moment is in an optimum state. The concept is typically extended to include the attitude of hope for future conditions unfolding as optimal as well.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archaeology]archeologist[/url].

An archeologist is someone dealing in the study of  archeology. 
Archeology is the study of human activity in the past, primarily through the recovery and analysis of the material culture and environmental data that they have left behind, which includes artifacts, architecture, biofacts and cultural landscapes.

This character has hair that is parted in the middle. The hair is parted on center, creating bangs or a fringe that is even on both sides. Examples include Da Capo's [url=/c4017]Miharu[/url] and Fate/Stay Night's [url=/c34]Rin[/url]. If the hair is parted off center, use the [url=/i1091]Parted to Side[/url] trait.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leg_warmer]leg warmers[/url].

Leg warmers are coverings for the lower legs, similar to socks but thicker and generally footless. They were originally used as dancewear by ballet and other classic dancers in order to keep the leg muscles warm and to prevent cramping or other muscle injuries. No scientific data has been yet collected to substantiate the claim that leg warmers prevent injury.

Traditionally knitted from pure sheep wool, modern variants are more typically made of cotton, synthetic fibers, or both. Some are made of other materials, such as chenille.

Leg warmers can vary in length, and in width, due to the material's stretchiness. They are commonly worn between the ankle to just below the knee, though many dancers prefer it to extend to cover the lower parts of the thigh. 
Some leg warmers are particularly short and made of thinner material; these are also known as 'ankle warmers'.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bodystocking]bodystocking[/url].

A bodystocking is a one-piece article of lingerie that covers the torso, and sometimes legs and arms of the wearer. It is similar to a leotard or a catsuit. The key difference is that it is usually made from partially transparent materials. Despite being quite erotic there are visual novels where heroines wear it as their main clothes.

[url=http://s.vndb.org/sf/22/3622.jpg]Example[/url]

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Succubus]succubus[/url].\n\nSuccubus is a female demon or supernatural being, who takes the form of a human woman in order to seduce men, usually through sexual intercourse. In modern fictional representations, a succubus may or may not appear in dreams and is often depicted as a highly attractive seductress or enchantress.
This character wears a strapless swimsuit. \n\nA strapless swimsuit has no shoulders or shoulder straps. Note that a strapless swimsuit can be a one piece or a bikini.

This character wears a swimsuit with a turtleneck.\n\nA polo neck, roll-neck(UK) or turtleneck (US) or skivvy (Australia) swimsuit is a garment with a close-fitting, round, and high collar that folds over and covers the neck. other than that, this is a regular swimsuit. Note that a turtleneck swimsuit can be a one piece or a bikini.
This character wears a strapless [url=/i666]leotard[/url].\n\nA strapless leotard has no shoulder straps or sleeves.

This character wears a [url=/i666]leotard[/url] with a turtleneck.\n\nA polo neck, roll-neck(UK) or turtleneck (US) or skivvy (Australia) leotard is a garment with a close-fitting, round, and high collar that folds over and covers the neck. Other than that, this is a regular leotard.

trait_alias: Bead in Hair\nBeads in Hair\nHair Bead
description: This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bead]beads[/url] interwoven in his/her hair.\n\n[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/43/79343.jpg]Example 1[/url], [url=http://s.vndb.org/ch/44/11144.jpg]Example 2[/url]

This character engages in sexual acts in an outdoor area. That is, any area not enclosed by walls, a roof and a floor.\n\nDo not confuse this with the [url=/i879]Sex in Public[/url] trait. These traits often overlap, but they refer to different things.

A superficial person is one who lacks substance, and tends to be materialistic. They judge others based on appearances, wealth, social standing or otherwise, purely surface values. In romantic situations, a superficial person (usually) only takes interest in those who are good-looking, rich and/or high in social value.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reincarnation]Reincarnation[/url] is the religious or philosophical concept that the soul or spirit, after biological death, begins a new life in a new body that may be human, animal or spiritual depending on the moral quality of the previous life's actions.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolf]wolf[/url] or has wolf-like physical features.

The gray/grey wolf is a species of canid native mostly found in the remote wilderness. They have sharp claws and long and bushy fur and tail.

Not to be confused with [url=http://vndb.org/i735]dogs[/url], as wolves are not domesticated and classed as different species.

Also not to be confused with [url=http://vndb.org/i706]werewolves[/url], as these characters are not humans that are affected by curses or moonlight.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tie_pin]tie pin[/url].\n\nA tie pin is a neckwear-controlling device, typically worn to secure the folds of cravats or neckties, and/or simply as an ornamental fashion statement.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terrorism]terrorist[/url].\n\nTerrorism is the systematic use of terror, often violent, especially as a means of coercion.

This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Broom]broom[/url].\n\nA broom is a cleaning tool consisting of stiff fibers attached to, and roughly parallel to, a cylindrical handle, the broomstick. It is thus a variety of brush with a long handle. It is commonly used in combination with a dustpan.

This character is an advisor of a student's club.

Club advisors play a vital role in ensuring that student involvement within the club is meaningful and productive. The most successful clubs are those in which the advisor takes an active interest in the group. The role of the advisor is to support and help guide the club, not to make decisions for the club. The club advisor serves a dual role in serving both the interests of the club and the school. It is essential that advisors are fully aware of their responsibilities.

The role of the advisor is to provide guidance and oversight of elections and by-laws. Although the advisor does not need to attend all club meetings and events, he or she must sanction all of the club’s activities. In addition, the advisor reserves rooms for club meetings and events and posts these onto the Student Events Calendar.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disappointment]Disappointment[/url] is the feeling of dissatisfaction that follows the failure of expectations or hopes to manifest. Similar to regret, it differs in that a person feeling regret focuses primarily on the personal choices that contributed to a poor outcome, while a person feeling disappointment focuses on the outcome itself.

This character engages in the act of female ejaculation during the game.\n\n[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Female_ejaculation]Female ejaculation[/url] refers to the expulsion of fluid by females from the paraurethral ducts through and around the urethra during or before an orgasm.

This character is a councillor of a local government.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Councillor]councillor[/url] (Cllr, Coun, Clr or Cr for short) is a member of a local government council, such as a city council.
Often in the United States, the title is councilman or councilwoman.

The character has sex with an exquisite, high-tech and/or magi-tech machine.\n\nDo NOT use this tag for regular sexual devices, to describe sex with a [url=https://vndb.org/i458]Robot[/url], [url=https://vndb.org/i459]Cyborg[/url] or characters of similar nature.
This character is violent.\n\nViolent characters prefer the usage physical force or power against others that can result in injuries, death, physiological scars or other forms of serious harm.

The character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_murder]mass murder.[/url]\n\nMass murder is the act of murdering a large number of people (four or more), typically at the same time or over a relatively short period of time.

This character commits an act of betrayal.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Betrayal]Betrayal [/url] (or backstabbing) is the breaking or violation of a presumptive contract, trust, or confidence that produces moral and psychological conflict within a relationship amongst individuals, between organizations or between individuals and organizations. Often betrayal is the act of supporting a rival group, or it is a complete break from previously decided upon or presumed norms by one party from the others. Betrayal is also a commonly used literary element and is often associated with or used as a plot twist.

When a person betrays their country use the [url=/i691]treason[/url] trait.

The character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Childbirth]childbirth[/url] during the story.\n\nChildbirth is the culmination of a human pregnancy or gestation period with the expulsion of one or more newborn infants from a woman's uterus.
This character wears transparent clothing.

This character is a subject of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coercion]coercion[/url].\n\nCoercion is the practice of forcing another party to act in an involuntary manner (whether through action or inaction) by use of threats or intimidation or some other form of pressure or force.

During the story of the game this character is seen carrying [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarot]tarot cards[/url].\n\nThe tarot is a pack of playing cards (most commonly numbering 78), used from the mid-15th century in various parts of Europe to play a group of card games such as Italian tarocchini and French tarot. From the late 18th century until the present time the tarot has also found use by mystics and occultists in efforts at divination or as a map of mental and spiritual pathways.

This character engages in the sexual act of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tribadism]tribadism[/url] during the story.

Tribadism is a form of non-penetrative sex in which a woman rubs her vulva against her partner's body for sexual stimulation, especially for ample stimulation of the clitoris. This may involve female-to-female genital contact or a female rubbing her vulva against her partner's thigh, stomach, buttocks, arm, or other body part (excluding the mouth). A variety of sex positions are recorded, including the missionary position.

The term is usually used in the context of lesbian sex, and originally encompassed societal beliefs about women's capability of being penetrative sexual partners.

This character gives birth to any kind of non-human creature during the course of the story. Egg laying belongs here as well.\n\nImportant note: Only use this tag if the birth of the baby monsters are part of the story. If it's just implied or covered by a time-jump and only the result (e.g. monsters are running rampart where there were none before) is shown, then do NOT use this tag!

This character wears hair ornaments that do not fit other hair ornament traits such as [url=https://vndb.org/i151]ribbons[/url], [url=https://vndb.org/i1103]beads[/url], [url=https://vndb.org/i726]flowers[/url], or [url=https://vndb.org/i152]bands[/url].\n\nInstead they wear something unusual such as stars (c5178), food (c4222), wings (c6350), or even ducks (c4448).

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bondage_%28BDSM%29]bondage[/url]

Bondage is the tying, binding, or restraining of a person for the sexual, aesthetic, and/or psychological pleasure of the parties involved. Rope, cuffs, bondage tape, self-adhesive bandages, or other restraints may be used for this purpose.

Bondage may be used as an end into itself, as in the case of rope bondage and breast bondage

If the characters are using bondage only during sex please use the [url=http://vndb.org/i680]bondage sex[/url] trait.
This character has a regenerative hymen making it possible to lose her virginity multiple times throughout a single story.

This character is a healer. The known types of healers are:

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Faith_healer]Faith Healers[/url]
Faith healing is healing through spiritual means. Believers assert that the healing of a person can be brought about by religious faith through prayer and/or rituals that, according to adherents, stimulate a divine presence and power toward correcting disease and disability. Belief in divine intervention in illness or healing is related to religious belief. In common usage, faith healing refers to notably overt and ritualistic practices of communal prayer and gestures (such as laying on of hands) that are claimed to solicit divine intervention in initiating spiritual and literal healing.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Traditional_healer]Traditional Healer[/url]
Traditional healing covers the health practices, approaches, knowledge and beliefs incorporating plant, animal and mineral-based medicines, spiritual therapies, manual techniques and exercises, applied singularly or in combination to treat, diagnose and prevent illnesses or maintain well-being. And should not be mixed with modern, government regulated, medicine and medical practices.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Healer_%28alternative_medicine%29]Alternative Medicine Healer[/url]
Alternative medicine is any practice that is put forward as having the healing effects of medicine, but is not based on evidence gathered with the scientific method. Often not part of conventional treatment, alternative medicine is usually based on tradition, belief in supernatural energies, pseudoscience, errors in reasoning, propaganda, or fraud. Alternative therapies lack scientific validation, and their effectiveness is either unproved or disproved. They have also been defined more broadly as the treatments that are not part of the conventional healthcare system.

This character has sex in the [url=http://danbooru.donmai.us/wiki_pages/16203]reverse spitroast[/url] position. Apply this trait to the partner in the middle, and apply [url=/i1704]i1704[/url] to the partners on the "ends".

For this position, one partner (typically male) has sex with another partner (typically female) in the cowgirl position while performing oral sex on a third partner (typically female) who is sitting on their face. The two participants on top typically (but don't always) face each other.

Do not confuse this with the [url=/i1499]spitroast[/url] position. For the spitroast, the partner in the middle is penetrated, while for the reverse spitroast, the partner in the middle is penetrating one of the other partners.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/21/85321.jpg]Example[/url]

This is a sexual act involving one man and two women. The women rub their vulvas together with the man's penis between them. The man may also take a more active role by thrusting his penis between their vulvas or by penetrating either of the women (or both of them alternately).

Apply this trait to the characters rubbing their vulvas on another character's penis. Apply [url=/i1705]i1705[/url] to the character having their penis rubbed.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/73/85273.jpg]Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/99/70699.jpg]Example 2[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/74/85274.jpg]Example 3[/url] - Different position.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drawing]drawing[/url].\n\nDrawing is a form of visual expression and is one of the major forms within the visual arts. There are several categories of drawing, including figure drawing, cartooning and doodling. There are also many drawing methods, such as line drawing, stippling, shading, the surrealist method of entopic graphomania, and tracing.

This character is a half-sister.\n\nA half-sister is a female sibling who shares one biological parent with the other siblings.  Do not confuse with Step-sister.  Half-sisters share blood relations, while step-sisters do not.

Another character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fisting]inserts their fist[/url] into this character's vagina or anus in a sex scene. Apply [url=/i1653]i1653[/url] to the character inserting their fist.\n\nDon't use this trait for cases where a character fists themselves. Use [url=/i592]Masturbation[/url] instead.
This character uses (voluntarily or not) a vibrator in secret during everyday activities. For example, while at work, while at school, or while walking in public.

This character is subject to erotic spanking. Apply [url=/i1688]i1688[/url] to the character spanking this character.\n\nErotic spanking is the act of spanking another person for the sexual arousal or gratification of either or both parties.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_people]Indian[/url] (from India).

Indian people or Indians are people who are citizens of India, which forms a major part of South Asia, containing 17.31% of the world's population. The Indian nationality is in essence made up of many distinct regional ethno-linguistic groups, reflecting the rich and complex history of India. India, in its current boundaries, was formed out of a number of predecessors.

Do not mix with Native Americans who are sometimes also referred as Indians.

This character is considered [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beauty#Ugliness]ugly.[/url]\n\nTo be ugly is to be aesthetically unattractive, repulsive, or offensive. Like its opposite, beauty, ugliness involves a subjective judgment and is at least partly in the "eye of the beholder."

trait_alias: happi coat\nhappy coat\nTraditional Japanese Straight-Sleeved Coat
description: This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Happi]happi[/url].\n\nHappi is a traditional Japanese straight-sleeved coat usually made of indigo or brown cotton and imprinted with a distinctive mon (crest). They are usually worn only to festivals. Originally, these represented the crest of a family, as happi were worn by house servants. Later, the coats commonly began to display the crests of shops and organisations. Firefighters in the past also used to wear happi; the symbol on their backs referred to the group with which they were associated. In English, "happi" is most often translated as "happi coat" or "happy coat".

A character with this tag wears or has worn a [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prison_uniform]prison uniform[/URL].\n\nA prison uniform is any uniform worn by individuals incarcerated in a prison, jail or similar facility of detention.

This character has been seen with a [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cigarette]cigarette[/URL].

A cigarette is a small cylinder of finely cut tobacco leaves rolled in thin paper for smoking. The cigarette is ignited at one end and allowed to smoulder; its smoke is inhaled from the other end, which is held in or to the mouth and in some cases a cigarette holder may be used as well. Most modern manufactured cigarettes are filtered and include reconstituted tobacco and other additives.

A cigarette is distinguished from a [url=/i1145]cigar[/url] by its smaller size, use of processed leaf, and paper wrapping, which is normally white. Cigars are typically much larger than cigarettes, composed entirely of whole-leaf tobacco and not wrapped in paper.

This character has been seen with a [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cigar]cigar[/URL].

A cigar is a tightly-rolled bundle of dried and fermented tobacco that is ignited so that its smoke may be drawn into the mouth.

A [url=/i1144]cigarette[/url] is distinguished from a cigar by its smaller size, use of processed leaf, and paper wrapping, which is normally white. Cigars are typically much larger than cigarettes, composed entirely of whole-leaf tobacco and not wrapped in paper.

An emotional person is somebody that is easily affected by [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emotional]feelings[/URL]. Emotional people are prone to making decisions based on feelings and impulses rather than logic, pragmatism or reason.

The character is a participant in [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Necrophilia]necrophilic[/URL] activities. A character with a sexual attraction to corpses (or the dead in general) is a necrophiliac.

This character wears clothing made partly or completely from [url=/http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fishnet]fishnet[/url] material.\n\nIn the field of textiles, fishnet is hosiery with an open, diamond shaped knit; it is most often used as a material for stockings, tights or bodystockings. Fishnet is available in a multitude of colors, although it is most often sported in traditional matte black.

This is a meta trait to gather all [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smoking]smoking[/url] related traits.\n\nSmoking is a practice in which a substance, most commonly tobacco, is burned and the smoke is tasted or inhaled. This is primarily practised as a route of administration for recreational drug use, as combustion releases the active substances in drugs such as nicotine and makes them available for absorption through the lungs. It can also be done as a part of rituals, to induce trances and spiritual enlightenment.

This character is a half-brother.\n\nA half-brother is a male sibling who shares one biological parent with the other siblings. Do not confuse with Step-brother. Half-brothers share blood relations, while step-brothers do not.

In common usage, [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theft]theft[/URL] is the taking of another person's property without that person's permission or consent with the intent to deprive the rightful owner of it. \n\nThe word is also used as an informal shorthand term for some crimes against property, such as burglary, embezzlement, larceny, looting, robbery, shoplifting and fraud.

[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paranoia]Paranoia[/URL] is a thought process believed to be heavily influenced by anxiety or fear, often to the point of irrationality and delusion. Paranoid thinking typically includes persecutory beliefs, or beliefs of conspiracy concerning a perceived threat towards oneself. Making false accusations and the general distrust of others also frequently accompany paranoia. For example, an incident most people would view as an accident or coincidence, a paranoid person might believe was intentional.

trait_alias: Round Drawn Japanese Heian Period Eyebrows
description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hikimayu]Hikimayu[/url]-styled eyebrows, or drawn round eyebrows on the forehead.

In pre-modern Japan, hikimayu was the practice of removing the natural eyebrows and painting smudge-like eyebrows on the forehead.

Aristocratic women used to pluck or shave their eyebrows and paint new ones using a powdered ink called haizumi, which was made of soot from sesame or rape-seed oils.

This character suffers from [url=http://en.dic.pixiv.net/a/Chuunibyou]Chuunibyou[/url].

Chuunibyou or "Middle-school 2nd Year Syndrome", is a colloquial and rather derisive term in Japan which describes a person at the age of fourteen would either act like a know-it-all adult, or thinks they have special powers no one else has. Some would even go as far as being obnoxious, arrogant, and often look down on adults or older people. This way of thinking or acting is mostly seen in teenagers during adolescence, however there are people who still act like this even after reaching adulthood.

Do not use this tag for cases where this way of thinking or acting is natural for the setting (e.g. for a mahou shoujo heroine in a fantasy world with actual magic powers) or when the character REALLY wields supernatural powers. Only use it where this behaviour is out of place.

A cowardly character is someone who is lacking in courage in battles or fights.

This character will runaway most of the time without thinking much about it. Popular examples would be Matou Shinji and Zenitsu from Kimetsu no Yaiba.

Do not confuse this trait with [url=/i216]Hetare[/url]. Hetare is associated with an inability in making decision, while Coward is associated in facing danger and challange.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curiosity]curious[/url] (as in eager to learn something).\n\nA curious person often wants to know more just about anything that (s)he encounters. A curious person is willing to learn new things, and likes to question the people around them.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misogyny]misogynist[/url], a person who hates, dislikes, mistrusts, or mistreats women.\n\nMisogyny is the hatred or dislike of women or girls. Misogyny can be manifested in numerous ways, including sexual discrimination, denigration of women, violence against women, and sexual objectification of women. Misogyny has been characterised as a prominent feature of the mythologies of the ancient world as well as various religions. In addition, many influential Western philosophers have been described as misogynistic. The male counterpart of misogyny is misandry, the hatred or dislike of men; the antonym of misogyny is philogyny, the love or fondness of women.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gynophobia]gynophobic[/url] (afraid of women).\n\nGynophobia is an abnormal fear of women. In the past, the Latin term was used, horror feminae, meaning "fear of women". In many cases, it may also be rooted in social phobia or social anxiety disorder.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misandry]misandrist[/url] (one who hates men).\n\nMisandry is the hatred or dislike of men or boys. Misandry is the antonym of philandry, the fondness, love, or admiration of men. Misandry is a back-formation from misogyny, the hatred or dislike of women.

This character is [url=http://www.fearof.net/fear-of-men-phobia-androphobia/]androphobic[/url].\n\nAndrophobia is an abnormal and irrational fear of men. Androphobia may be related to traumatic events in the sufferer's past (for example rape/sexual assault, witnessing physical and verbal abuse). It may also be due to social phobia or social anxiety disorder.
This is the meta-trait to group relationship traits about sisters.
This is the meta-trait to group relationship traits about brothers.
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pickaxe]pickaxe[/url].\n\nA pickaxe or pick is a hand tool with a hard head attached perpendicular to the handle.

This character has a generally [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weakness]weak body[/url]. This character may be also sickly. (optional)\n\nWeakness is a symptom represented, medically, by a number of different conditions, including: lack of muscle strength, malaise, dizziness, or fatigue. The causes are many and can be divided into conditions that have true or perceived muscle weakness. True muscle weakness is a primary symptom of a variety of skeletal muscle diseases, including muscular dystrophy and inflammatory myopathy. It occurs in neuromuscular junction disorders, such as myasthenia gravis.
This character receives an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enema]enema[/url].\n\nAn enema is the procedure of introducing liquids into the rectum and colon via the anus.
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coprophilia]Scat[/url] is a fetish involving the act of defecation or the feces itself in a sexual context.
A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wooden_horse_%28device%29]wooden horse[/url] is used on this character.\n\nThese devices can be used either for torturing a victim or as part of a BDSM scene.

This character has round, cartoonish eyes. They may or may not have irises. Do not mix this trait with [url=/i917]Tareme[/url], chibi eyes or any other common anime eyes.\n\n[url=http://s.vndb.org/ch/81/12781.jpg]Example 1[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/46/79346.jpg]Example 2[/url]

This character gets her breast size increased in a very short period of time. This can be the result of a realistic medical procedure like breast implants, or of fantasy origin like some super drugs or magic.

Hot wax is dripped onto this character in a sex scene. Apply [url=/i1892]Engages in (Sexual) >> Wax Play[/url] to the character(s) dripping the wax.\n\n[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wax_play]Wax play[/url] is a form of sensual play involving warm or hot wax usually dripped from candles or ladled onto a person's naked skin.
This character has something inserted into their nipples in a sex scene.

This character is seen wearing a bunny costume/dress.

The two essential part of the dress are the bunny ears (usually in the form of a headband) and the bunny tail tailored to the lower back of the dress.

The form of the costume itself can vary, depending on its nature. In case of a sexy dress, it can be a leotard, or just underwear. In case a dress aimed for children (like for a masquerade) can be pyjama-like in design, covering the entire body.

A disc jockey, also known as [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DJ]DJ[/url], is a person who plays recorded music for an audience.\n\nThere are several types of disc jockeys. Radio DJs or radio personalities introduce and play music that is broadcast on AM, FM, shortwave, digital, or internet radio stations. Club DJs select and play music in bars, nightclubs, or discothèques, or at parties or raves, or even in stadiums. Hip hop DJs select and play music using multiple turntables to back up one or more MCs/rappers, perform turntable scratching to create percussive sounds, and are also often music producers who use turntablism and sampling to create backing instrumentals for new tracks. In reggae, the DJ is a vocalist who raps, "toasts", or chats over pre-recorded rhythm tracks while the individual choosing and playing them is referred to as a selector. Mobile DJs travel with portable sound systems and play recorded music at a variety of events.

This character competes in or engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surfing]Surfing[/url]\n\nSurfing is a surface water sport in which the wave rider, referred to as a "surfer," rides on the forward face of a wave, which is most often carrying the surfer towards shore. Waves suitable for surfing are found primarily in the ocean, but can be found in some lakes, in rivers in the form of a standing wave or tidal bore. Surfing can also be done in manmade sources such as wave pools and boat wakes. The term "surfing" refers to the act of riding a wave and not the form (with or without a board) in which the wave is ridden. For instance, the native peoples of the Pacific surfed waves on alaia, paipo, and other such crafts on their belly, knees, and feet. Not to mention, Bodysurfing, the act of surfing a wave without a board, is considered by some to be the purest form of surfing. That much said, the more modern day definition of surfing tends to refer to when a surfer rides a wave standing up on a surfboard, which is referred to as stand-up surfing or paddleboarding. Although, another prominent form of surfing in the ocean today includes bodyboarding, which refers to when a surfer rides a wave either on the belly, dropknee, or stand-up on a bodyboard. Not to mention, knee boarding, surfmatting (riding inflatable mats), foils, bodysurfing, and so forth.

This character is one of the performers of a triple blowjob. Apply [url=/i1639]i1639[/url] to the receiving character.\n\nA triple blowjob is a blowjob performed by three people at the same time on a single person.

This character is seen wearing a wedding ring.\n\nA [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wedding_ring]wedding ring[/url] or wedding band is a metal ring indicating the wearer is married. Depending on the local culture, it is worn on the base of the right or the left ring finger.

This character is seen wearing an engagement ring.\n\nAn [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engagement_ring]engagement ring[/url] is a ring indicating that the person wearing it is engaged to be married, especially in Western cultures. Engagement rings are traditionally worn only by women, and rings can feature diamonds or other gemstones. In some cultures, engagement rings are also used as [url=http://vndb.org/i1186]wedding rings[/url].
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fisherman]fisherman[/url].\n\nA fisherman or fisher is someone who captures fish and other animals from a body of water, or gathers shellfish.

This character uses "washi", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.\n\nColloquial. Mainly used by males. Often used in western dialects and fictional settings to stereotypically represent old characters.
This character performs a sexual act on a sleeping character, waking them up in the middle of doing so, either intentionally or not. Apply [url=/i1651]i1651[/url] to the character who was asleep.
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assertiveness]assertive[/url] and takes the initiative in romantic and/or sexual pursuits.

trait_name: Sex in Front of an Audience
description:
This character engages in a sexual act whilst somebody else is watching them. The sexual act is not hidden from the onlooker(s), they are aware of it.

Note 1: This trait differs from [url=https://vndb.org/i879]Sex in Public Places[/url] in that the place can be private or public, only the presence of an audience counts.

Note 2: See [url=https://vndb.org/i1827]Discreet Sex[/url] for when the audience is not aware of the act (or at least not shown to be).
This character is involved in sexual activities while they are handcuffed, willingly or unwillingly.

This character participates in sexual acts where food or drinks play a significant role.\n\nPossible examples include a masturbation scene using a cucumber, or a person putting food on themselves and having their partner eat or lick it off them.

This person is the head (or leader) of some [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sect]sect[/url].\n\nA [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sect]sect[/url] is a subgroup of a religious, political or philosophical belief system, usually an offshoot of a larger religious group. Although in past it was mostly used to refer to religious groups, it has since expanded and in modern culture can refer to any organization that breaks away from a larger one to follow a different set of rules and principles.

trait_alias:
Sukumizu
Sukuru Mizugi
スクール水着
スク水
すくみず
description: This character wears a [url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SchoolSwimsuit]school swimsuit[/url].
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_hair#Hair_lengths]hair length[/url] which is ankle length or longer.

A skeleton is a type of physically manifested undead often found in fantasy, and horror fiction, and mythical art. Most are human skeletons, but they can also be from any creature or race found on Earth or in the fantasy world.
This character is one of the performers of a group blowjob (by at least 4 characters). Apply [url=/i1640]i1640[/url] to the receiving character.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santa_suit]Santa suit[/url], usually consisting of red jacket with white fur trim, stocking cap, a wide buckled belt, and black boots. A women's costume may differ slightly.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocket_launcher]rocket launcher[/url] is any device that launches a rocket-propelled projectile, although the term is often used in reference to mechanisms that are portable and capable of being operated by an individual.\n\nThe rocket launchers category includes shoulder-fired missile weapons, any weapon that fires a rocket-propelled projectile at a target yet is small enough to be carried by a single person and fired while held on one's shoulder.
This character has an irrational fear of dead things or things associated with death.
This character is one of identical twins, that in the course of the story pretends to be other twin.\n\nAdd for both, if exchange is on both sides.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pony]pony[/url].\n\nA pony is a small horse. Depending on context, a pony may be a horse that is under an approximate or exact height at the withers, or a small horse with a specific conformation and temperament.

This character is seen carrying a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tant%C5%8D]tantou[/url].\n\nThe tantou is commonly referred to as a knife or dagger. The blade is single or double edged with a length between 15 and 30 cm. It is shorter than it's successor - wakizashi, it's sides also generally have no ridge line and are nearly flat.
This character frequently puffs out their cheeks like a child when they feel insulted or upset. It may look funny and cute.

[URL=https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/effeminate]Effeminate characters are lacking in "manliness"[/URL]. He is unsure of himself and may act girlish. Not being able to fight back, he may become the subject of bullying by classmates. He blushes and loses the power of speech in the girl's company.

Also refers to male characters [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sissy#Pejorative_sense]who engage in activities[/URL] considered typical of the gender role of a girl- e.g. wearing feminine clothing or makeup.

Only use this for characters who are (or seem to be) male.
Devices are attached to this character's nipples which use vibration, electrical current, vacuum or other methods to stimulate this erogenous zone.

This character refers to themself by their own name. In other words, this character refers to themself in the third person. This is also called "[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illeism]Illeism[/url]".\n\nThis talking pattern may be used by small children and young women, and is considered to be cute and childish.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kimono#Mofuku]Mofuku[/url]. \n\nMofuku is formal mourning dress for men or women. Both men and women wear kimono of plain black silk with five kamon over white undergarments and white tabi. For women, the obi and all accessories are also black. Men wear a subdued obi and black and white or black and gray striped hakama with black or white zori. The completely black mourning ensemble is usually reserved for family and others who are close to the deceased.
This character is seen with or using a weaponised [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drill]drill[/url].

This character is see in or described as being part of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gyaru]Gyaru[/url] fashion.

Gyaru fashion is a type of Japanese street fashion that originated in the 1970s. In English speaking countries Gyaru is commonly mistaken for ganguro, but that is actually a subculture of gyaru. Gyaru is a girly-glam style, breaking away from traditional standards of beauty by dwelling on the man-made (wigs, fake eyelashes, fake nails, etc).

Gyaru fashion is typically characterized by having heavily bleached or dyed hair (mostly shades from dark brown to blonde), excessively decorated nails, and dramatic makeup.

The makeup typically consists of dark eyeliner and fake eyelashes used in ways intended to make the eyes appear larger. Clothing pieces for gyaru fashion differ depending on which gyaru style the individual chooses.

This character uses [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tonfa]Tonfas[/url].\n\nThe tonfa, also known as tong fa or tuifa, is an Okinawan weapon. It is a stick with a handle, and is about 15-20 inches long. It was traditionally made from red oak and wielded in pairs.
This character is a teacher in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kindergarten]kindergarten[/url] or in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nursery_school]nursery school[/url].
The character wears striped panties.
A character that holds grudges and whose forgiveness is hard to earn.
This character is seen carrying a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Notebook]notebook[/url]

This person exchanges their mind or soul with that of another's either through supernatural or technological means and they end up in each other's bodies. Alternatively, their minds may stay where they are as their bodies adjust.

This character is a fan of discipline. They frequently lecture those who behave inappropriately. In the school such a person can easily become the class president or even the student council president.

trait_alias:
Attention to foreskin
Foreskin attention
Foreskin fetish
Foreskin fetishism
description: This character, while playing with another character's penis, calls particular attention to the foreskin. Apply [url=/i1654]i1654[/url] to the character having their foreskin played with.\n\nDuring the act of foreskin play they may mention the presence or possibility of phimosis (where the foreskin cannot be readily retracted from the glans of the penis). Typically, special focus is given to fully retracting said foreskin prior to or during fellatio, thus enhancing sexual pleasure of the male partner.
This character has only one eye. This may be due to the physiological features (he has one eye because of mutations or due to non-human nature of himself) or wounds received in a fight or accident.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headband]headband[/url] or hairpin with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horn_%28anatomy%29]horns[/url] attached to it. He or she may wear it as an accessory in order to dress or look like a demon or a cow, for example.

This trait is different from Body > [url=https://vndb.org/i828]Horns[/url] by being a piece of clothing, instead of a part of a body.
And it is different from [url=https://vndb.org/i17]Odango[/url] by not being made of hair.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gloves]fingerless gloves[/url].\n\nA glove is a garment covering the whole hand. Gloves have separate sheaths or openings for each finger and the thumb; if there is an opening but no covering sheath for each finger they are called "fingerless gloves".

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gloves#Mittens]Mittens[/url]. \n\nMittens are gloves which cover the entire hand or fist but do not have separate finger openings or sheaths. Mittens are warmer than gloves made of the same material because fingers maintain their warmth better when they are in contact with each other. Reduced surface area reduces heat loss.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capri_pants]Capri pants[/url].\n\nCapri pants are mid-calf pants worn in warm weather. Variants end below the knee and calf. Though widely popular with women they are also worn by men in many countries, especially in Europe, Latin America and Asia.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pantalettes]Pantalettes[/url].

Pantalettes are undergarments covering the legs worn by women, girls, and very young boys (before they were breeched) in the early- to mid-19th century.

Pantalettes originated in France in the early 19th century, and quickly spread to Britain and America. Pantalettes were a form of leggings or long drawers. They could be one-piece or two separate garments, one for each leg, attached at the waist with buttons or laces. The crotch was left open for hygiene reasons. They were most often of white linen fabric and could be decorated with tucks, lace, cutwork or broderie anglaise.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leggings]Leggings[/url] are a type of skin-tight clothing covering the legs, which can be worn by both men and women. Modern leggings are typically made from a blend of lycra (aka spandex), nylon, cotton, or polyester blend, but they can also be made from wool, silk and other materials. Leggings are sometimes worn fully exposed, and are more traditionally worn partially covered by a garment such as a skirt, a large t-shirt or shorts, or fully covered by an outer garment, such as a full length skirt.\n\nLeggings are typically ankle-length, and some are stirrupped or encase the feet. Some are shorter. Leggings are worn to keep a person's legs warm, as protection from chafing during an activity such as exercise or as a decorative or fashion garment. Leggings are worn by both men and women during exercise but usually only by women at other times. In contemporary usage, leggings refers to tight, form-fitting trousers that extend from the waist to the ankles.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sokutai]sokutai[/url].

The sokutai (束帯) is complex attire only worn by courtiers, aristocrats and the emperor at the court in Japan. Part of a sokutai are the shaku (笏), a flat ritual baton or sceptre, and a hat called kanmuri (冠) .

No longer in normal use, the sokutai is however still worn by imperial court members and government officials (including the Prime Minister) on rare occasions such as weddings and enthronement ceremonies.

trait_alias:
Kimono with very long sleeves
Kimono with ankle-length sleeves
Kofurisode
Oofurisode
振袖
小振袖
大振袖
description:
A furisode (振袖, lit. swinging sleeves) is a style of kimono distinguishable by its long sleeves, which range in length from 85 centimeters for a kofurisode (小振袖) to 114 centimeters for an ōfurisode (大振袖).

Furisode are the most formal style of kimono worn by unmarried women in Japan. The furisode is made of very fine, brightly colored silk, and is commonly rented or bought by parents for their daughters to wear when celebrating Coming of Age Day the year they turn 20. By wearing a furisode, a young woman signifies that she is both single and a legal adult, and thus available for marriage. In this sense, a furisode might be likened to the formal gowns worn by debutantes in the West.

The furisode is generally worn for formal social functions such as the tea ceremony or wedding ceremonies of relatives. Since furisodes can be quite expensive, many women rent them as needed rather than purchasing them.

trait_alias:
Kimono with shorter sleeves
Irotomesode
Kurotomesode
留袖
色留袖
黒留袖
description:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kimono#Tomesode]Tomesode[/url] (留袖) is a type of kimono. It is an expensive formal dress worn by married women.
Originally, there was a custom that the long sleeves of the furisode were shortened after marriage, thereby creating a tomesode. This was because the long swinging sleeves would be impractical when the married woman worked in the kitchen. 

The tomesode distinguishes itself from other kimono by only having patterns under the waistline. It has five or sometimes three family crests, or kamon, which indicates the formality of the kimono.

Kuro-tomesode (black tomesode) are often worn for wedding ceremonies by married female relatives of the bride or groom. The eri, obijime and obiage are always white, and the obi matches the colourful pattern of the kimono to signify a happy occasion. It is believed that the black colour is to match the clean white colour of the bride, as this kimono is rarely used at other occasions than weddings of near family members (sisters or daughters). A friend of the bride or groom would not wear kurotomesode, but homongi or iro-tomesode.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclops]cyclops[/url], i.e. has only one eye in the middle of his face or forehead.\n\nThis trait doesn't refer to those who lost an eye in any existing way. For those who weren't born/created with only one eye socket, please use i1229.

trait_alias:
Thread Weapon
Monomolecular Wire
Monofilament Wire
Microfilament Wire
Microfilament Whip
description:
This character uses a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monomolecular_wire]monomolecular wire[/url].

Monomolecular wire is a fictional wire, often used as a weapon, consisting of single strand of strongly-bonded molecules, like carbon nanotubes. It has applications in cutting objects and severing adjacent molecules. A similar or identical concept may be called a microfilament wire or, as a weapon, a microfilament whip.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/31/79431.jpg]Example image[/url]

Monomolecular wires are seen in the Star Wars Expanded Universe, Cyber City Oedo 808, Hyperion Cantos, Robert J. Sawyer's Illegal Alien, the manga Battle Angel Alita, Naruto, Hellsing, My-Hime, Simon R. Green's Deathstalker series, as well as the roleplaying games Shadowrun, and Cyberpunk 2020.

This character is seen wearing a type of bridal gauntlet. A bridal gauntlet or wedding gauntlet is a type of fingerless glove that covers part of the hand and includes a ring around the middle finger not necessarily worn by brides.\n\n[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/18/79418.jpg]Example[/url].

This character use "waga", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.\n\nWaga is a very formal pronoun, it means "my" or "our". Used in speeches and formalities; 我が社 waga-sha (our company) or 我が国 waga-kuni (our country).
This character has a magical, holy or cursed mark somewhere on their body. It may share a mystic power or a curse with the owner, or may be used in some kind of ritual.

This character becomes a target of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flirting]flirting[/url].

Flirting is a playful, romantic or sexual overture by one person to another subtly indicating an interest in a deeper relationship with the other person, and can involve verbal communication as well as body language. Body language can include flicking the hair, eye contact, brief touching, open stances, proximity etc. Verbal communication of interest can include the vocal tone, such as pace, volume, intonation. Challenges (teasing, questions, qualifying, feigned disinterest) serve to increase tension, test intention and congruity.

Almost every VN has some romance and relationships, but rarely they do have actual flirting. Use this trait sparingly for only the ones that actually do.
This character is seen with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microphone]microphone[/url]. This can be either a microphone held in their hand or one tied to their ear.
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soul_patch]soul patch[/url].\n\nA soul patch is a small patch of facial hair just below the lower lip and above the chin.

This character tries to put a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curse]curse[/url] on someone, using his religious, magical or any other mystical powers.\n\nNot to be mixed with the speech pattern of using vulgar language.
A maid's headdress is a type of frilly hairband usually found in maid cosplay or as part of a standard [url=http://vndb.org/i433]maid's dress[/url].
This character loves to talk. However, the topic he started is not always meaningful, which often annoys his companions, especially when they want to enjoy the silence.

trait_alias: Sex in Front of a Mirror\nSex Involving Mirrors\nSex in Front of a Reflective Surface
description: This character engages in sexual activities in front of a mirror, or any other reflective surface.\n\nThis trait should be used when there is a significant focus on the reflections of the character(s) involved. Do not use this trait if the reflection is just coincidentally present.

A character with this tag has a haraguro personality.

A haraguro character is one who has an outward appearance of being amicable, friendly, innocent, kind and/or refreshing, but uses any combination of the aforementioned traits to hide their real cruel, cunning, evil, manipulative, mean and/or sadistic side. 

Despite the negative connotation, not all haraguro are villainous or are sociopaths. Their motives vary very widely depending upon the character her/himself and the "seriousness" of the story. 

The term comes from the Japanese word, "Haraguroi (腹黒い)", which means "black-hearted; mean; scheming".
This character is not afraid to face the danger head-on. He's always ready to defend his country or close people, and fulfill his duty, even if it means death.

This character is attempting to perform a [url=https://vndb.org/i495]Boobjob[/url], but their breasts are too small to do it properly. Apply [url=/i1628]i1628[/url] to the receiving character.

Naizuri literally means "rubbing against nothing".

Note: It's possible that the character realises the futility of their attempt and and helps our with their hands for example by rubbing the penis between their chest and the palms of their hands. The trait still applies in such cases.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/93/119093.jpg]NSFW Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/94/119094.jpg]NSFW Example 2[/url]

This person engages in sexual intercourse with themselves either through time travel, alternate dimensions, or the use of high technology or magic.\n\nDo not confuse this trait with [url=http://vndb.org/i592]masturbation[/url] where a person can stimulate their own genitals without the use of a partner.

trait_alias:
Dyed Hair
Hair coloring
Colored hair
Hair color change
description:
This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hair_coloring]dyes his/her hair[/url].

Hair coloring is the practice of changing the color of hair. Hair dyeing, which is an ancient art, involves treatment of the hair with various chemical compounds.

Note: Please do not use this trait just because the character has an unnatural hair color. Purple, blue, pink, green and other colors that are impossible without hair coloring in the real world, are used abundantly in visual novels. Thus only use this tag, if the VN explicitly states that this character colors his/her hair.

This character is often [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barefoot]barefoot[/url]; doesn't wear any shoes.

Barefoot is the state of not wearing any footwear. 

Note: Do not use this trait if the character is barefoot just in the sex scenes, or once or twice takes off his/her shoes in the novel.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adhesive_bandage]band-aid[/url].

Band-aid is a small dressing used for injuries not serious enough to require a full-size bandage.

It also can be used as an accessory in order to look sloppy, tough or dangerous.

Note: Only used this tag if the character actually has a band-aid on for a length of time or shown wearing it.
For example, do NOT use this tag, if a character accidentally cuts his/her finger, puts a band-aid on the wound and then the visual novel immediately cuts to the next scene, never mentioning or showing the band-aid again.

This character wears or uses [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosmetics]makeup[/url].\n\nCosmetics (colloquially known as makeup or make-up) are care substances used to enhance the appearance or odor of the human body. They are generally mixtures of chemical compounds, some being derived from natural sources, many being synthetic.
This character wears torn or damaged clothing.

A Lolita Hairband is a type of frilly wide headband similar to but much smaller than a [url=http://vndb.org/i992]bonnet[/url] that is sometimes covered in ribbons and bows.\n\nOriginally seen in Victorian fashion they have returned as a type of headwear for many types of [url=http://vndb.org/i820]lolita[/url] fashion.

trait_alias:
Old-style Bloomers
Old School Bloomers
Pumpkin Panties
パンプキンパンツ
description: This character wears old-style [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloomers_(clothing)]bloomers[/url].\n\nPlease do NOT use this trait for typical Japanese girl's  gym shorts. Use the [url=http://vndb.org/i178]Sport Bloomers[/url] trait instead.

This character is subject of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infidelity]infidelity[/url].\nIn other words, his/her partner or spouse has sex with someone other, without his/her knowledge or permission.
