[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanzashi]Kanzashi[/URL] are hair ornaments used in traditional Japanese hairstyles. They can act as a pinning device for hairstyles and/or be purely ornamental. Designs vary in complexity, and often have a floral motif.

[URL=https://s.vndb.org/sf/86/79386.jpg]Simple kanzashi example.[/URL]
[URL=https://s.vndb.org/sf/87/79387.jpg]Elaborate kanzashi example.[/URL]

The character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/News_presenter]news presenter[/url].\n\nA news presenter is a person who presents news during a news program on television, on the radio or on the Internet.

This character becomes the subject of the (sudden/mysterious) disappearance. Temporarily or permanently. According to their will or not. It may also be the complete disappearance of a character out of this world, which cannot be equated to common physical death. For example, the repose of the soul that existed in this world as a ghost, or the disappearance of the physical and mental component of the human, as if he/she never existed, due to interference of someone's special powers.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Research]researcher[/url].\n\nA researcher is someone who conducts research, i.e., an organized and systematic investigation into something.
The character often has nightmares, more than the ordinary person. It might be a single recurring nightmare or a different one each time.

trait_alias: Student Body Vice President\nStudent Government Vice President\nStudent Council Vice Chairman
description:
This character is the student government vice president.

The vice president of the student government is the second highest ranking officer of a student government or student union association on the high school, college, or university level. The vice president is the right-hand person of the president of the student government, and is usually the second-in-command within the student government.

Should the president be unable to fulfill the role of his/her position due to absence, having resign, or some other reasons, the vice president will be the one to succeed the position, whether temporarily or permanently depending on the nature of the situation. Depending on the school, this decision can also be influenced by the votes of the other members of the student government and/or the student body.

The vice president also have a high authority in the student government, surpassed only by the president. The vice president is also often in charge of making important decisions in the student government and can also act as the representative of the president as the right-hand person of the highest ranking officer of the student government.
A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biker]biker[/url] is a person who rides a bicycle, motorcycle, or motorbike, especially in competition or as a hobby.
A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motorcycle]motorcycle[/url] is a two-wheeled vehicle that is powered by a motor and has no pedals.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sleepwalking]Sleepwalking[/url], as defined, is the carrying out of various actions while asleep. Example of activities include: sitting up in bed, going to the bathroom, cleaning, cooking, driving, grabbing at objects that are not there, etc. Also sleepwalkers will have little or no memory of the incident. \n\nThe eyes of the sleepwalker can be open as well as long as it is clear they are asleep.

The act of escaping prison, jail, solitary confinement (or any form of confinement for that matter), or escaping in general. This trait can also be applied to escaping in any form as long as the person is either imprisoned (Example: jail) or confined in a way that it is imprisonment (Example: tied up and locked in a basement)\n\nSuccessfully or unsuccessfully doesn't matter as long as an attempt to escape was made.

The character goes through a temporary loss consciousness for a short time where they are for the most part unresponsive. This loss of consciousness can be from anything such as, for example, low blood count, being unable to handle blood, being embarrassed, exhaustion, and a medical condition.\n\nOnly use this trait for if the person passes out for a SHORT period of time. If it is longer than 6 hours it is a Coma.

This character uses "atakushi", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]Japanese pronouns for "I"[/url], to address themselves.\n\nAn informal variation of watakushi. In fiction, generally used by upper-class ladies.

This character is the concubine of another character.\n\nConcubinage is an interpersonal relationship in which a person (usually a woman) engages in an ongoing sexual relationship with another person (usually a man) to whom they are not or cannot be married.

A closet pervert is someone who, on the surface, seems normal or mainstream, but in reality is morally or sexually perverse. A closet pervert is somebody that hides their perversion, for personal reasons and/or fear of discovery. Including the changes that will happen if others are to learn of their perversion.

This character is an idealist, someone who is absorbed with living life the way they perceive it should be. They purposely overlook the darkness of human nature in favor of seeing everyone in an unrealistically good light. To an idealist, there are no such things as bad people. There are only bad situations people are in that force them to act a certain way. Finally, an idealist is someone who expects the best from people, not realizing that not everyone is willing to give up their time or money as willing as they are.\n\nThe opposite of a cynic, an idealist often has the nature of selflessness and believes in things like honor, justice, honesty, etc.

A revolutionary is a person who either actively participates in, or advocates revolution. To be such the person must advocate the overthrow of a government or the complete change of a society or take an active part in either one of the two. Terrorists can also be revolutionaries depending on their goals.

This character is a non-adult living without his/her parents at home.\nThis can be because they are dead, on a trip, the character has run from home or simply, his/her parents are never mentioned in the game.
A character with this trait engages in non-blood-related [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incest]incestuous[/URL] relations.

This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_position#Threesomes]spit-roast[/url] position. Apply this trait to the partners on the "ends", and apply [url=/i1703]i1703[/url] to the partner in the middle.

For this position, one partner (typically female) performs oral sex on another partner (typically male) while being penetrated in the doggy position by a third partner (typically male).

Do not confuse this with the [url=/i1133]reverse spitroast[/url] position. For the spitroast, the partner in the middle is penetrated, while for the reverse spitroast, the partner in the middle is penetrating one of the other partners.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/26/85126.jpg]Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/11/43911.jpg]Example 2[/url] - Gender-inverted example.
This character mourns someone and is struck by grief.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eccentricity_(behavior)]eccentric[/url].

Eccentricity (also called quirkiness) refers to unusual or odd behavior on the part of an individual. This behavior would typically be perceived as unusual or unnecessary, without being demonstrably maladaptive.
Eccentricity is often associated with genius, intellectual giftedness, or creativity. People may perceive the individual's eccentric behavior as the outward expression of their unique intelligence or creative impulse.
It refers to a son's desire to have sexual intercourse with his mother, sometimes an obsessive affection.
An ambitious person is defined as a person with an earnest desire for some type of achievement or distinction, such as power, honor, fame, or wealth, and the willingness to strive for its attainment.

Pool is the family of cue sports and games played on a pool table having six receptacles called pockets along the rails, into which balls are deposited as the main goal of play. Typically is played at bars. Equipment needed: pool cue, billiard balls, and a pool table.

A character with this trait wears or has worn a tailcoat.\n\nA [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tailcoat]tailcoat[/URL] is a coat with the front of the skirt cut away, so as to leave only the rear section of the skirt, known as the tails.

A character with this trait wears or has worn cufflinks.\n\n[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cufflink]Cufflinks[/URL] are used to secure French button cuffs and are also an item of jewellery for men. Cufflinks can be manufactured from a variety of different materials, such as glass, stone, leather, metal, precious metal or combinations of these. Securing of the cufflinks is usually achieved via toggles or reverses based on the design of the front section, which can be folded into position.

The blunt person is the realest person you will ever meet, they don't sugarcoat anything and say what the mean: they often come of as rude and even insensitive at times, but they don't have any bad intentions. They aren't afraid of confrontations and will say what they honestly think without beating around the bush. A blunt person can say the truth when others can't or won't point it out.

Not to be confused with sharp-tongued. A sharp-tongued person is simply sarcastic & is often comments to tease or annoy someone using the oppositions weak point. A blunt person however is simply brutally honest & very frank about what they think. Most, if not all of the time, their comments are simply the truth. Though they way they convey it is another matter entirely.

Different from the normal honest person who's honest in a helpful way and try not to offend the opposition while being honest, a blunt person just say the truth and what they honestly feel or think flat out. Honest has a positive connotation, while blunt has a more negative connotation.
The person is the president of a sports club at school.
This character suffers of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penis_removal]penis removal[/url], voluntary or not.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bindi_(decoration)/]bindi[/url].

A bindi is a forehead decoration worn in South Asia and Southeast Asia.

Traditionally it is a bright dot of red colour applied in the centre of the forehead close to the eyebrows, but it can also consist of other colours with a sign or piece of jewellery worn at this location.

Note: This trait is for the latter usage. If the bindi appears as a painted mark on the forehead, then use the [url=http://vndb.org/i1514]Bindi (Mark)[/url] trait instead.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bindi_(decoration)]bindi[/url].

A bindi is a forehead decoration worn in South Asia and Southeast Asia.

Traditionally it is a bright dot of red colour applied in the centre of the forehead close to the eyebrows, but it can also consist of other colours with a sign or piece of jewellery worn at this location.

Note: This trait is for the former usage. If the bindi appears as a form of jewelry, please use the [url=http://vndb.org/i1513]Bindi (Jewelry)[/url] trait instead.
An [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assault_rifle]assault rifle[/url] is a selective fire rifle that uses an intermediate cartridge and a detachable magazine.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magatama]magatama[/url] jewellery, keychain etc.

Magatama (勾玉), less frequently (曲玉), are curved, comma-shaped beads that appeared in prehistoric Japan from the Final Jōmon period through the Kofun period.

The beads, also described as jewels, were made of primitive stone and earthen materials in the early period, but by the end of the Kofun period were made almost exclusively of jade. 

Magatama originally served as decorative jewelry, but by the end of the Kofun period functioned as ceremonial and religious objects.

This character is a psychometrist.\n\n[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychometry_(paranormal)]Psychometry[/url],  also known as token-object reading, or psychoscopy, is a form of extra-sensory perception characterized by the claimed ability to make relevant associations from an object of unknown history by making physical contact with that object. Supporters assert that an object may have an energy field that transfers knowledge regarding that object's history.

This character suffers from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obsessive–compulsive_disorder]OCD[/url].\n\nObsessive–compulsive disorder (OCD) is an anxiety disorder characterized by intrusive thoughts that produce uneasiness, apprehension, fear or worry (obsessions), repetitive behaviors aimed at reducing the associated anxiety (compulsions), or a combination of such obsessions and compulsions. Symptoms of the disorder include excessive washing or cleaning, repeated checking, extreme hoarding, preoccupation with sexual, violent or religious thoughts, relationship-related obsessions, aversion to particular numbers and nervous rituals such as opening and closing a door a certain number of times before entering or leaving a room.
This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Androgyny]androgynous[/url].\n\nAn androgynous person is a female or male who has a high degree of both feminine and masculine traits.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halberd]halberd[/url] is a two-handed pole weapon that came to prominent use during the 14th and 15th centuries. The halberd consists of an axe blade topped with a spike mounted on a long shaft.

The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ji_%28halberd%29]ji[/url] (Chinese: 戟), or Chinese halberd, was an ancient pole arm used as a military weapon in one form or another from at least as early as the Shang dynasty until the end of the Qing dynasty. They are still used for training purposes by many Chinese martial arts.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bicycle]bicycle[/url], often called a bike or cycle, is a human-powered, pedal-driven, single-track vehicle, having two wheels attached to a frame, one behind the other.

The person is almost murdered by another human (or humans) during the story. i.e. The person is almost strangled to death but is released before death or the person is shot (in the head for example) but manages to survive. The important thing is that they were nearly killed but managed to survive and the person who nearly killed he/she was intending on killing them.

The person exhibits great amount of cruelty. Cruelty is indifference to suffering or even pleasure in inflicting it. The person enjoys making other people's lives a living hell. Can be related to sadism.

trait_alias: Double penetration dildo\nDouble headed dildo\nDouble dildo
description:
This character is penetrated with a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double_penetration_dildo]double-ended dildo[/url] or vibrator.

This is a sex toy that allows for the simultaneous penetration of two people's orifices at the same time. It resembles two dildos on opposite ends of the same shaft.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/99/83499.jpg]Example[/url]

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facesitting]facesitting[/url] in a sex scene. Apply [url=/i1652]i1652[/url] to the character being sat on.\n\nFacesitting is a sexual practice in which one partner sits on or over the other's face, typically to allow or force oral-genital or oral-anal contact. Facesitting is common among dominant and submissive individuals, for demonstrating superiority and for sexual gratification.
The person is willing to obey orders and do anything anyone tells them. Can be out of loyalty, fear or some other reason. The main point is they will do anything you say. Does not apply to robots.

This character is seen with (an ersatz of) [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pocky]Pocky[/url].

Pocky (ポッキー Pokkī) is a Japanese snack food produced by Ezaki Glico. Pocky was first sold in 1966, and consists of chocolate-coated biscuit sticks. It was named after the Japanese onomatopoetic word pokkin (ポッキン).

The original was followed by almond coatings in 1971, and strawberry coatings in 1977. Today, the product line includes variations as milk, mousse, green tea, honey, banana, cookies and cream, and coconut flavored coatings, and themed products such as "Decorer Pocky", with colorful decorative stripes in the coating, and "Men's Pocky", a dark (bittersweet) chocolate and "mature" version.

This character is involved in sexual activities while they are blindfolded.\n\nUse of a blindfold is said to enhance the remaining senses of the wearer, focusing attention on sound, smells and physical contact. This increased awareness is said to allow for greater excitement and anticipation by eliminating visual cues.
A kind of throwing knife commonly associated with the ninja.
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lieutenant]Lieutenant[/url].
This character's military rank is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corporal]Corporal[/url].
The character has pronounced shadows/dark lines under or around their eyes, usually to show that the character regularly gets little sleep.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Workaholic]workaholic[/url].

A workaholic is a person who is addicted to work. While the term generally implies that the person enjoys their work, it can also imply that they simply feel compelled to do it. There is no generally accepted medical definition of such a condition, although some forms of stress, impulse control disorder, obsessive-compulsive personality disorder and obsessive-compulsive disorder can be work-related.

Workaholism in Japan is considered a serious social problem leading to early death, often on the job, a phenomenon dubbed karōshi.
The person engages in sign language which is a form of non-verbal communication with your hands using a dedicated sign language.

This character plays [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netball]netball[/url].

Netball is a ball sport played by two teams of seven players. Its development, derived from early versions of basketball, began in England in the 1890s.

Games are played on a rectangular court with raised goal rings at each end. Each team attempts to score goals by passing a ball down the court and shooting it through its goal ring. Players are assigned specific positions, which define their roles within the team and restrict their movement to certain areas of the court. During general play, a player with the ball can hold onto it for only three seconds before shooting for a goal or passing to another player. The winning team is the one that scores the most goals. Netball games are 60 minutes long. Variations have been developed to increase the game's pace and appeal to a wider audience.

trait_alias:

Child born out of wedlock
Love child
Bastard
description: This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legitimacy_(law)]illegitimate child[/url].\n\nIllegitimacy (or bastardy) is the status of a child born outside marriage.

This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coming_out]comes out of the closet[/url].\n\nComing out of the closet, or simply coming out, is a figure of speech for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and asexual (LGBT) people's self-disclosure of their sexual orientation (or lack of) and/or gender identity.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Photographer]professional photographer[/url].\n\nA professional photographer uses photography to make a living, while amateur photographers take photographs for pleasure and to record an event, place or person.

The person has padding in their bra in order to make their breasts seem bigger. The reason for it can vary but it can be to hide the fact the person has little to no breasts or the person is trying to disguise themselves as a woman.
A circlet is a crown with neither arches nor a cap (internal covering).
Long, elegant gloves that don't cover the users fingers.\n\nExample: https://s.vndb.org/sf/19/79419.jpg

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaulders]Spaulders[/url] are pieces of armour in a harness of plate armour. Typically, they are a single plate of steel or iron covering the shoulder with bands (lames) joined by straps of leather or rivets.
This character sucks another character's nipples in a sex scene. Apply [url=/i1630]i1630[/url] to the other character.\n\n[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/02/119102.jpg]NSFW Example[/url]

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turban]turban[/url].\n\nA turban is a kind of headwear based on cloth winding. Featuring many variations, it is worn as customary headwear, usually by men.
This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandal]sandals[/url] with high heels.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bathrobe]bathrobe[/url] is usually made from towelling or other absorbent textile, and may be donned while the wearer's body is wet, serving both as a towel and an informal garment.

In case of torn or ripped pantyhose by design, having usually multiple cuts/rips on the legs made on puropose or fabricated like that for fashion reasons just use: [url=https://vndb.org/i3086]Torn Pantyhose (by design)[/url].
In case of crotchless pantyhose just use: [url=https://vndb.org/i2061]Crotchless Pantyhose[/url].

This character is a [url=http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=Hanyou]hanyou[/url].\n\nHanyous are mythological creatures with one youkai parent and one human parent.

trait_alias:
Belt bag 
Belt pack
Bum bag
Hip bag
Hip pack
Waist bag
description: A character with this trait wears or has worn a fanny pack.\n\nA [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fanny_pack]fanny pack[/URL] is a small fabric pouch usually secured with a zipper and worn by use of a strap around the hips or waist.

A character with this trait is sensitive.\n\nA [URL=http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/sensitive]sensitive[/URL] person is one who has or displays a quick and delicate appreciation of others' feelings. They tend to be easily hurt, offended or upset.
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/17/79417.jpg]Christmas cap[/url] is a pointed cap, usually red and white fabric, worn by Santa Claus.
This character is a novelist. Novelists are people who write fiction in a prose format.

This character is considered to be a slut (sexually promiscuous). Slut or slattern is a term applied to an individual who is considered to have loose sexual morals or who is sexually promiscuous. The accepted denotative meaning is a sexually promiscuous woman.\n\nThe term is generally pejorative and most often used as an insult, sexual slur or offensive term of disparagement (slut shaming). However, in recent times, there have been attempts to "reclaim" the word, while some individuals embrace the title as a source of pride.
The character has a unusually pale skin-tone or albinism.
This character wears a [url=http://amtwiki.net/amtwiki/index.php/Haori]haori[/url] (Japanese formal coat).

This character is a [url=http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/genie]genie[/url].\n\nGenie is a spirit of Arabian folklore, as depicted traditionally imprisoned within a bottle or oil lamp, and capable of granting wishes when summoned.

A character with this trait has Sanpaku eyes.

[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanpaku]Sanpaku eyes[/URL] refers to eyes in which the white space above or below the iris is visible. 

In Japanese media, this is far more common in male characters than in females. Sanpaku-gan produces a more “piercing and sharp” look that lacks cuteness, so Japanese fiction tends to apply it to aggressive, delinquent, mean and/or rude characters.

Examples: [URL=https://vndb.org/c9786]1[/URL], [URL=https://s.vndb.org/sf/47/79347.jpg]2[/URL], [URL=https://s.vndb.org/sf/48/79348.jpg]3[/URL], [URL=https://s.vndb.org/sf/49/79349.jpg]4[/URL].

This character is a [url=http://yokai.wikia.com/wiki/Tsukumogami]tsukumogami[/url].

Tsukumogami is a term used to categorize a type of yôkai. The most accepted definition of the term says that tsukumogami are inanimate objects that once they have served their owner/s for 100 years, they receive a soul and therefore become alive and self-aware.

Tsukumogami can range from weapons to clothes to umbrellas. The umbrella version ([url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kasa-obake]karakasa[/url]) is typically depicted with one eye, a mouth, two arms and one leg. Another popular one is [url=http://yokai.wikia.com/wiki/Ittan_Momen]Ittan-momen[/url], a floating strip of cotton cloth with eyes and arms.

A character with this trait wears or has worn a choker.

A [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Choker]choker[/URL] is a close-fitting band encircling the neck. Chokers can be made of a variety of materials, including velvet, plastic, beads, metal such as silver, gold or platinum, leather, etc. They can be adorned in a variety of ways, including with sequins, studs, or a pendant. 

This also includes collar-style chokers (typically leather bands with buckles) which are worn as fashion accessories and [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detachable_collar]detachable shirt collars[/URL].

[URL=https://s2.vndb.org/ch/49/28549.jpg]Example 1[/URL]
[URL=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/72/137172.jpg]Example 2[/URL]
[URL=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/71/137171.jpg]Example 3[/URL]
[URL=https://s2.vndb.org/ch/50/52250.jpg]Example 4 (Detachable Shirt Collar)[/URL]

A character with this trait is a misanthrope.\n\n[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misanthropy]Misanthropy[/URL] is the general hatred, distrust or disdain of the human species or human nature. A misanthrope, or misanthropist is someone who holds such views or feelings.

A character with this trait sports a bowl cut hairstyle.\n\nA [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bowl_cut]bowl cut[/URL] is a simple and plain short haircut where the hair is cut with a straight fringe on the front and the rest of the hair is the same length all the way around or is cut short on the sides and back. It is so named because it looks as though someone put a bowl on the head and cut off or trimmed short all the visible hair.

A character with this trait possesses a Shimada hairstyle.\n\nThe [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shimada_%28hairstyle%29]Shimada[/URL] is a women's hairstyle in Japan, similar to a [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chignon_%28hairstyle%29]chignon[/URL]. Its modern usage is mainly limited to geisha (wearing it as a wig), but during the Edo period it was also worn by ordinary women, and especially by girls in their late teens. Generally the hair is gathered together at the crown of the head and a small portion of the bun is sectioned off to point outward.

Hair that is combed back, away from the forehead, then held in place with a hairstyling product. 

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/44/79344.jpg]Example 1[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/ch/71/58071.jpg]Example 2[/url]

Don't use the trait for the characters that wear their hair in a ponytail. In that case, use i18 instead.
Note, that in some rare instances, it IS possible for a character to have both Slicked Back hair and a ponytail. Case in point: c11286.

This character wears ankle boots.

An ankle boot is a type of footwear that only covers the foot and the ankle and does not extend up to the leg. They have high heel variants.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/20/79420.jpg]Example[/url]

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychiatrist]psychiatrist[/url].\n\nA psychiatrist is a physician who specializes in psychiatry. A psychiatrist specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of mental disorders.

This character performs a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Striptease]striptease[/url].\n\nA striptease is an erotic or exotic dance in which the performer gradually undresses, either partly or completely, in a seductive and sexually suggestive manner.

This character has a significantly larger than [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_penis_size]average[/url] penis. This is either obvious in the art (e.g. v13053) or discussed by characters in the game.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweatpants]sweatpants[/url]. \n\nSweatpants are a casual variety of soft trousers intended for comfort or athletic purposes, although they are now worn in many different situations. Because of their comfort and fashionable varieties, they have become one of the most commonly worn items of clothing.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jersey_%28clothing%29]sports jersey[/url].\n\nA sports jersey is a shirt made of soft material, worn by a member of a sports team. The sports jersey usually displays the athlete's name and team number as well as the logotype of the team or corporate sponsor.

A character with this trait is a clown, be it a professional or an amateur one.\n\nA [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clown]clown[/URL] is a comic performer who employs slapstick or similar types of physical humour, often in a mime style. Clowns have a varied tradition with significant variations in costume and performance. The most recognisable clowns are those that commonly wear outlandish costumes featuring distinctive makeup, colourful wigs, exaggerated footwear, and colourful clothing. Their entertainment style is generally designed to entertain large audiences, especially at a distance.
The person is responsible for the murder of a royalty.
This character engages in dancing at some point of the story.

This character wears a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sundress]sundress[/url].\n\nA sundress is a dress intended to be worn in warm weather. Typically, it is an informal or casual dress in a lightweight fabric, most commonly cotton, and usually loose fitting. The dress is intended to be worn without a layering top. Sundresses can be of any neckline and hemline, including modest styles and a variety of patterns.

This character is wearing a school backpack intended for transporting educational materials to and from school.\n\nTypical school backpacks generally lack the rigid frame of an outdoor-style backpack and include only a few pockets in addition to the main storage compartment. While traditionally very simple in design, school backpacks are often made with padded shoulder straps and backs as well as additional reinforcement to hold large numbers of heavy textbooks, as well as safety features such as reflective panels to make the wearer of the pack more visible at night.
Any kind of small electronic device.
Simple household or worktools that has little to no moving mechanical part.
The character is seen with or using a drill.\n\nNote: If the drill is weaponised and not a working tool, then use [url=https://vndb.org/i1217]Drill [Weapon][/url] instead.
Any item for purpose of facilitating or aiding transportation.
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Food]Food[/url] is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.
Any sport related items belong here.
Any items with a primary purpose of containing any other items or substances belong here.
Any items that are used in modern medicine belong here.
Items that do not fit under any other categories.

trait_alias:

description:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swinging_(sexual_practice)]Swinging[/url] or (rarely) partner swapping is a non-monogamous behavior, in which singles or partners in a committed relationship engage in sexual activities with others as a recreational or social activity.

Swinging can take place in a number of contexts, ranging from spontaneous sexual activity at informal gatherings of friends to planned regular social meetings to hooking up with like-minded people at a swingers' club. It can also involve Internet-based swinger social networking services online.

The older term wife-swapping, once considered to be equivalent to "swinging", is criticized today as being androcentric where it is presumed that the partners are a married heterosexual couple and that it is the male who is in control of the sexual activities and also that it does not accurately describe the full range of sexual activities in which both singles or couples may take part.

Note: Do not confuse swinging with [url=https://vndb.org/i772]Infidelity[/url].

Historically worn under kimono both by samurai (to resist injury) and by women (for more "obvious" reasons, particularly in eras when a slim figure was considered fashionable), its association with warriors has made it a near-universal symbol of toughness in Japan.

[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samue]Samue[/URL] is the work clothing of Japanese Zen Buddhist monks, worn when engaged in samu. It is a two-piece set of matching robe-like shirt and pants. \n\nIn modern times they have become popular as general casual or work wear.

[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Z%C5%8Dri]Zouri[/URL] are flat and thonged Japanese sandals made of rice straw or other plant fibers, cloth, lacquered wood, leather, rubber, or synthetic materials. Zouri are quite similar to flip-flops.

The traditional forms of zouri are seen when worn with other traditional clothing; modern forms are fairly common, especially in summer. While [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geta_%28footwear%29]geta[/URL] are nowadays worn with the informal yukata, zouri are associated with the more formal kimono.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flagellation]Flagellation[/url] (Latin flagellum, "whip"), flogging, whipping or lashing is the act of methodically beating the human body with special implements such as whips, lashes, rods, switches, the cat o' nine tails, the sjambok, etc. 

Typically, flogging is imposed on an unwilling subject as a punishment; however, it can also be submitted to willingly, or performed on oneself, in religious or sadomasochistic contexts.

Apply this trait on characters being whipped. Apply its [url=https://vndb.org/i2549]counterpart[/url] on the characters whipping them.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_branding]Human branding[/url] or stigmatizing is the process in which a mark, usually a symbol or ornamental pattern, is burned into the skin of a living person, with the intention that the resulting scar makes it permanent. This is performed using a hot or very cold branding iron. \n\nIt therefore uses the physical techniques of livestock branding on a human, either with consent as a form of body modification; or under coercion, as a punishment or to identify an enslaved or otherwise oppressed person. It may also be practiced as a "rite of passage", e.g. within a tribe, or to signify membership of or acceptance into an organization.

The term can also include other sexual acts involving the anus, including pegging, anal–oral sex, fingering, and object insertion.

A character with this trait uses one of the masculine [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]Japanese pronouns[/URL], "ore-sama". Ore-sama comes from the Japanese masculine pronoun for “I; me (俺 or オレ)” and the very respectful honorific suffix, “-sama (様)”.

Since this is the most arrogant masculine reference of oneself, characters who use "ore-sama" tend to be aggressively overconfident and pompous males. Characters who utilise "ore-sama" are also known to be boastful, forward, hasty and having a “my way or the highway” attitude.

"Ore-sama" is also sometimes used as a personality trait term to describe such characters.

This character wears a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_school_uniform]Sailor School Uniform[/url].

This kind of japanese school uniform is modeled in appearance similar to that of the European-style naval uniforms and was first used in Japan in the late 19th century, replacing the traditional kimono.

This character wears a thigh band.\n\nAn thigh band is a piece of material worn around the thigh usually on a naked leg.

This character is a mistress of another character.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mistress_%28lover%29]mistress[/url] is a relatively long-term female lover and companion who is not married to her partner, especially when her partner is married. Generally, the relationship is stable and at least semi-permanent, but the couple does not live together openly and the relationship is usually, but not always, secret. There is often also the implication (if not the fact) that the mistress is "kept" – i.e. that her lover is paying for some (and sometimes all) of her living expenses. 

This role does not preclude a character from also being a i371, i1493 or a courtesan.

This character's nipples are visible through her clothing.\n\nUse this trait for characters with sprites whose nipples are easily visible and drawn in. Do not use it for [url=https://vndb.org/g1446]Naked Sprites[/url].

This character is a daughter of an upper class family.

The upper class is the social class composed of the wealthiest members of society, who also wield the greatest political power. The upper class is generally contained within the wealthiest 1-2% of the population, and is distinguished by immense wealth (in the form of estates) which is passed from generation to generation.

This trait is about the social status of the character and does not refer to her behavior*.

*Having grown up accustomed to wealth and privilege, they have a tendency to flaunt their family wealth and status. As they are used to being waited upon by servants, they are more likely than not to order others not of the same social status as them around, even unintentionally.
A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greave]greave[/url] is a piece of armour that protects the leg. Greaves usually consisted of a metal exterior with an inner padding of felt.

The character is subjected to torture using needles, nails, or other pointy objects.\n\nNeedles, nails or spikes are used to perforate or pierce the skin and body of a character with the intention of hurting him. This trait should not be used by unintentional perforation.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asphyxia]Asphyxia[/url] or asphyxiation is a condition of severely deficient supply of oxygen to the body. In order to be considered torture asphyxia should not be caused by natural causes or by any incidental means.

Causes of forced oxygen deficiency considered torture usually are:
Strangling - using hands, rope, ecc... to suffocate someone for a period of time 
Drowning - forcing someone to keep head underwater for a period of time
Hanging - forcing someone to hang for a period of time
Gas intoxication - forcing someone to inhale gas for a period of time

Extended asphyxia can lead to death.
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ribbon_(rhythmic_gymnastics)]Ribbon[/url] is a component of rhythmic gymnastics composed of a handle (called "stick"), a ribbon, and attachment.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballet_flat]Ballet flats or Dolly shoes[/url] are derived from a woman's soft ballet shoe, with a very thin heel or the appearance of no heel at all. \n\nThe style sometimes features a ribbon-like binding around the low tops of the slipper and may have a slight gathering at the top-front of the vamp (toe box) and a tiny, decorative string tie. Ballet slippers can be adjusted and tightened to the wearer's foot by means of this string tie and done.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microskirt]microskirt or micro-miniskirt[/url] is a very short skirt, being shorter than a miniskirt, being less than 8 inches (20 cm) in length. The microskirt is sometimes humorously referred to as a beltskirt and is described as more an evocation of the idea of a skirt than something that covers anything substantial.\n\nAt that length, if the wearer has bare legs, the microskirt exposes the thighs and the lower portion of the buttocks, as well as part of the undergarment(s), with even more being exposed if the wearer bends down. To avoid exposure of buttocks and undergarment(s), a microskirt may be worn with tights, leggings, shorts or bloomers. Stretch microskirts may be made using spandex material which may be worn in conjunction with hold-ups and a pair of stiletto heel pumps, and sometimes with G-string underwear.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mule_%28shoe%29]Mule[/url], a French word, is a style of shoe that is backless and closed-toed. Mules can be any heel height - from flat to high. It differs from sandals because they are backless without straps or thongs passing around the ankle or heel. 
A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slide_%28footwear%29]slide[/url] is a shoe that is backless and open-toed, essentially an open-toed mule.

The sexy version of slides and mules is usually open-toed, with heels. 

Example: [url=http://www.getchu.com/brandnew/709009/c709009charab2.jpg]character wearing sexy mules[/url]

It consists of two or more curved blades affixed to a crossbar or glove, and is designed to slash through skin and muscle. \n\nFist claws is categorized under the fist weapon class.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shikigami]shikigami[/url] (spirit servant) is a spirit that can be summoned and controlled by a [url=https://vndb.org/i388]onmyouji[/url], like familiar are summoned by warlocks in occidental witchcraft. 
Shikigami's are invisible to the majority of people but they can assume physical human or animal form if ordered by the onmyouji.

Shikigami must be conjured during a complex ceremony and their power is connected to the spiritual force of their master. If the evoker is well introduced and has lots of experience, his Shikigami can possess animals and even people and manipulate them. But if the evoker is careless, his shikigami may get out of control in time, gaining its own will and consciousness. In this case the shikigami will raid its own master and kill him in revenge. Normally shikigami are conjured to exercise risky orders for their masters, such as spying around, stealing and enemy tracking.

Although this type of vibrators is not intended to be inserted into vagina or anus due to lack of water resistance, sometimes they're used that way.\n\n[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/72/82772.jpg]NSFW example[/url]

[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Jane_%28shoe%29]Mary Jane[/URL] is an American term for a closed, low-cut shoe with one or more straps across the instep.\n\nClassic Mary Janes are typically made of black leather or patent leather, have one thin strap fastened with a buckle or button, a broad and rounded toebox, low heels, and thin outsoles.
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lone_wolf_%28trait%29]lone wolf[/url] type personality.

This character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Underweight]underweight[/url].\n\nUnderweight is a term describing a human whose body weight is considered too low to be healthy. A person may be underweight due to genetics, metabolism, lack of food (frequently due to poverty), or illness.

A character with this trait wear loafers.\n\n[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slip-on_shoe]Loafers[/URL] are typically low, lace-less shoes. The style most commonly seen, known as a loafer or slippers in American culture, has a moccasin construction. A less casual, earlier type of loafer is made with side gussets. These shoes have elasticated inserts on the side which allow the shoe to be easily removed but remain snug when worn.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kilt]kilt[/url], a knee-length non-bifurcated skirt-type garment with pleats at the rear, originating in the traditional dress of men and boys in the Scottish Highlands of the 16th century. Since the 19th century it has become associated with the wider culture of Scotland in general, or with Celtic (and more specifically Gaelic) heritage even more broadly. It is most often made of woollen cloth in a tartan pattern.

This character [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/confine]confines[/url] someone.\n\nConfinement is to shut or keep a person in a small closed space and prevent that person from leaving this place because of imprisonment, illness, discipline, etc.

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oni]oni[/url].

Oni are creatures from Japanese folklore, variously translated as demons, devils, ogres or trolls. They are popular characters in Japanese art, literature and theatre.

Not to be confused with a western style [url=https://vndb.org/i498]Demon[/url].

The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nunchaku]nunchaku[/url] is a traditional Okinawan martial arts weapon consisting of two sticks connected at one end by a short chain or rope. The two sections of the weapon are commonly made out of wood, while the link is a cord or a metal chain. \n\nModern-day nunchaku can be made from metal, wood, plastic or fibreglass.The nunchaku is most widely used in martial arts such as Okinawan kobudō and karate. Many varieties of nunchaku are available.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butt_plug]butt plug[/url] is a sex toy that is designed to be inserted into the rectum for sexual pleasure. In some ways, they are similar to a dildo, but they tend to be shorter, and must have a flanged end to prevent the device from being lost inside the rectum.

Butt plugs come in a variety of colors, shapes, sizes, and textures. Some are designed to look like penises, while some are ribbed or wavy. The majority, however, are shaped, having a thin tip which is wider in the middle, a notch to hold it in place once it is inserted, and a flared base to prevent complete insertion into the rectum. Some plugs are designed (long, flexible and curved) to penetrate the sigmoid colon.

Butt plugs are made of a variety of materials, the most common being latex. Other materials used include silicone, neoprene, wood, metal, glass, stone, and many other materials.

The character is forced into a marriage that is not by his or her choice, is something they are opposed to actually doing, and would not consent to under normal circumstances. Reasons can vary between being sold into marriage against their will, parents forcing them to get married to someone (possibly under threat), or for some other reason.\n\nThis trait also counts if it was attempted but not successfully completed (such as the ceremony being interrupted for some reason). What matters is opposition to the marriage and being forced to go along with it.

A character with this trait is a charismatic person.

[URL=http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/charisma]Charisma[/URL] is defined as the "compelling attractiveness or charm that can inspire devotion in others".

Charismatic people are charming, friendly and extroverted people with great social skills. They tend to be good public speakers and street smart.
This character is the mother of another character's spouse.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Witch_hat]witch hat[/url], in popular culture, is the style of hat characterized by a conical crown and a wide brim (like akubras and gats), usually worn by fictional characters like witches or sorcerers.\n\nDepending upon the material in which the hat is made, the crown may regularly be observed in a flexed, bent or crumpled condition.

A [url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Lamia]Lamia[/url] is a monster with the upper torso of a human woman and the lower half of a snake. Known for living with their own kind in small villages or living stealthily in human settlements, they are extremely intelligent and individualistic.\n\nThis monster origins are rooted in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamia]greek mythology[/url] were she is a mistress of the god Zeus, causing Zeus' jealous wife, Hera, to kill all of Lamia's children and transform her into a monster that hunts and devours the children of others.

A [url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Werecat]werecat[/url] is a monster similar to a [url=https://vndb.org/i706]werewolf[/url] but with the characteristics of a cat instead of a wolf. They are sneaky, athletic and friendly creatures.\n\nThey’re generally harmless monsters most of the time, but they will be in heat every few months, when they will become incredibly violent and force human males they like into having sex with them.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estrous_cycle]Estrus cycle[/url] is the period of maximum sexual receptivity that the female of most mammals, excluding humans, experience just prior to ovulation.\n\nIn species/monsters with estrous cycles, females are generally only sexually active during the estrus phase of their cycle. This is also referred to as being "in heat".

A mandragora is [url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Mandragora]plant monster[/url] in the form of a woman with roots and a [url=http://it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mandragora]mandragora[/url] on top of the head. \n\nThe parts corresponding to the roots are buried deep within the earth. They only push out the flower on their head to the surface of the ground. They wait for their prey, which is lured by the sweet fragrance released from the flower petals, to come and pull them up.

A [url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Slime]slime[/url] is semi-liquid monster, with a flexible half-transparent body that can change into various forms. They are intelligent enough to speak, but their thoughts are simple, and they instinctively wander around in search of human men who will end up as their prey.\n\nA slime monster can grow upon feeding and duplicate himself originating a smaller copy. Various kind/color of slime monster exists every one with his own characteristics: bubble slime, red slime, dark slime, queen slime, sea slime, ecc...

An [url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Arachne]arachne[/url] is a bug type monster, with the lower body of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider]spider[/url] and the upper body of a human, that dwells in dark places such as caves and deep within forests. They have high intelligence, but most of them are lustful and belligerent. Since they have high physical abilities, they are very dangerous creatures.

They make sticky thread inside their body and use it to make a net-like web, and surprisingly, they're proficient in sewing.
Their main body and threads are weak to fire.

A [url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Mimic]mimic[/url] is a monsters that disguise himselves as treasure chests, waiting to leap out and attack unsuspecting adventurers. Since they set a trap by mimicking treasure chests, they usually live in places such as towers and caves, or other places where someone would likely find a treasure.\n\nEven though mimics seems affected by substantial practical problems about ergonomics and locomotion, they have powerful illusion, teleportation, and pocket-dimension-hopping abilities.

This character's skin is covered or partially covered by [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scale_(anatomy)]scales[/url].\n\nA scale is a small rigid plate that grows out of an animal's skin to provide protection and coloration. Scales are common amongst reptiles (snakes, dragons), fish and insects. Various types of scales exists according to shape and to class of animal.

This character is penetrated or otherwise sexually teased by a magic wand. 

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hitachi_Magic_Wand]Magic Wand[/url] is an electrical, mains-powered vibrating massager, manufactured for relieving tension and relaxing sore muscles. The device is well known for its use as a vibrator, and as a masturbation aid for women, because it functions effectively as a clitoral vibrator and is able to bring women to clitoral orgasm.

Because of the Magic Wand's popularity, various aftermarket attachments with differences in colour, pattern of studs, and material, became available to purchase.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blanket]blanket[/url] is a type of bedding, generally speaking, a large piece of cloth, intended to keep the user warm, especially while sleeping or laying down. \n\nBlankets are generally used for warmth and comfort and usually they are made of wool.

The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Andrew%27s_Cross_%28BDSM%29]X-cross[/url], St. Andrew's Cross, Crux decussata, X-frame or saltire cross is a common piece of equipment in BDSM dungeons. It typically provides restraining points for ankles, wrists, and waist. When secured to a saltire, the subject is restrained in a spreadeagle position.\n\nThe submissive may be attached to the cross with either the back or front facing the cross. Being restrained facing the cross is the position often used for whipping. Being attached with one's back to the cross is usually more of a sexual bondage position or used for sexual teasing.

The [url=http://goo.gl/je3GqL]mitre[/url] is a type of headgear now known as the traditional, ceremonial head-dress of bishops and certain abbots in the Roman Catholic Church, as well as in the Anglican Communion, some Lutheran churches, and also bishops and certain other clergy in the Eastern Orthodox churches, Eastern Catholic Churches and the Oriental Orthodox Churches. The Metropolitan of the Malankara Mar Thoma Syrian Church also wears a mitre during important ceremonies such as the Episcopal Consecration.

An [url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Harpy]harpy[/url] is a bird type monster, with the body of a girl and the legs of a bird, with big bird-like wings. Harpies can fly and for this reason boies are usually light and small.\n\nExcept for mating season, when they become aggrssive, harpies have bright and cheerful personalities.

This character skin is covered or partially covered by [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feather]feathers[/url].\n\nFeathers are epidermal growths that form the distinctive outer covering, or plumage, on birds. They aid in flight, thermal insulation, waterproofing, and coloration that helps in communication and protection.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hellhound]hellhound[/url] is a supernatural dog. Hellhounds have mangled black fur, glowing red eyes, super strength or speed, ghostly or phantom characteristics, and a foul odor. In cultures that associate the afterlife with fire, hellhounds may have fire-based abilities and appearance. 

They are often assigned to guard the entrances to the world of the dead, such as graveyards and burial grounds, or undertake other duties related to the afterlife or the supernatural, such as hunting lost souls or guarding a supernatural treasure. In European legends, seeing a hellhound or hearing it howl may be an omen or even a cause of death.

[url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Hellhound]Hellhound monster girls[/url] exhist too and they are ferocious, bold, selfish and untamable by man.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_guard]shin guard[/url] or shin pad is a piece of equipment worn on the front of a player’s shin to protect them from injury. These are commonly used in sports for protective protection measures.

In Greek mythology [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medusa]Medusa[/url] was a monster, a Gorgon, generally described as having the face of a hideous human female with living venomous snakes in place of hair. Gazing directly into her eyes would turn onlookers to stone. 

Famous is the story about Medusa beheaded by the hero Perseus, who thereafter used her head, which retained its ability to turn onlookers to stone, as a weapon until he gave it to the goddess Athena to place on her shield.

[url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Medusa]Monster girls medusa[/url] exists too, they are an high level type of [url=https://vndb.org/i1759]lamia[/url], having in common the same appearance: upper body of a human woman and the lower body of a snake.They differ from normal lamias as they possess the ability to cause the body of whomever they make eye contact with to harden like stone.

[url=http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/subcultures/monster-girls]Monster Girls[/url] are a special type of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mythic_humanoids]humanoid[/url] where the anthropomorphic character is a mix between a creature (both real and fictional) and a human. Which means some body parts/limbs of a creature has generally been added or switched on a human body. Most of them are an human torso on the top of a monster bottom body. One of the general rule is to keep the face and torso area human. The human is usually a female, though some rare male examples exist.

The umbrella terminology of monster girl can include certain types of personifications of monsters from video games, movies, books and so forth, like vampires, trolls, succubus... 
Mythological creatures such as fox girls or other types of humanoid creatures are often included and so forth.

Fetishism involving around monster girls is referred to as [url=https://vndb.org/g2205]teraphilia[/url].

A [url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Beelzebub]beelzebub[/url] is a bug type monster, with the body of a girl and the legs of a fly, with big fly-like wings. Beelzebubs can fly and for this reason bodies are usually light and small.\n\nBeelzebubs are referred to as "Lord of the flies" and "Lord of gluttony" since their lust and appetite are extremely ravenous.

This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stinger]stinger[/url].

A stinger, or sting, is a sharp organ found in various animals capable of injecting venom, usually by piercing the skin of the victim. Technically, a stinger is the part of an insect or animal that holds a sting, where a sting is the pointed organ, but in common language those terms are used interchangeably.

Well-known animals with sitngers are: hornets, some ants, centipedes, and scorpions.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jiangshi]jiangshi[/url] is a chinese [url=https://vndb.org/i487]vampire[/url]/[url=https://vndb.org/i1393]zombie[/url]. Jiangshi literally translates to 'stiff corpse'. It is a horrific creature that usually hops along, and when it comes across a victim it will suck the life force (in Chinese, "qi") out of them.

The jiangshi is said to be raised by a necromancer, or when the soul of a dead man cannot leave his body due to reasons in life, such as they were a horrible troublemaker, or if they commit suicide. The body looks different due to when they were raised. If they are raised soon after death, their appearance looks almost like a normal human, however if they have decomposed some time before they come to life, they can look horrific and ghastly.

Usually they are described as a pale white colour with furry green hair, moss, or mold growing on their flesh. The Jiang Shi also has pale, long white, messy hair atop their heads. They are said to have extremely long tongues and black, sharp fingernails, and they walk along with their arms outstretched.

A [url=http://monstergirlencyclopedia.wikia.com/wiki/Cancer]cancer[/url] is a crustacean type monster, with the upper body of a woman, a lower body covered in a hard shell, and one of their five pairs of crab legs have become giant pincers.\n\nCancers usually live near water, such as oceans, seashores, and rivers as normal crabs do.
This character has more than two eyes. This may be due to their non-human nature (extraterrestrial, monster, monster girl, android) or due to a mutation (genetic experiment, mutant).

This character uses "oira", one of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.\n"Oira" is similar to "ore", but more casual. May give off sense of more country bumpkin.

Double Peace Sign Ahegao (also known as W Sign Ahegao) it's also abbreviated in [url=http://g.e-hentai.org/g/581355/1d1c939056/?p=1]AWP[/url]: (A) Ahegao - (W) Double V - (P) Sign Peace

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canteen_(bottle)]canteen[/url] is a drinking water bottle designed to be used by hikers, campers, soldiers and workers in the field. It is usually fitted with a shoulder strap or means for fastening it to a belt, and may be covered with a cloth bag and padding to protect the bottle and insulate the contents.

Prime Minister

President of the Government
Chancellor
description: [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premier]Premier[/url] is a title for the head of government in some countries, states and sub-national governments. A second in command to a premier is designated as a vice-premier or deputy premier.

This character wears an animal pelt as clothing.

An animal pelt is obtained by skinning an animal.
People wearing animal pelts, not for cosplay, but as an everyday outfit are considered indigenous, barbaric and uncivilized.

A character with this trait wears or has worn a blazer.

A [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blazer]blazer[/URL] is a type of jacket resembling a suit coat, but cut more casually. Blazers often have naval-style metal buttons to reflect their historic association as jackets worn by boating club members.

Blazers are often part of a uniform that denotes, for example, an airline's employees, students of a particular school, members of yachting and rowing clubs, and athletes on a particular team.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nurarihyon]Nurarihyon[/url] is a Japanese youkai, considered to be the leader of all youkai. He is usually depicted as an old man with a gourd-shaped head and wearing a kesa. \n\nThe Nurarihyon will sneak into someone's house while they are away, drink their tea, and act as if it is their own house. Because it looks human, anyone who sees him will mistake him for the owner of the house, making it very hard to expel him.

The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nurikabe]nurikabe[/url] is a [url=https://vndb.org/i622]youkai[/url], or spirit, from Japanese folklore. It manifests as a wall that impedes or misdirects walking travelers at night. Nurikabe's main ability is that it can change its form and expand itself.\n\nTrying to go around is futile as it extends itself forever, but knocking on the lower left part of the wall makes it disappear. It has been suggested that the legend was created to explain travellers losing their bearings on long journeys.

[url=http://yokai.wikia.com/wiki/Daidarabotchi]Daidarabotchi[/url] is a gigantic youkai from Japanese mythology, sometime said to pose as a mountain range when sleeping. \n\nHis size was so great his footprints were said to have created in numerable lakes and ponds. He is the responsible for the Japanese geography, since he is able to move mountains and leave them wherever he wants.

A [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_gun]water gun[/url] is a type of toy gun designed to shoot water or liquid in science terms. Similar to water balloons, the primary purpose of the toy is to soak another person in a game such as water warfare.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamata_no_Orochi]Yamata no Orochi[/url] is a gigantic dragon/serpent with eight heads and eight tails and red eyes. Its body is long enough to cover eight peaks and valleys, and it's covered with moss and trees. Its belly is inflamed and smeared with blood.

The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kama_(weapon)]kama[/url] is a traditional Filipino and Japanese farming implement similar to a sickle used for reaping crops and also employed as a weapon. The kama is often included in weapon training segments of karate, silat and in some Chinese martial arts and can be used singly or in pairs.
This character ejaculates onto their own face or body, often multiple times, covering themself in their own semen.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massage]Massage[/url] involves working and acting on the body with pressure – structured, unstructured, stationary, or moving – tension, motion, or vibration, done manually or with mechanical aids. Massage can be applied with the hands, fingers, elbows, knees, forearm, feet, or a massage device. Massage can promote relaxation and well-being, can be a recreational activity, and can be sexual in nature.

Medical gloves are disposable gloves used during medical examinations and procedures that help prevent contamination between caregivers and patients. Medical gloves are made of different polymers including latex, nitrile rubber, vinyl and neoprene.

Rubber glove's primary purpose is protection of the hands while performing tasks involving chemicals. Rubber gloves can be worn during dishwashing to protect the hands from detergent and allow the use of hotter water.

A megaphone is a portable, usually hand-held, cone-shaped acoustic horn used to amplify a person’s voice or other sounds and direct it in a given direction. The sound is introduced into the narrow end of the megaphone, by holding it up to the face and speaking into it, and the sound waves radiate out the wide end. The megaphone increases the volume of sound by increasing the acoustic impedance seen by the vocal cords, matching the impedance of the vocal cords to the air, so that more sound power is radiated. It also serves to direct the sound waves in the direction the horn is pointing.

Sexual slavery is a process wherein someone 'forces' by varied means someone else to engage into sexual activity of some sort.

The mentioned 'force' could be outright force/coercion or be part of an agreement between a dominant and a submissive.
The means are varied and numerous, some not exhaustive means are blackmailing, hypnotism, mind breaking and sexual violence or some form of consensual slave contract.

There are two distinct forms of sexual slavery:
1. A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_slavery]non-consensual one[/url], an act of performing non-voluntary sexual activity due to coercion.
2. A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_slavery_%28BDSM%29]consensual one[/url], usually in some form of a dominant person owning a submissive person as property.

In the environment of visual novels, mainly nukige there has to be postulated a third form of sexual slavery:
3. A semi-(non-)consensual one, wherein the 'submissive' has first to be persuaded by the dominant person by means usually regarded as a criminal act in real life. The Japanese subculture has defined the word 調教 [choukyou] for this, which literally means ‘to teach an animal to do something or to behave correctly’.

Mahjong is a game that originated in China. It is commonly played by four players (with some three-player variations found in South Korea and Japan). Similar to the Western card game rummy, mahjong is a game of skill, strategy, and calculation and involves a degree of chance.\n\nThe game is played with a set of 144 tiles based on Chinese characters and symbols, although some regional variations use a different number of tiles. In most variations, each player begins by receiving 13 tiles. In turn players draw and discard tiles until they complete a legal hand using the 14th drawn tile to form four groups (melds) and a pair (head).

A [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Security_guard]security guard[/url], or security officer, is a person who is paid to protect property, assets, or people. They are usually privately and formally employed civilian personnel. Security officers are generally uniformed and act to protect property by maintaining a high-visibility presence to deter illegal and inappropriate actions, observing for signs of crime, fire or disorder; then taking action and reporting any incidents to their client and emergency services as appropriate.
A ride on the back and shoulders of another person.

This character is subject of a debt.

A debt generally refers to money owed by one party, the borrower or debtor, to a second party, the lender or creditor. Debt is generally subject to contractual terms regarding the amount and timing of repayments of principal and interest.

Common types of debt owed by individuals and households include mortgage loans, car loans, and credit card debt. Besides these more formal debts, private individuals also lend informally to other people, mostly relatives or friends. One reason for such informal debts is that many people, in particular those who are poor, have no access to affordable credit. Such debts can cause problems when they are not paid back according to expectations of the lending household.

A character with this trait wears a pair of Tabi.\n\n[URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tabi]Tabi[/URL] are traditional Japanese socks. Ankle-high and with a separation between the big toe and other toes, they are worn by both men and women with [URL=https://vndb.org/i1672]zouri[/URL], geta, and other traditional thonged footwear.

A character with this trait wears a pair of Geta.\n\n[URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geta_%28footwear%29]Geta[/URL] are a form of traditional Japanese footwear that resemble both clogs and flip-flops. They are a kind of sandal with an elevated wooden base held onto the foot with a fabric thong to keep the foot well above the ground. They are worn with traditional Japanese clothing such as kimono or yukata, but (in Japan) also with Western clothing during the summer months.
A baseball glove allows the wearer to more easily catch a baseball, due to its large, cupped shape. It is generally made up of a leather (or synthetic alternative) outer layer, with a fabric lining.

Uwabaki are a type of Japanese slippers worn indoors at home, school or certain companies and public buildings where street shoes are prohibited. Uwabaki are light, flexible shoes which are easy to slip on and off, designated for indoor use. 

As they are not generally worn outside, the soles are kept clean, and thus cleaning and maintenance of the building's floors are kept to a minimum.

Refusing to be told what to do or how to act, these characters will regularly lash out at authority, either passively or overtly, and often times reject the accepted mores of society. Examples of rebellious behavior include skipping school, smoking cigarettes, and getting into frequent arguments with authority figures such as teachers and parents.\n\nNote that the motivation behind their behavior is important. Not all smokers or school skippers, or smoking school skippers, are rebellious. Their actions have to be primarily motivated purely by the will to defy.

This character plays [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shogi]shogi[/url] at some point in the story.

Shogi is a two-player strategy board game in the same family as Western (international) chess, chaturanga, makruk, shatranj and xiangqi, and is the most popular of a family of chess variants native to Japan.

Two players, Sente 先手 (Black; more literally, person with the first move) and Gote 後手 (White; person with the second move), play on a board composed of rectangles in a grid of 9 ranks (rows) by 9 files (columns). The board is nearly always rectangular. Each player has a set of 20 wedge-shaped pieces of slightly different sizes. Except for the kings, opposing pieces are undifferentiated by marking or color.

This character plays [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_football]American football[/url].\n\nAmerican football is a sport played by two teams of eleven players on a rectangular field with goalposts at each end. The offense, the team with control of the oval-shaped football, attempts to advance down the field by running with or passing the ball, while the team without control of the ball, the defense, aims to stop their advance and take control of the ball for themselves. The offense must advance at least ten yards in four downs, or plays, or else they turn over the football to the opposing team; if they succeed, they are given a new set of four downs. Points are primarily scored by advancing the ball into the opposing team's end zone for a touchdown or kicking the ball through the opponent's goalposts for a field goal. The team with the most points at the end of a game wins.

This character wears a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tutu_%28clothing%29]tutu[/url].\n\nA tutu is a female ballet dancer’s costume consisting of a bodice and an attached skirt incorporating numerous layers of fabric, this being either short and stiff and projecting horizontally from the waist (the classical tutu) or long, soft, and bell-shaped (the romantic tutu).

This character wears a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polo_shirt]polo shirt[/url].\n\nA polo shirt is a form of shirt with a collar, a placket with typically two or three buttons, and an optional pocket.

Very short shorts terminating at the upper thigh. The term 'Hotpants' may be used interchangeably, though the term originally applied to shorts made in luxury fabrics such as velvet and silk. This character is a sheep or a humanoid possessing sheep-like traits.\n\nA sheep is a type of farm mammal known for their distinguishable woolly fur. Male sheeps are called "rams" and are known to possess horns.

This character uses "sessha" (拙者), one of the [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]Japanese pronouns[/url] for "I", to address themselves.\n\nSessha is a very humble and archaic form of addressing oneself used mostly by males.
This character is a sculptor.\n\nA sculptor is an artist who specializes in [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sculpture]sculpture[/url].
This character is an [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Architect]architect[/url].\n\nAn architect is a person who plans, designs, and oversees the construction of buildings.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Receptionist]receptionist[/url].\n\nA receptionist is an employee taking an office/administrative support position. The work is usually performed in a waiting area such as a lobby or front office desk of an organization or business. The title "receptionist" is attributed to the person who is employed by an organization to receive or greet any visitors, patients, or clients and answer telephone calls. The term Front Desk is used in many hotels for an administrative department where a receptionist's duties also may include room reservations and assignment, guest registration, cashier work, credit checks, key control as well as mail and message service. Such receptionists are often called front desk clerks.
This character overuses or overemphasizes the word "desu no" at the end of their sentences.\n\nLike ~desu wa, ~desu no is a more refined and polite way of using ~desu.
This character has sex in the infirmary of the school.

This character carries and/or uses paper talismans. They consists of a small rectangular paper with the kanji of a representative Shinto kami inscribed.

Paper talisman often originate from Shinto religion. They are often used in exorcism, wards, and purification. They may be hanged around a house or placed on things in hopes

In fictional use of paper talismans, they may contain mystical magic powers. Generally these are used as a tool for fighting spirits and monsters. Intuitively, paper talismans may function as something else, such as being made as an explosive item.

This character is a son of an upper class family. The male equivalent of an [url=/i1727]Ojou-sama[/url].

The upper class is the social class composed of the wealthiest members of society, who also wield the greatest political power. The upper class is generally contained within the wealthiest 1-2% of the population, and is distinguished by immense wealth (in the form of estates) which is passed from generation to generation.

This tag is about the social status of the character and does not refer to his behavior.
This character is framed for a crime.\n\nFrame-up is a plan to make an innocent person appear to be guilty of a crime.

This character has a rather large, shapely, ample posterior, usually accompanied by curvacious and enticing hips and thighs.\nThis is either obvious in the art by the ass sticking out (e.g. v18755) or discussed by characters in the game.

This character is a dropout from school.\n\nDropping out means leaving a school, college, university or group for practical reasons, necessities, or disillusionment with the system from which the individual in question leaves. It is a more common term in the US and Canada, but also applies worldwide.

A character with this trait elopes with another character of the VN.\n\n[URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elopement_%28marriage%29]Elopement[/URL] is often used to refer to a marriage conducted in sudden and secretive fashion, usually involving a hurried flight away from one's place of residence together with one's beloved with the intention of getting married. It is colloquially used for any marriage performed in haste, with a limited public engagement period or without a public engagement period. Some couples elope because they wish to avoid objections from parents, or religious obligations.

This character carries somebody the bridal style.\n\nA man or possibly a woman carries a woman/man in his arms — one arm under their legs and the other supporting their back like a groom carrying his bride.

This character is seen with a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wrench]wrench[/url].\n\nA wrench is a tool used to provide grip and mechanical advantage in applying torque to turn objects—usually rotary fasteners, such as nuts and bolts—or keep them from turning.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wild_boar]boar[/url].\n\nBoars are a suid native to much of Eurasia, North Africa, and the Greater Sunda Islands. Boars are a bulky, massively built suid with short and relatively thin legs. The trunk is short and massive, while the hindquarters are comparatively underdeveloped. The animal's head is very large, taking up to one third of the body's entire length.

This character is shown to carry a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taser]taser[/url] and possibly use it as well.

Taser is a type of electroshock weapon used by firing two small dart-like electrodes, which stay connected to the main unit by conductors, to deliver electric current to disrupt voluntary control of muscles causing "neuromuscular incapacitation". The electrodes are pointed to penetrate clothing and barbed to prevent removal once in place.

Unlike a [url=/i1306]stun gun[/url], a taser can launch its electrodes, allowing the user to maintain some distance between themselves and the target.
