Polyamory is the practice of having more than one intimate relationship at the same time, with the full knowledge and consent of all partners involved.

Use [url=/i862]polygamy[/url] instead if the character is married to more then one spouse.

In Japan, a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R%C5%8Dnin_(student)]kanendosei[/url] (colloquially, a "ronin") is a student who has graduated from middle school or high school but has failed to enter a school at the next level, and consequently is studying outside of the school system for entrance in a future year. They may study at a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yobik%C5%8D]yobiko[/url].\n\nA [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R%C5%8Dnin]ronin[/url] was a samurai with no lord or master during the feudal period (1185–1868) of Japan. In modern Japanese usage, the term also describes a salaryman who is "between employers" or a secondary school graduate who has not yet been admitted to university.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janitor]janitor[/url].\n\nA janitor (American English, Scottish English), custodian (British English), janitress (female), cleaner or caretaker is a person who cleans and maintains buildings such as hospitals, schools and residential accommodation. A janitors' primary responsibility is as a cleaner, but in some cases, they will also carry out maintenance and security duties.

This character is infamous, someone who is known for a reputation that's not exactly regarded positively in public eyes.

The counterpart of being famous, this character is well known for some bad quality or deed. Note that being infamous does not mean one is automatically a criminal or villain or evil, many infamy can be created due to the character's reputation, wide spread rumors, and/or the person being misunderstood, the same as how positive fame is spread, only towards a more negative note.

ex. being a lone wolf that is well known for some reputation yet most people hesitate to interact with him/her due to said reputation and/or maybe along with their intimidating air, but in fact that person may have a heart of gold or is just misunderstood.

On the other hand, it's also possible for one person to be both famous and infamous at the same time, being well known and revered to positively on one hand in one group, while at the same time resented or feared by some other group of people or even seen as an outcast with a formidable and/or notorious reputation.

On another note, many criminals and villains usually have a reputation of infamy. However, it should be noted that although criminals, villains, and generally evil characters are usually infamous, infamy does not automatically mark someone as evil as explained above. Many anti-heroes can have a degree of infamy, the same as how a villain can actually be famous positively but it's actually a mask to hide their true selves and goals as well as using the public to their advantage.

This character has [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autism]autism[/url].

Autism is a disorder of neural development characterized by impaired social interaction, by impaired verbal and non-verbal communication, and by restricted, repetitive or stereotyped behavior. The diagnostic criteria require that symptoms become apparent before a child is three years old.

Only use this tag for characters who are explicitly said to be autistic (within the story or by the creators). Do not use it for characters who are simply too shy to properly communicate, for example.
A character with this trait is a subject of sacrifice in darker purposes, whether they are willing or unwilling.

This character is the leader of a music club associated with a school.\n\nTypically, the main goal of a music club is to gather together to learn to play music, sing songs, and perfect their skills day by day. A club typically has the opportunity to hold a performance at the school's festival, which is usually a concert in an auditorium.

Modern earmuffs come in two basic kinds:

-Thermal earmuffs, worn in cold environments to keep a person's ears warm with pads of cloth or fur.
-Acoustic earmuffs, also known as ear defenders: cups lined with sound-deadening material, like thermal earmuffs and headphones in appearance, which are worn as hearing protection. These may be carried on a head-band or clipped onto the sides of a hard hat, for use on construction sites.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centaur]centaur[/url].\n\nA centaur is a mythological creature with the upper body of a human and the lower body of a horse. The centaurides or centauresses are female centaurs.

An [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orc]orc[/url] is a fictional humanoid creature that is part of a fantasy race akin to goblins.

The exact definition of the orc varies greatly depending on the setting. Orcs typical to western fantasy tend to strongly resemble humans, but are much taller and more muscular, have green or tan-colored skin, and have tusks. Orcs typical to Japanese-style fantasy tend to possess pig-like features such as snouts and pig ears, or are sometimes little more than gigantic, bipedal pigs.

Other varieties exist, and anything that is called an orc in-fiction can be tagged as such.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midwife]midwife[/url].\n\nA midwife is a professional in [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midwifery]midwifery[/url], specializing in pregnancy, childbirth, postpartum, women's sexual and reproductive health (including annual gynecological exams, family planning, menopausal care and others), and newborn care.

A [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_breakdown]mental breakdown[/URL] is an acute, time-limited mental disorder that manifests primarily as severe stress-induced depression, anxiety, or dissociation in a previously functional individual, to the extent that they are no longer able to function on a day-to-day basis until the disorder is resolved.\n\nA nervous breakdown is defined by its temporary nature, and often closely tied to psychological burnout, severe overwork, sleep deprivation, and similar stressors, which may combine to temporarily overwhelm an individual with otherwise sound mental functions.

This character has an [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eidetic_memory]eidetic memory[/url].\n\nEidetic memory is an ability to vividly recall images from memory after only a few instances of exposure, with high precision for a brief time after exposure, without using a mnemonic device. Although the terms eidetic memory and photographic memory are popularly used interchangeably, they are also distinguished, with eidetic memory referring to the ability to view memories like photographs for a few minutes, and photographic memory referring to the ability to recall page or text numbers, or similar, in great detail.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blacksmith]blacksmith[/url].

A blacksmith is a metalsmith who creates objects from wrought iron or steel by forging the metal, using tools to hammer, bend, and cut. Blacksmiths produce objects such as gates, grilles, railings, light fixtures, furniture, sculpture, tools, agricultural implements, decorative and religious items, cooking utensils and weapons.

Blacksmiths also have a general knowledge of how to make and repair many things, from the most complex of weapons and armor to simple things like nails or lengths of chain.

This character has a tail covered with fur. This type of tail is usually drawn to resemble the tail of a particular mammalian species, and the character will typically have ears that match it.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/ch/37/7737.jpg]Example 1[/url] - cat tail
[url=https://s.vndb.org/ch/10/11610.jpg]Example 2[/url] - dog tail
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/46/87246.jpg]Example 3[/url] - fox tail
These are the traits relating to skin textures (like scales) or coverings (like fur) that may cover some or most of the skin.

The characters is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gnome]gnome[/url].\n\nGnomes are diminutive spirits in Renaissance magic and alchemy, first introduced by Paracelsus in the 16th century and later adopted by more recent authors including those of modern fantasy literature. Its characteristics have been reinterpreted to suit the needs of various storytellers, but it is typically said to be a small humanoid that lives underground.

The character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siren]siren[/url]. \n\nBased off of Greek mythology, the siren is a dangerous creature that who lure nearby sailors with their enchanting music and voices to shipwreck on the rocky coast of their island.

This character comes from Madagascar.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiger]tiger[/url] or a tigress.\n\nThe tiger (Panthera tigris) is the largest cat species, most recognisable for their pattern of dark vertical stripes on reddish-orange fur with a lighter underside.

A relationship breakup, often referred to simply as a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breakup]breakup[/url], is the termination of an intimate relationship by any means other than death. Please refer to the "Engages in/[URL=https://vndb.org/i2455]Breakup[/URL]" for characters that are the ones initiating the breakup.

[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remarriage]Remarriage[/url] is a marriage that takes place after a previous marital union has ended, as through divorce or widowhood. In this event, the ex-spouse will have married another person to continue a marital relationship, with another partner.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish]fish[/url].\n\nA fish is any member of a group of animals that consist of all gill-bearing aquatic craniate animals that lack limbs with digits.
This character suffers from a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phobia]phobia[/url].\n\nA phobia is a type of anxiety disorder, defined by a persistent fear of an object or situation.

This character's hair length is much longer than floor length and either drags on the floor or must be tied up. It may even be miles in length or endless.

http://safebooru.org/index.php?page=post&s=view&id=2015961
http://safebooru.org/index.php?page=post&s=view&id=1858821

This character carries a [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quiver]quiver[/URL].\n\nA quiver is a container for arrows, crossbow bolts or darts, such as those fired from a bow, crossbow or blowgun. It can be carried on an archer's body, the bow, or the ground, depending on the type of shooting and the archer's personal preference. Quivers were traditionally made of leather, wood, furs, and other natural materials, but are now often made of metal or plastic.

This character was forced to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-dressing]cross-dress[/url] by other people.

Cross-dressing is the wearing of clothing and other accessories commonly associated with a gender within a particular society that is seen as different than the one usually presented by the dresser. Cross-dressing has been used for disguise, performance art and as a literary trope in modern times and throughout history.

For cross-dressing consented by the character themselves, use [url=/i48]Engages in >> Cross-dressing[/url].

This character has one or more braid used as hair ties.

Note: This trait is not about braided ties (objects) but about ties made by natural hair braids.

Examples: https://vndb.org/c24938, https://vndb.org/c694, https://vndb.org/c36081
This character masturbates with water via a faucet, showerhead, jacuzzi jet, etc.

This character wears a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toga]toga[/url] or one of its related garments. A toga is a robe-like garment made from a semicircular piece of cloth which is draped over the body. Togas are traditionally associated with ancient Rome, where they were a type of (usually men's) formal wear.\n\nRelated to the toga is the [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stola]stola[/url], a type of long, pleated dress worn by women in ancient Rome which looks similar and is often called a toga in modern English.
This character [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grade_retention]repeats a grade[/URL]. The reason may be bad grades, too many absences or severe violation.

[URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snowballing_(sexual_practice)]Snowballing[/URL] is a human sexual practice in which one person takes someone else's semen into his or her mouth and then passes it to the mouth of the other, usually through kissing.\n\nThe semen may afterwards be returned to the partner's mouth, mixed with saliva; the couple or other partners may then exchange the fluid several times, causing its volume to increase (hence "snowballing").

trait_alias:
Cosmetic Operation
Aesthetic Plastic Surgery
Breast Enhancement
Lip Enhancement
Facelift
description:
This person receives a cosmetic surgery. Cosmetic surgery is an optional procedure that is performed on normal parts of the body with the only purpose of improving a person's appearance and/or removing signs of aging.

The scope of cosmetic surgery procedures includes:
* Breast Enhancement: Augmentation, Lift, Reduction
* Facial Contouring: Rhinoplasty, Chin, or Cheek Enhancement
* Facial Rejuvenation: Facelift, Eyelid Lift, Neck Lift, Brow Lift
* Body Contouring: Tummy Tuck, Liposuction, Gynecomastia Treatment
* Skin Rejuvenation: Laser Resurfacing, Botox, Filler Treatments

This character teaches [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_education]sex education[/url], which cover topics and issues regarding anything about sexuality.\n\nPlease only use this trait for formal sex education teachers (for instance, somebody teaching an inexperienced partner "what to do" in a sexual situation doesn't count).
This character often uses the [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KRFLMu7qzWs]ara ara[/url] expression.

A [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Landlord]landlord[/url] is the owner of a house, apartment, condominium, land or real estate which is rented or leased to an individual or business, who is called a tenant (also a lessee or renter).

trait_alias: Joshi-Mane\nSchool Sports Club Aide\nSchool Sports Club Manager
description: This character is a sports club manager.\n\nA sports club manager is a person (typically female) who helps a sports team with various menial tasks, such as cleaning and sorting equipment, laundry, recording player and game stats, distributing towels and drinks, and others.

[URL=https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/streetwise]Streetwise[/URL] characters have a wealth experience and knowledge in dealing with dangerous or difficult situations. They are comfortable in navigating criminal circles, though it does not necessarily mean they are criminals themselves.

[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karuta]Karuta[/url] is a Japanese card game originating from Portugal. Most of the karuta games use [url=/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E-awase]e-awase[/url] cards.\n\nThe basic idea of any e-awase karuta game is to be able to quickly determine which card out of an array of cards is required and then to grab the card before it is grabbed by an opponent. The two types of e-awase karuta decks that are most often seen are the uta-garuta and iroha-karuta. In uta-garuta, players try to find the last two lines of a waka given the first three lines. It is often possible to identify a poem by its first one or two syllables. The poems for this game are taken from the Ogura Hyakunin Isshu and are traditionally played on New Year's Day.

明るい
Always in a Good Mood
Happy
Sunny
description: This character is [URL=https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/cheerful]cheerful[/URL], seeming to always be in a good mood. They're happy and wear big, bright smiles.

This character wears a [URL=http://www.yourdictionary.com/utility-belt]utility belt[/URL], which is a is a belt with pockets, loops, etc. for carrying useful items.

Often used for professional purposes but this trait can also apply to those who wear it as a fashion statement.

[URL=http://www.occidental-leather.com/adjustable/9855.jpg]Example 1: Builder[/URL]
[URL=http://multifiles.pressherald.com/uploads/sites/4/2011/04/UtilityBeltGraphic0411-1024x914.jpg]Example 2: Police officer[/URL]
[URL=http://www.thefoamcave.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/41Iqk2V-MoL.jpg]Example 3: Generic/Unspecified[/URL]

Found more often in written than in spoken Japanese, the speaker uses [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns#List_of_Japanese_personal_pronouns]this personal pronoun[/URL] as a measure of respect through the derogation of self.

A [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Straitjacket]straitjacket[/URL] is a garment shaped like a jacket with overlong sleeves and is typically used to restrain a person who may otherwise cause harm to him/herself or others.\n\nOnce the arms are inserted into the straitjacket's sleeves, they are then crossed across the chest. The ends of the sleeves are then tied to the back of the wearer, ensuring that the arms are kept close to the chest with as little movement as possible.
This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Film_director]film director[/url].\n\nA director is a person who directs the making of a film, movie or TV show.
This character is a middle brother.\n\nA middle brother is a male sibling who is older than his younger sibling, but at the same time he's younger than his elder sibling.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trans_woman]transwoman[/url].

Transsexual people experience a gender identity that is inconsistent or not culturally associated with their assigned sex, and desire to permanently transition to the gender with which they identify- usually seeking medical assistance to help them align their body with their identified sex or gender.

A transwoman is a woman who was assigned male at birth, but who has already made a permanent or partial transition, or have recently started to transition to the opposite sex (this could be before or during the story).

Please note that transwomen and [URL=https://vndb.org/i737]futanari[/URL] are not the same- transwomen only have one set of genitalia whereas futanari possess both male and female genitalia.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trans_man]transman[/url].

Transsexual people experience a gender identity that is inconsistent or not culturally associated with their assigned sex, and desire to permanently transition to the gender with which they identify- usually seeking medical assistance to help them align their body with their identified sex or gender.

A trans man is a man who was assigned female at birth, but who has already made a permanent or partial transition, or have recently started to transition to the opposite sex (this could be before or during the story).

trait_alias: Lotus-Eater Machine\nTrapped in a Simulated Reality
description:
This character is confined in a [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simulated_reality]simulated reality[/URL], involuntarily or voluntarily.

While this trait applies to anybody confined in any kind of simulated reality, the "Lotus-Eater Machine" scenario refers to a specific variety of confinement in a simulated reality. In this, a character, usually the protagonist, is knocked out or goes to sleep and wakes up in their own personal paradise. In reality, they're being held prisoner by another character who, using technology, magic or other methods, induces very intense and very realistic hallucinations. Sometimes the lotus-eater doesn't know it's all fake. Sometimes they do know but don't care. [Edited from [url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LotusEaterMachine]TV Tropes[/url]]

NOTE: By the very nature of this trait, the majority- if not all- of its instances would be spoilers. Please apply spoilers accordingly.

This character is involved in a romantic relationship that doesn't work out and they "dump" their partner.

A relationship breakup, often referred to simply as a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breakup]breakup[/url], is the termination of an intimate relationship by any means other than death. The act is commonly termed "dumping [someone]" in slang when it is initiated by one partner or "getting dumped by [someone]" for the partner on the receiving end.

Please refer to the "Subject of/[URL=https://vndb.org/i2406/]Breakup[/URL]" for characters that are on the receiving end of a breakup.

This character is a [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nun]nun[/URL].

A nun is a member of a religious community of women, typically one living under vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience. She may have decided to dedicate her life to serving all other living beings, or she might be an ascetic who voluntarily chose to leave mainstream society and live her life in prayer and contemplation in a monastery or convent. 

The term "nun" is applicable to Catholics (eastern and western traditions), Orthodox Christians, Anglicans, Lutherans, Jains, Buddhists, Taoists, Hindus and some other religious traditions.

This character engages in a specific type of [URL=https://vndb.org/i557]cosplay[/URL]- dressing up as an animal.\n\nNOTE: For characters that only engage in sexual cosplay, please use the more specific [URL=https://vndb.org/i2458]Sexual Animal Cosplay[/URL] trait instead.
This character engages in a specific type of [URL=https://vndb.org/i557]cosplay[/URL]- dressing up in sexualised animal costumes.
This character is a priest for a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Priest#Christianity]Christian[/url] sect, ie, Catholic, Anglican, Orthodox.\n\nA priest performs mass and takes care of a church.

This character engages in [URL=https://vndb.org/i557]sexualised cosplay[/URL], meaning that they participate in sexual activities whilst dressing up either as a different fictional character, or creature (real or fictional).

This character gives [URL=https://vndb.org/i1121]birth[/URL] from the anus.\n\nIf the character gives birth to non-humanoids or monsters use this trait in conjunction with [URL=https://vndb.org/i1128]Monster Birth[/URL].

trait_alias:
Dental Assistant
Dental Auxiliary
Dental Hygienist
Dental Technician
Dental Therapist
Dental Doctor
description:
This character works as a dentist. 

A [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dentist]dentist[/url], also known as a dental surgeon, is a surgeon who specializes in dentistry, the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases and conditions of the oral cavity. The dentist's supporting team aids in providing oral health services. The dental team includes dental assistants, dental hygienists, dental technicians, and, in some states, dental therapists.

This trait can also be used for those who work in the aforementioned dental supporting team.
This character is involved in a pornographic production against their will (as a subject of rape) or unconsciously (using a hidden camera, deception, hypnosis, etc.)
This character engages in creating a pornographic production against the subject's will.

This character wears a collar for slavery purposes.

A slave collar is a band encircling the neck which is placed on the wearer by another person to indicate the wearer's submission or enslavement.

In sexual situations, this often incorporates [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collar_(BDSM)]collar use in BDSM[/URL].

A character with this trait wears a pet collar.

A [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collar_(animal)]pet collar[/URL] is a piece of material put around the neck of certain pet animals, such as dogs or cats, for control, identification, or other purposes. Identification tags and medical information is often placed on collars. Collars are also useful for controlling the animal, as they provide a handle for grabbing or means of leading.

[URL=https://vndb.org/c9473]Example 1[/URL]
[URL=https://vndb.org/c14653]Example 2[/URL]
[URL=https://vndb.org/c54555]Example 3[/URL]

NOTE: This trait is intended for [pet] animals wearing collars, not humans wearing collars in a slavery and/or sexual context.

For collars worn in slavery contexts (including in sexual contexts), please use [URL=https://vndb.org/i2465]Slave Collar[/URL]. 
For collar-styled neck accessories (usually worn by humans), please use [URL=https://vndb.org/i1568]Choker[/URL].
This character is a [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Animal]real-life animal[/URL].

This character is in an open relationship.

An [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_relationship]open relationship[/URL] is an umbrella term for any relationship that is open to new sexual and/or romantic partners.

Specifically, it is an interpersonal relationship in which the parties want to be together but agree to a form of non-monogamous relationship. This means that they agree that other people relating in a flirting manner, sexual or physical, or intimate way with their partner is permitted, or often times tolerated. Generally, an open relationship is when the parties involved have two or more sexual relationships occurring at the same time either as a short-term relationship, such as dating, or a long-term relationship, such as marriage.

description: This character wears a band- usually a collar or bracelet- with lethal functions designed to force them into participating in a death game.\n\nThe band is typically unable to be removed by the person who wears it, and is equipped with a mechanism that causes the person's death, such as exploding or injecting poison into their body.

Another character farts on this character's face. Apply [url=/i2402]Face-farting[/url] to the character doing the farting.\n\nFace-farting is a bonding activity where a person, usually a girl, sits on a boy's or another girl's face and forces them to smell their farts. Normally, it is done for sexual pleasure for either side.

[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massage]Massage[/url] involves working and acting on the body with pressure – structured, unstructured, stationary, or moving – tension, motion, or vibration, done manually or with mechanical aids. Massage can be applied with the hands, fingers, elbows, knees, forearm, feet, or a massage device. Massage can promote relaxation and well-being, can be a recreational activity, and can be sexual in nature.

[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erotic_massage]Erotic massage[/url] or sensuous massage is the use of massage techniques by a person on another person's erogenous zones to achieve or enhance their sexual excitation or arousal. In the case of women, the two focal areas are the breasts and pubis, while in case of men, the focal area is the male genitals.

This character [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spitting]spits[/url] on another character during a sex scene in order to produce erotic excitement or sexual arousal. Apply [url=/i2475]Subject of (Sexual) > Erotic Spitting[/url] to the other character, or [url=/i2476]Engages in (Sexual) > Spit Drinking[/url] if they're drinking it.\n\nErotic Spitting can be done, but not necessarily, as a type of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erotic_humiliation]erotic humiliation[/url] and usually contains elements of submission for the person being spat on, and dominance, for the person spitting.

Another character [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spitting]spits[/url] on this character during a sex scene in order to produce erotic excitement or sexual arousal. Apply [url=/i2474]Engages in (Sexual) > Erotic Spitting[/url] to the spitting character.\n\nErotic Spitting can be done, but not necessarily, as a type of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erotic_humiliation]erotic humiliation[/url] and usually contains elements of submission for the person being spat on, and dominance, for the person spitting.

This character drinks another character's spit in a sex scene. Apply [url=/i2474]Engages in (Sexual) > Erotic Spitting[/url] to the spitting character.\n\nErotic Spitting can be done, but not necessarily, as a type of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erotic_humiliation]erotic humiliation[/url] and usually contains elements of submission for the person being spat on, and dominance, for the person spitting.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Godparent]godparent[/url].

A godparent, in many denominations of Christianity, is someone who bears witness to a child's baptism, although the term has also been used in a legal sense. In both religious and civil views, a godparent tends to be an individual chosen by the parents to take an interest in the child's upbringing and personal development, and to take care of the child should anything happen to the parents.
In fairy tales, a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairy_godmother]fairy godmother[/url] is a fairy with magical powers who acts as a mentor or parent to someone, in the role that an actual godparent was expected to play in many societies.

This character is a godchild.\n\nA godchild, in the Christian religion, is a child whose moral and religious development is partly the responsibility of two or more [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Godparent]godparents[/url].

This character has a human-like appearance. Features include two-legged bipedalism and at least two arms and hands.\n\nThis trait is to describe [url=/i408]nature[/url] characters that feature human-like features. Do not apply this trait to characters who are pure human beings.

Bunny girl cosplay are far more common in Japan than normal bunny/rabbit cosplay.

The key parts of a bunny girl costume/dress are: bunny kemonomimi headband and leotard. Other items usually added to the costume are: fishnet or normal pantyhose, high heels, bunny tail, cuffs, bowtie.

In case of sexual roleplay use it in conjunction with [url=https://vndb.org/i2458]Sexual Animal Cosplay[/url] and [url=https://vndb.org/i1370]Petplay[/url] (if applicable).

[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_blindness]Color blindness[/url], also known as color vision deficiency, is the decreased ability to see color or differences in color.

The character is fully aware that they are in the game and break the illusion of reality of the game's setting by either indirectly or directly addressing the audience.

Alternatively, they may interact with their creator (the writer or director of the novel, etc.). This is more akin to breaking one of the walls of the set, but the existence of a director implies the existence of an audience, so it's still indirectly Breaking The Fourth Wall.

This trope is usually used for comedic purposes.

Read more on [url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakingTheFourthWall?from=Main.BreakTheFourthWall]TV Tropes[/url].

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single_parent]single parent[/url]. They are raising, or have raised, one or more children on their own. This is most often a result of the parent separating from a partner, having a child unintentionally, or becoming widowed. However, a person can also choose to have or adopt a child by themselves.

This character wears their clothing unfastened, untidy, and unsecured. Distinctively, they're often seen with open [url=/i160]shirts[/url] and untied [url=/i999]ribbons[/url].\n\nOnly apply this trait to characters who primarily wear (at least a few) clothing articles unfastened. Do not confuse with i2106, where the character wears clothing apparently big for them.

This character wears a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bedlah]bedlah[/url]-type costume.

In the world of belly dance the term bedlah refers simply to the costume that a dancer wears. Most commonly it is used to refer to the matched set of bra and belt that cabaret dancers use, but technically it encompasses all parts of the dancer's costume as well, such as the jewelry, headband, skirt, pants and veil. This is often referred to as a Complete Bedlah.

Occasionally it also refers to just one piece of the costume such as the highly ornate belt that tribal dancers wear which may or may not have a matching bra.

A [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goblin]goblin[/url] is a monstrous creature from European folklore, first attested in stories from the Middle Ages. They are ascribed various and conflicting abilities, temperaments and appearances depending on the story and country of origin. They are almost always small and grotesque, mischievous or outright malicious, and greedy, especially for gold and jewelry.
The [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zucchetto]zucchetto[/url] is a small, hemispherical, form-fitting ecclesiastical skullcap worn by clerics of various Catholic churches.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flagellation]Flagellation[/url] (Latin flagellum, "whip"), flogging, whipping or lashing is the act of methodically beating the human body with special implements such as whips, lashes, rods, switches, the cat o' nine tails, the sjambok, etc. 

Typically, flogging is imposed on an unwilling subject as a punishment; however, it can also be submitted to willingly, or performed on oneself, in religious or sadomasochistic contexts.

Apply this trait on characters whipping someone. Apply its [url=https://vndb.org/i1676]counterpart[/url] to the characters being whipped.

The dominatrix is a female archetype which operates on a symbolic mode of representation, associated with particular attire and props that are drawn on within popular culture to signify her role—as a strong, dominant, sexualised woman—linked to but distinct from images of sexual fetish.

description: An [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eating_disorder]eating disorder[/url] is a mental disorder defined by abnormal eating habits that negatively affect a person's physical or mental health.\n\nThey include binge eating disorder where people eat a large amount in a short period of time, anorexia nervosa where people eat very little and thus have a low body weight, bulimia nervosa where people eat a lot and then try to rid themselves of the food, pica where people eat non-food items, rumination disorder where people regurgitate food, avoidant/restrictive food intake disorder where people have a lack of interest in food [...]. These disorders do not include obesity.

This character loses their job.\n\n[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Termination_of_employment]Termination of employment[/url], is an employee's departure from a job and the end of an employee's duration with an employer. Termination may be voluntary on the employee's part, or it may be at the hands of the employer, often in the form of dismissal (firing) or a layoff. Dismissal or firing is generally thought to be the fault of the employee, whereas a layoff is generally done for business reasons (for instance a business slowdown or an economic downturn) outside the employee's performance.
[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marine_mammal]Marine mammals[/url] are aquatic mammals that rely on the ocean and other marine ecosystems for their existence.

This character [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weight_loss]loses weight[/url].

Weight loss can occur if the character controls their food dietary habits to prevent them from gaining calories. Weight loss can also occur if the character exercises frequently to improve fitness to expend more energy into their work and metabolism to incur weight loss.

Sometimes, weight loss may occur unintentionally from a health-related sickness.

The character have a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_dysfunction]sexual dysfunction[/url]. It can be temporary or permanent, occur before or during the events of the game.

May be used for various problems related to sexual activity whether they are positive (such as an erection that doesn't stop at all), negative (such as an erection disorder) or not very important (as the premature ejaculation that doesn't prevent to procreate).

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minotaur]minotaur[/url]. A minotaur is a mythical creature portrayed in Greek Classical times with the head and tail of a bull and the body of a man.

According to the [url=http://mgewiki.com/w/Minotaur]monster girl wiki[/url], a minotaur is a beastman type monster with the characteristics of an ox. This character wears clothing with small pieces of fabric sewn together. In other words: A patched-up clothing.

Either distinctively sewn messy, clothing that seems to show visible sewn threading combining pieces of fabric are patchwork.

Formal patchwork clothing also exist, often carefully sewn in patterns.

In terms of the actual sewing technique:
[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patchwork]Patchwork[/url] or "pieced work" is a form of needlework that involves sewing together pieces of fabric into a larger design. The larger design is usually based on repeating patterns built up with different fabric shapes (which can be different colors). These shapes are carefully measured and cut, basic geometric shapes making them easy to piece together.

A [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magazine]magazine[/url] is a publication, usually a periodical publication, which is printed or electronically published (sometimes referred to as an online magazine). Magazines are generally published on a regular schedule and contain a variety of content. They are generally financed by advertising, by a purchase price, by prepaid subscriptions, or a combination of the three.

This character performs [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seppuku]seppuku[/url].

Seppuku is a form of Japanese ritual suicide by disembowelment. It was originally reserved for samurai, but was also practiced by other Japanese people later on to restore honor for themselves or for their family. A samurai practice, seppuku was used either voluntarily by samurai to die with honor rather than fall into the hands of their enemies (and likely suffer torture) or as a form of capital punishment for samurai who had committed serious offenses, or performed because they had brought shame to themselves. 

The proper method for committing the act—developed over several centuries—was to plunge a short sword into the left side of the abdomen, draw the blade laterally across to the right, and then turn it upward.
This character has an unconventional amount of more than two arms.\n\nPlease only use [url=https://vndb.org/i2263]i2263[/url] if the character has exactly four arms.

This character commits [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide]suicide[/url], but it is possible to avoid this outcome by satisfying some game conditions or make choices leading otherwise.

[Url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knitting]Knitting[/url] is a method by which yarn is manipulated to create a textile or fabric for use in many types of garments.\n\nKnitting creates multiple loops of yarn, called stitches, in a line or tube. Knitting has multiple active stitches on the needle at one time. Knitted fabric consists of a number of consecutive rows of intermeshing of loops. As each row progresses, a newly created loop is pulled through one or more loops from the prior row, placed on the gaining needle, and the loops from the prior row are then pulled off the other needle.

This character is morally strong enough not to be persuaded to do anything wrong: his way of thinking will not deteriorate and will not be destroyed by anyone, no matter how difficult his experiences.\n\nThis trait can be used (for example) for a character who can not be corrupted by money or for a character who is violated (by proxy or otherwise) by others but who would remain "loyal" to his lover and do not succumb to pleasures given of his rapist.

This character plays or engages in [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golf]golf[/url].\n\nGolf is a club-and-ball sport in which players use various clubs to hit balls into a series of holes on a course in as few strokes as possible.

This character engages in [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boating]boating[/url]. Boating is the leisurely activity of travelling, recreational, or sporting use of a boat.\n\nSailing and yachting is the racing of boats.

Acne is a skin condition prevalent in pubescent teenagers that occurs when hair follicles are clogged with dead skin cells and oil from the skin. It is characterized by blackheads or whiteheads, pimples, oily skin, and possible scarring.

description: The character is afraid of a long-term commitment to someone, saying otherwise, they are afraid of love. It's not a mental illness and can take different forms, depending on the person.\n\nThis fear is usually expressed by the rejection of those declaring their love or wanting to take the relationship to the next level (like marriage), possibly rethinking their actions later, when the fear has diminished.

[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_abstinence]Sexual abstinence[/url] or sexual restraint is the practice of refraining from some or all aspects of sexual activity for medical, psychological, legal, social, financial, philosophical, moral, or religious reasons.

Use the trait both for voluntary and forced abstinence, where it is clearly expressed that the character is refraining from sexual intercourse due to his own wish or due to being forced by another character.

In order to prevent misapplication, don't apply the trait to virginal characters, unless they clearly express that they do not intend to have sex until marriage, or something similar.

A suppository is a cone or cylinder shaped drug that is inserted into the body through the rectum, vagina, or urethra where it then releases its medication. Rectal suppositories are the most common type of suppository.

The character models for erotic/nude photos.

[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erotic_photography]Erotic photography[/url] is a style of art photography of an erotic, sexually suggestive or sexually provocative nature. Though the subjects of erotic photography are usually completely or mostly unclothed, that is not a requirement. 

Erotic photographs are normally intended for commercial use, including mass-produced items such as decorative calendars, pinups and for men's magazines but sometimes the photographs are intended to be seen only by the subject's partner.

Do not confuse with [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pornography]pornographic photography[/url], which is of a sexually explicit nature (preferably use traits related to porn production in that case).

This character is a member of a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennis]tennis club[/url] associated with a school.\n\nA school sports club is a administration-approved student-based school organization focusing on a selected sport. Tennis is a racket sport that can be played individually against a single opponent (singles) or between two teams of two players each (doubles). Each player uses a tennis racket that is strung with cord to strike a hollow rubber ball covered with felt over or around a net and into the opponent's court.

This character is the leader of a student club.\n\nA school [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennis]tennis club[/url] president leads the members of the student club in day to day training and prepares them for competitions.

A school NT club is a administration-approved student-based school organization focusing on discovery and usage of new technologies such as [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smartphone]smartphones[/url] or [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tablet_computer]tablets[/url] and optionally [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer]computers[/url].

Not to be confused with the [url=https://vndb.org/i1438]School Computer Club[/url] that is only interested in computers.
This character is the leader of a school NT club.\n\nA school NT club president leads the members of the student club in day to day activities and optionally prepares them for competitions.

This character engages in tickling torture. Apply [url=https://vndb.org/i2366]i2366[/url] to the receiving victim.

Tickle torture is the use of tickling to abuse, dominate, humiliate or even "prank" someone. The victim laughs even if he or she finds the experience unpleasant because the laughter is an innate reflex rather than social conditioning. Tickle torture can either be consensual or forced, depending on the circumstances. 

If tickle torture is consensual, it is usually done as a part of some sort of sexual ritual or another mode of affection. Forced tickle torture can either be used for mild interrogation purposes or simply for a harmless method of dominating someone.

If the capelet garment length reach below hip length, use i860 instead.

This character is a high-class prostitute.

This can take many forms: working as a host or hostess for a high-class club and providing sexual services aside of other things, being an escort (providing sexual services) for rich businessmen, being a paid mistress of a high-class client, a personal entertainer of sorts (eg. geisha) offering sexual services aside of other forms of entertainment and so on. Instead, they are sought after for their services by the elite of society who are willing to pay fortunes for a night spent with them. This character is the leader of a soccer club associated with a school.

A [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mummy]mummy[/url] is a deceased human or an animal whose skin and organs have been preserved by either intentional or accidental exposure to chemicals, extreme cold, very low humidity, or lack of air, so that the recovered body does not decay further if kept in cool and dry conditions.

Traditionally fictional mummies are considered a type of undead that have lived in distant times and belong to ancient and extinct cultures. 

Mummies are commonly associated with the culture of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Egypt]ancient Egypt[/url] or [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pre-Columbian_era]pre-Columbian[/url] civilizations.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rokurokubi]Rokurokubi[/url].\n\nThis youkai is a Japanese Monster that are often depicted as ordinary women by day, but at night their necks elongate. (Nukekubi is a variation of the youkai where their head completely detaches).

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baku_(mythology)]baku[/url].\n\nThis youkai is a Japanese monster that has a similar appearance to a tapir. They watch over humans and act as a guardian spirits. They feed on the dreams of humans – specifically bad dreams. Evil spirits and yokai fear baku and flee from them, avoiding areas inhabited by them. Therefore, health and good luck follow a baku wherever it goes.
This character behaves in a primitive way, acting instinctively, and can even be described as a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Primitive_culture]savage[/url].

The [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stole_(vestment)]stole[/url] is a liturgical vestment of various Christian denominations. It consists of a band of colored cloth, formerly usually of silk, about seven and a half to nine feet long and three to four inches wide, whose ends may be straight or may broaden out. The center of the stole is worn around the back of the neck and the two ends hang down parallel to each other in front, either attached to each other or hanging loose. The stole is almost always decorated in some way, usually with a cross or some other significant religious design.

This character overuses or overemphasizes the word "nano" at the end of their sentences.

Sometimes appended with "desu" at the end.

"Nano" or "no" at the end of a sentence is the formal equivalent (and somewhat feminine) to putting "~n desu/da" pattern. In simple terms, "nano" is used to place emphasis on what the speaker is saying.

In friction, immature / childish characters are prone to this pattern.

trait_alias:
Mai
Odori
Asobi
Kabuki
Noh Mai
Nihon Buyō
Folk dances
Bon Odori
Jinta mai
歌舞伎
舞踊
description: Japanese traditional dance has a long history, the oldest known ones may be among those transmitted through the kagura tradition, or folk dances. There are large number of these traditional dances, which are often -odori, -asobi, and -mai, and may be specific to a region or village. Mai and Odori are the two main groups of Japanese dances, and the term Buyō was coined in modern times as a general term for dance.

This character has [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allergy]allergies[/url].

Allergies are a number of conditions caused by hypersensitivity of the immune system to typically harmless substances in the environment.

These common diseases include hay fever, food allergies, atopic dermatitis, allergic asthma, and anaphylaxis. Symptoms may include red eyes, an itchy rash, sneezing, a runny nose, shortness of breath, or swelling. Food intolerances and food poisoning are separate conditions.

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romance_(love)]romantic[/url].\n\nA romantic is inclined toward or suggestive of the feeling of excitement and mystery associated with love, and/or of an idealized view of reality when it comes to romance. They value their emotions greatly, and like the subtler aspects of romance, as well as most romance-themed situations, like confessions or happy couples. They appreciate gestures that are romantically pronounced, like offering flowers, and are fans of environments that contribute to a romantic mood, like a full moon. The person may be a romantic due to a traditional upbringing, or a naive ignorance of love, sometimes influenced by fiction.

This character observes and analyzes people they meet.

They usually do so to better understand them, judge their characters, or uncover their intentions, reactions or habits. Unlike pure curiosity, the intentions of such a person may be either good, bad, or neutral, are often backed by an ulterior motive, and are usually limited to certain people or environments.

Can also be applied to characters who observe and pay attention to their surroundings, sometimes even quickly noticing changes in people, environments, or even moods/atmospheres, but without reaching the knowledge or sharpness of being insightful.

Anthropomorphic Animal - a bipedal hybrid of an animal in a humanoid form. For a character to be considered anthropomorphic animal, either human and animal traits should be pronounced in about equal measure, or the latter should be dominant.

Do not use the trait to describe characters that look mostly human, but have minor animal characteristics, like animal ears (use [url=/i677]Kemonomimi[/url] instead) or a tail (use [url=/i561]Tail[/url]).

Only use the trait to describe the characters, for whom the anthropomorphic form is the primary one. Do not use it for shapeshifters, who can turn into an alternative animalistic form (e.g. a werewolf).

This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cousin]cousin[/url] but who does not share kinship ties, either because of an [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adoption]adoption[/url] or by [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remarriage]remarriage[/url].

This character is a part of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuri_(genre)]yuri fandom[/url]. Yuri fandom refers to people with obsessive interest in anime, manga and novels that feature romantic relationships between girls (is sometimes called shōjo-ai by Western fandom).

A [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poncho]poncho[/url] is an outer garment designed to keep the body warm. A rain poncho is made from a watertight material designed to keep the body dry from the rain. A gang bang or gangbang is a situation in which several people engage in physical sexual activity with one particular individual sequentially or at the same time. Normally, there is a single individual who is the central focus of the sexual activity; for example, one man or woman surrounded by several men or women.
Rather than serial couplings by two people, the gang bang is defined by the number and simultaneity of the various sex acts, such as vaginal, anal or oral sex or double penetration.

Gang bangs are not defined by the precise number of participants, but usually involve more than three people and may involve a dozen or more.

Gang bangs also differ from group sex, such as threesomes and foursomes, in that most (if not all) sexual acts during a gang bang are centered on or performed with just the central person.

https://s2.vndb.org/sf/39/72939.jpg

A character with this trait possesses one of the variations of the [url=https://tanuki-kimono.tumblr.com/post/134047853321/nihongami-japanese-hairstyles-part-312]Hyogo[/url] hairstyle.

Tate Hyogo is said to have been worn by female kabuki dancers. But it’s mostly associated with middle rank Yuujo (prostitutes). Upper rank prostitutes never wore this style.
Yoko Hyogo was worn by high rank Yuujo in Yoshiwara and Shimabara from mid Edo era. It was a of variation Tate Hyogo with bigger chignons. Each red light districts had its own way of setting the many decorative pins and haircombs.
Date Hyogo was only worn by Oiran (top rank Yuujo). With its big chignons and lavishly decorated ornaments, from pins to combs and golden ropes, this hairstyle was the most gorgeous of all.

description:
This character wears torn or ripped pantyhose by design, having usually multiple cuts/rips on the legs made on puropose or fabricated like that for fashion reasons.
A common use case can be torn pantyhose of a punk character.

In case pantyhose gets damaged or torn during a fight, a sexual scene or anything else that it's not made on purpose just use: [url=https://vndb.org/i1555]Torn Pantyhose[/url].
In case of crotchless pantyhose just use the appropriate trait: [url=https://vndb.org/i2061]Crotchless Pantyhose[/url]

[url=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/64/129564.jpg]Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/65/129565.jpg]Example 2[/url]

This character wears a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sailor_suit]sailor suit[/url].

A sailor suit is a uniform traditionally worn by enlisted seamen in the navy, and other government funded sea services. It later developed into a popular clothing style for children.

Since some kind of Japanese school uniforms are in the style of sailor suits just use: [url=https://vndb.org/i1723]Sailor School Uniform[/url]

This character is seen in [url=https://www.per-spex.com/articles/fashion-history/2019/2/16/sukeban-the-forgotten-story-of-japans-girl-gangs]Sukeban[/url] fashion. [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sukeban]Wikipedia[/url]

The sukeban was a truly unique subculture in Japanese society. The term 'sukeban' was created by Japanese police to categorise and explain the rise of teenage all-female street gangs in the 1960s. Meaning 'delinquent girl' or 'girl boss', the sukeban were groups of teenage girls that protested against society with their altered fashion, radical solidarity and being involved in offences such as, violence, theft and drug use. They protested against mainstream gender norms and feminine expectations in a male-dominated society. The idea of a woman 'behaving badly' went against the gender norms of how a woman is supposed to act, and provided a thrilling way to challenge society. In addition, the expectations of how a woman dressed were restricting and sexist, and the sukeban weren't going to accept this anymore and that's why they altered their look.
The common signifiers of sukeban fashion include:
 - long skirt opposed to mini-skirt 
 - blouses were cut short to expose the waist
 - brightly dyed or permed hair 
 - school shoes were replaced with Converse sneakers
 - wearing coloured socks
 - rolled up sleeves
 - weapons like chains, baseball bat or katana 

[url=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/69/129569.jpg]Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/68/129568.jpg]Example 2[/url]
[url=https://vndb.org/c20349]Example 3[/url]
[url=https://vndb.org/c30794]Example 4[/url]

The [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_school_uniform#Gakuran]gakuran[/url] and the tsume-eri are the uniforms for many middle-school and high-school boys in Japan. The color is normally black, but some schools use navy blue.

The top has a standing collar buttoning down from top-to-bottom. Buttons are usually decorated with the school emblem to show respect to the school. Pants are straight leg and a black or dark-colored belt is worn with them. Boys usually wear penny loafers or sneakers with this uniform. Some schools may require the students to wear collar-pins representing the school and/or class rank. 

[url=https://s2.vndb.org/sf/44/129644.jpg]Example 1[/url]

A [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waist_cincher]waist cincher[/url] (sometimes referred to as a waspie) is a belt worn around the waist to make the wearer's waist physically smaller, or to create the illusion of being smaller. 
It can also be used over clothing for decorative purpose.

This character is subjected to an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exorcism]exorcism[/url].\n\nExorcism is the religious practice of evicting demons or other spiritual entities from a person or an area which they are believed to have possessed. Depending on the spiritual beliefs of the exorcist, this may be done by causing the entity to swear an oath, performing an elaborate ritual, or simply by commanding it to depart in the name of a higher power. The practice is ancient and part of the belief system of many cultures and religions.

This character has [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cornrows]cornrows[/url] hairstyle.

Cornrows, also called canerows in the Caribbean, are a style of hair braiding, in which the hair is braided very close to the scalp, using an underhand, upward motion to make a continuous, raised row.
Cornrows are often formed in simple, straight lines, as the name implies, but they can also be formed in elaborate geometric or curvilinear designs.

Brazilians are predominantly Roman Catholic. Brazil is a multiethnic society, which means that it is home to people of many different ethnic origins. As a result, majority of Brazilians do not equate their nationality with their ethnicity, usually embracing and espousing both simultaneously.

Unapplicable category to collect characters that wear a traditional japanese coat.

This character wears a [url=https://wiki.samurai-archives.com/index.php?title=Jinbaori]jinbaori[/url].

Jinbaori (literally "military camp haori") are a style of surcoat typically worn over armor.

Originally a rather simple jacket worn over armor as a protection against the weather, jinbaori evolved over the course of the Sengoku period into far more elaborate garments, decorated with various motifs as an expression of the wearer's wealth, power, and aesthetic taste.
